original: 'bras la sogs pa rngo btag ma byas pa mnos te za ba la yang ltung ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras la sogs pa rngo btag ma byas pa mnos te za ba la yang ltung ba med pa ste /
translated: There is also no offense if one eats uncooked grain, such as rice, that has not been threshed.

original: de la skabs 'di'i nyes pa med pa las dgongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la skabs 'di'i nyes pa med pa las dgongs pa yin gyi /
translated: The point of this exception in this context is

original: 'bru tsam pa len pa'i nyes byas gzhan ni yod do //
analyzed: 'bru tsam pa len pa'i nyes byas gzhan ni yod do //
translated: that there is another offense, a minor offense, for taking just a grain.

original: blang bar bya ba gal te mang ba nyid na dge slong dag la bgo bsha' bya'o zhes bya ba la /🔽blang bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blang bar bya ba gal te mang ba nyid na dge slong dag la bgo bsha' bya'o zhes bya ba la / blang bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If what is to be accepted is indeed a large amount, it should be shared with the monks.🔽What is to be accepted is

original: blang bar 'os pa ste /
analyzed: blang bar 'os pa ste /
translated: what is worthy of being accepted.

original: 'bras thug po che'am ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung phyed dang lnga btsos pa de'i rkyen gyi tshod ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras thug po che'am ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung phyed dang lnga btsos pa de'i rkyen gyi tshod ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is a large amount of rice or half a Magadha measure of rice, together with the vegetables that are the conditions for that.

original: gal te mang ba nyid na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te mang ba nyid na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is indeed a large amount means

original: mang ba'i dngos po ni mang pa nyid de blang bar bya ba de gal te rang bza' ba las lhag cing mang ba nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: mang ba'i dngos po ni mang pa nyid de blang bar bya ba de gal te rang bza' ba las lhag cing mang ba nyid yin na'o //
translated: that if what is to be accepted is indeed a large amount, it is more than what one should eat.🔽It should be shared with the monks means

original: dge slong dag la bgo bsha' bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong dag la bgo bsha' bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: that

original: de ltar mang ba dag yin na de'i tshe dge slong dag la yang bgo bsha' bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar mang ba dag yin na de'i tshe dge slong dag la yang bgo bsha' bya ba'o //
translated: If there is a great deal, then it should be shared with the monks.

original: de lta bas na mang ba nyid ces smos pa ni rang bza' ba las lhag na gdon mi za bar bza' bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i @304b phyir ro /
analyzed: de lta bas na mang ba nyid ces smos pa ni rang bza' ba las lhag na gdon mi za bar bza' bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i @304b phyir ro /
translated: Thus, the term “great deal” is stated in order to teach that if there is more than one’s own share, then one should certainly eat it.

original: gal te rang bza' ba las mi lhag na ni des gdon mi za bar dge slong dag la bgo bsha' bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te rang bza' ba las mi lhag na ni des gdon mi za bar dge slong dag la bgo bsha' bya ba ma yin no //
translated: If there is not more than one’s own share, then one should not certainly share it with the monks.

original: de'i phyir so sor thar pa'i mdo las kyang lhung bzed gang ba gnyis sam gsum blangs nas phyi rol kun dga' ra bar 'dod la dge slong 'khod pa rnams la yang bgo bsha' bya /
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor thar pa'i mdo las kyang lhung bzed gang ba gnyis sam gsum blangs nas phyi rol kun dga' ra bar 'dod la dge slong 'khod pa rnams la yang bgo bsha' bya /
translated: Therefore, the Sūtra on the Bases of Discipline also states, “Having taken two or three full alms-bowls, if you wish to go to a pleasure grove, you should share it with the monks who are there.

original: bdag kyang bza' bar bya ste zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag kyang bza' bar bya ste zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: You should also eat it yourself.

original: gal te blang bar bya ba de las lhag par yod na zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te blang bar bya ba de las lhag par yod na zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma yin no //
translated: If there is more than that which should be taken, this is the remainder of the words.”

original: lhung bzed do gsum tsam las lhag par len pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /🔽// / spangs nas za ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: lhung bzed do gsum tsam las lhag par len pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to / // / spangs nas za ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: The second is the downfall of accepting more than three begging bowls.🔽Having eaten, one should not rise from your seat if you have not finished what was sufficient.🔽Having eaten, one should not rise from one’s seat if one has not finished what was sufficient.🔽One should not abandon one’s seat.

original: ji tsam gyis chog pa bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽ji tsam gyis bkres pa'i sdug bsngal dang bral bar gyur pa de tsam bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis chog pa bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te / ji tsam gyis bkres pa'i sdug bsngal dang bral bar gyur pa de tsam bza' bar bya'o //
translated: If one has begun to eat, one should not rise from one’s seat until one has finished what was sufficient.

original: zas brtsams pas ldang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zas brtsams pas ldang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not abandon one’s seat.

original: dge slong zas bza' bar brtsams pas ji srid du chog par ma zos pa de srid du ldang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong zas bza' bar brtsams pas ji srid du chog par ma zos pa de srid du ldang bar mi bya ste /
translated: If one has not begun to eat, one should not rise from one’s seat until one has finished what was sufficient.

original: stan spang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽gzhan du bza' bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni byin len byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: stan spang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gzhan du bza' bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni byin len byed pa yin gyi /
translated: One should not abandon one’s seat.🔽If one has begun to eat, one should not rise from one’s seat until one has finished what was sufficient.

original: zas brtsams pa nyid ni ma yin te /🔽brtsams pa zhes smos pa'i phyir dang 'og nas kyang gnas btang ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zas brtsams pa nyid ni ma yin te /🔽brtsams pa zhes smos pa'i phyir dang 'og nas kyang gnas btang ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One should not abandon one’s seat.

original: de lta bas na bza' ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma smos kyang grub pas logs shig tu bya mi dgos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na bza' ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma smos kyang grub pas logs shig tu bya mi dgos so //
translated: Therefore, even though it is established without being mentioned, it is not necessary to state it separately.

original: da ni zas brtsams pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni zas brtsams pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the characteristic of beginning a meal,

original: tha na lan tshva yan chad bza' bar bya ba gang yang rung ba cung zad cig blangs na rnam pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /🔽tha na lan tshva yan chad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha na lan tshva yan chad bza' bar bya ba gang yang rung ba cung zad cig blangs na rnam pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te / tha na lan tshva yan chad ces bya ba ni /
translated: he says, “If one takes up even a little of any food to eat, up to and including salt, it is just that aspect.”🔽Up to and including salt

original: chung du na lan tshva yan chad tsam yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chung du na lan tshva yan chad tsam yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means even a little bit of salt.

original: bza' bar bya ba gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Any food to eat

original: bza' ba dang bca' ba'i zas gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: bza' ba dang bca' ba'i zas gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: means any food to eat or consume.🔽A little bit

original: cung zad cig ces bya ba ni chung du zhig kyang ngo //
analyzed: cung zad cig ces bya ba ni chung du zhig kyang ngo //
translated: means even a small amount.🔽If one takes up

original: blangs na zhes bya ba ni byin len byas na'o //
analyzed: blangs na zhes bya ba ni byin len byas na'o //
translated: means if one receives it.

original: rnam pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is just that aspect

original: zas brtsams pa de nyid yin te /
analyzed: zas brtsams pa de nyid yin te /
translated: means it is just that beginning of a meal.

original: zas brtsams pa ni de nyid du bza' ba'i phyir byin len byas pa'o ;
analyzed: zas brtsams pa ni de nyid du bza' ba'i phyir byin len byas pa'o ;
translated: The food that is begun is that for which the ritual of receiving has been performed in order to eat it.

original: /'og nas shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang shes gtso bo zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i ming can du sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: /'og nas shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang shes gtso bo zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i ming can du sbyor bar byed do //
translated: The term “chief” in the verse should be applied to the term “chief perception” and the term “chief ideation” in the commentary.

original: gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir spangs pa nyid dang lhag por ma byas pa nyid la'o zhes 'byung ba de la spangs pa nyid @305a * //🔽ni gang yin /
analyzed: gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir spangs pa nyid dang lhag por ma byas pa nyid la'o zhes 'byung ba de la spangs pa nyid @305a * // ni gang yin /
translated: With regard to the question, “What is the chief perception?” the commentary states, “It is the chief agent in the abandonment and non-abandonment of a place.”🔽What is abandonment?

original: lhag por ni gang yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: lhag por ni gang yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: What is non-abandonment?

original: je spangs pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: je spangs pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach abandonment, the commentary states,

original: spangs pa'i ni gnas btang ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: spangs pa'i ni gnas btang ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “Abandonment is the relinquishing of a place.”

original: phyogs gang du 'dug par gyur pa de btang ba ni spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs gang du 'dug par gyur pa de btang ba ni spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The relinquishing of a place where one has been staying is called “abandonment.”

original: gang gis btang ba zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis btang ba zhe na /
translated: By whom is it relinquished?

original: de'i phyir 'dug pa'i 'o zhes bya ba smras ta /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dug pa'i 'o zhes bya ba smras ta /
translated: In order to teach this, the commentary states, “It is the relinquishing of a place by one who is staying there.”

original: dge slong gi'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi'o //
translated: It is the relinquishing of a place by a monk.

original: 'dug pa ji lta bu zhig gis she na de'i phyir /🔽rtsa ba la sogs pa bca' bar bya ba la sogs pa'i zas brtsams pa'i'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dug pa ji lta bu zhig gis she na de'i phyir / rtsa ba la sogs pa bca' bar bya ba la sogs pa'i zas brtsams pa'i'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What kind of one who is seated?🔽Therefore he says:🔽of one who has begun to eat food such as roots, etc.

original: gang gis rtsa ba la sogs pa bca' bar bya ba la sogs pa'i zas brtsams pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gis rtsa ba la sogs pa bca' bar bya ba la sogs pa'i zas brtsams pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: of one who has begun to eat food such as roots, etc.

original: rtsa ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma'i sgras ni sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu bca' bar gyur pa dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma'i sgras ni sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu bca' bar gyur pa dag bsdu'o //
translated: The term “etc.” in “roots, etc.” includes food such as stems, leaves, flowers, and fruits.

original: bca' ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og ma'i sgras ni 'bras chan dang / zan dron dang / sha dang snum khur dang 'dag gu bza' bar bya ba dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: bca' ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'og ma'i sgras ni 'bras chan dang / zan dron dang / sha dang snum khur dang 'dag gu bza' bar bya ba dag bsdu'o //
translated: The term “etc.” in “food such as roots, etc.” includes food such as rice, barley, meat, oil, and soup.

original: ci cung zad kyang ma byas par btang na'am zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci cung zad kyang ma byas par btang na'am zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If one gives to one who has not done even the slightest work, then what?🔽Therefore he says:

original: rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu bca' bar bya ba dag dang / thug pa las gzhan pa bza' bar bya bar rung ba dang mi rung ba dang / ma 'dres pa'i byin len stobs pa 'thob pa'i phyogs na 'greng ba byas nas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu bca' bar bya ba dag dang / thug pa las gzhan pa bza' bar bya bar rung ba dang mi rung ba dang / ma 'dres pa'i byin len stobs pa 'thob pa'i phyogs na 'greng ba byas nas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The root, trunk, leaves, flowers and fruits that are to be prepared, and the food that is suitable to be eaten, other than what is chewed, and the one who is not a defiled giver of the formal acceptance of an offering of food, who stands in the direction of the obtainment.

original: rtsa ba la sogs pa bca' bar bya ba dag las gzhan pa dang thugs pa las kyang gzhan pa bza' bar bya ba rung ba /
analyzed: rtsa ba la sogs pa bca' bar bya ba dag las gzhan pa dang thugs pa las kyang gzhan pa bza' bar bya ba rung ba /
translated: Other than the root, etc., that are to be prepared, and other than what is chewed, the food that is suitable to be eaten,

original: mi rung ba dang ma 'dres pa'i byin len stobs pa'i 'dri ma mkhan de spangs te gnas btang na spangs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi rung ba dang ma 'dres pa'i byin len stobs pa'i 'dri ma mkhan de spangs te gnas btang na spangs pa nyid yin no //
translated: and the one who is not a defiled giver of the formal acceptance of an offering of food, if he abandons that defiled giver of the formal acceptance of an offering of food, and leaves the place, then he has abandoned it.

original: byin len stobs pa'i 'dri ma mkhan khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: byin len stobs pa'i 'dri ma mkhan khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na de'i phyir /
translated: What kind of special qualities does the one who gives the formal acceptance of an offering of food have?

original: 'thob pa'i phyogs na 'greng pa zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'thob pa'i phyogs na 'greng pa zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “who stands in the direction of the obtainment.”

original: dge slong gis byin len bya ba'i phyir zas 'thob pa'i phyogs na 'greng ba de'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis byin len bya ba'i phyir zas 'thob pa'i phyogs na 'greng ba de'o //
translated: That one who stands in the direction of the obtainment of food by a fully ordained monk for the sake of the formal acceptance of an offering of food.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: bza' bar bya ba rnam pa de lta bu 'drim par byed pa'i phyag tshang byin len stobs pa de spangs bar byas nas zas brtsams pa'i 'dug pa'i gnas de nas dge slong gis gnas btang na spangs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba rnam pa de lta bu 'drim par byed pa'i phyag tshang byin len stobs pa de spangs bar byas nas zas brtsams pa'i 'dug pa'i gnas de nas dge slong gis gnas btang na spangs pa nyid yin no //
translated: If a monk, having rejected the service of a servant who brings such food, begins to eat, then he is rejected from that place of sitting.

original: rtsa ba la sogs pa btang bas ni spangs par mi 'gyur te sha kha ra la sogs pa yang de nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba la sogs pa btang bas ni spangs par mi 'gyur te sha kha ra la sogs pa yang de nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa yin no //
translated: He is not rejected by rejecting roots and so on, and sugar and so on are included in that.🔽Here the text is:

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis bza' ba lnga po dag ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i dngos po @305b dag spangs par gyur nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis bza' ba lnga po dag ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i dngos po @305b dag spangs par gyur nas /
translated: “Venerable, if a monk, having rejected things other than the five foods,

original: des slad kyi bza' ba lnga po dag 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: des slad kyi bza' ba lnga po dag 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: later eats the five foods, what is the offense?”

original: ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “There is no offense.”

original: bza' bar bya ba lnga ni 'dag gu dang sha dang 'bras chan dang zan dron dang snum khur dag ste /
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba lnga ni 'dag gu dang sha dang 'bras chan dang zan dron dang snum khur dag ste /
translated: The five foods are vegetables, meat, cooked grain, barley flour, and oil.

original: bza' bar bya ba de dag las byin len spangs na zas thams cad spangs par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba de dag las byin len spangs na zas thams cad spangs par 'gyur ro /
translated: If one rejects the ritual of receiving the food, then all food is rejected.

original: rtsa ba la sogs pa spangs pas ni bza' bar bya ba dag spangs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba la sogs pa spangs pas ni bza' bar bya ba dag spangs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if one rejects roots, etc., one does not reject food.

original: gsol cig ces bya ba yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsol cig ces bya ba yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The same is true of the word “eat.”

original: gsol cig ces smras na des kyang spangs pa yin par shes par bya'i /
analyzed: gsol cig ces smras na des kyang spangs pa yin par shes par bya'i /
translated: If one says “eat,” one should understand that all is rejected.

original: sngar bstan pa 'ba' zhig spangs par ma zad do //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa 'ba' zhig spangs par ma zad do //
translated: It is not only the previously mentioned that is rejected.

original: gsol cig ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ni kha cig tu gzhan yul la bya ba'i yul gyis 'jug pa yang yin pas /
analyzed: gsol cig ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ni kha cig tu gzhan yul la bya ba'i yul gyis 'jug pa yang yin pas /
translated: The word “eat” is sometimes used in the sense of “give to another.”

original: 'dis ni gzhan dag la byin cig ces bya bar ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan dag la byin cig ces bya bar ston to //
translated: Thus, this word “eat” indicates “give to another.”

original: gal te rang nyid mi len na'o na rang gi yul la bkag pa'i 'bras bur mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang nyid mi len na'o na rang gi yul la bkag pa'i 'bras bur mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If one does not take oneself, then is it not the case that the result of the prohibition is not in one’s own domain?

original: 'dri ma pa gang yin pa de nyi tshe rang gi yul las phyir bkag par zad kyi /
analyzed: 'dri ma pa gang yin pa de nyi tshe rang gi yul las phyir bkag par zad kyi /
translated: The one who is defiled rejects only in his own domain.

original: zan thams cad bkag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zan thams cad bkag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: He does not reject all food.

original: song shig ces bya ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /🔽sngar bstan pa 'ba' zhig gis spangs par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: song shig ces bya ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni / sngar bstan pa 'ba' zhig gis spangs par ma zad kyi /

analyzed: phyag tshad 'dri ma mkhan la mar song shig ces smras pa 'dis kyang spangs pa yin no // 'tshal lags so zhes bya bas kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong sngar tho 'tshams pa'i rtog pa can gyis byin len stobs par gyur la /
translated: Here, the text is the question: “Venerable, if a monk who previously had the thought to harm is given consecrated food,

analyzed: lhag bor zhes bya ba ni lhag mar byas shing bor ba ste /

analyzed: lhag por byed pa'i dge slong gis lhag mar ma byas shing ma bor ba ni lhag por ma byas pa ste /

analyzed: de lta @306b bas na snga ma las bzlog pa mtshams kyi nang dang 'thob pa'i phyogs dang / mdun na 'dug pa las dge slong gis lhag por bya ba 'byung ste /

analyzed: de ni re zhig phyir btang ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //

analyzed: zas rung ba ma yin pa dang / 'dres pa la ni lhag por gyi dngos po mi bya ba nyid yin no //

analyzed: dge slong gis zan za ba'i gnas ma btang ba de ni gnas ma btang ba ste /

analyzed: mi bza' bar brtag pa byas pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: mi za bar brtag pa byas pa zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: des kyang lhag por bya ba nyid yin no //

analyzed: kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mi bza' bar brtag pa ma byas pas lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya bar ston to //

analyzed: de'i phyir / gsol bas bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'tshal ma 'tshal lags shing spangs te yongs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par bgyid pa las bca' ba dang bza' ba rnyed cing 'tshal bar 'tshal na /
translated: I, the fully ordained monk named so-and-so, having eaten and refused post-midday tonics, will eat this food that I have obtained and that I have requested.

original: lhag por bgyis te ;
analyzed: lhag por bgyis te ;
translated: I will do it as leftovers.🔽Please give it to me.”

original: bdag la stsal du gsol zhes gang la gsol ba btab pa des /
analyzed: bdag la stsal du gsol zhes gang la gsol ba btab pa des /
translated: The one from whom the request is made

original: lhag por bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: lhag por bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: is to do it as leftovers.

original: lhag por byed pas lhag por bya ba ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: lhag por byed pas lhag por bya ba ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How is it to be done as leftovers by one who is doing it as leftovers?

analyzed: de'i phyir / khyod kyir gyur gyis bzhud cig ces bya ba'i tshig gis bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /

analyzed: khyod kyir gyur gyis bzhud cig ces bya ba'i tshig brjod par bya @307a * //

analyzed: ba'o ; / kha cig ni ci bder gsol cig ces kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Some say, “Eat as much as you like.”

analyzed: slob dpon kha cig na re ci bder gsol cig ces bya ba'i tshig brjod par bya'o zhes kyang zer te /
translated: Some masters say that the words “Eat as much as you like” are spoken.

original: 'dir don gtso che ba yin gyis /
analyzed: 'dir don gtso che ba yin gyis /
translated: Here the meaning is primary,

original: tshig ni nges pa med pas /
analyzed: tshig ni nges pa med pas /

analyzed: des na lhag por bya ba'i tshig ni mdo las smos pa 'di gnyis sam /
translated: Therefore, the words for the remainder rite are either these two mentioned in the sūtra or others that are similar.

original: de dang mthun pa gzhan dag gis kyang byar rung ngo //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa gzhan dag gis kyang byar rung ngo //
translated: It is suitable to do it with any of those.

analyzed: ji tshig tsam kho nas lhag por bya bar zad dam zhe na /

original: de'i phyir / kham gnyis sam gsum zos nas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / kham gnyis sam gsum zos nas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “After eating two or three mouthfuls.”

original: je dang por kham gnyis sam gsum zos te lhag mar byas shing de'i 'og tu sngar bshad pa'i tshig brjod pas dor bar bya ste /🔽de tsam gyis na lhag mar byas pa yang yin la /
analyzed: je dang por kham gnyis sam gsum zos te lhag mar byas shing de'i 'og tu sngar bshad pa'i tshig brjod pas dor bar bya ste / de tsam gyis na lhag mar byas pa yang yin la /
translated: Then, one should discard the remainder by reciting the above verse.

original: bor ba yang yin pas lhag bor byas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bor ba yang yin pas lhag bor byas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one has both left the remainder and discarded it, it is called “the remainder that is discarded.”

original: ci gang gis mi bza' bar brtag pa byas pas lhag por byed na des kyang kham gnyis sam gsum zos nas bya 'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci gang gis mi bza' bar brtag pa byas pas lhag por byed na des kyang kham gnyis sam gsum zos nas bya 'am zhe na /
translated: If one has determined not to eat, should one still eat two or three morsels and then discard them?

original: de'i phyir bya ba btang bas ni bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bya ba btang bas ni bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “One should not eat by giving up the action.”

original: gang gis zas kyi bya ba spang ba de ni bya ba btang ba ste /
analyzed: gang gis zas kyi bya ba spang ba de ni bya ba btang ba ste /
translated: One who has given up the action of eating is one who has given up the action.

analyzed: des ni bza' bar mi bya bar khyod kyir gyur gyis bzhud cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gang yang rung bas lhag por bya'o //
translated: One should discard the remainder by saying any of the following phrases: “I have finished eating,” “I have had enough,” “I am satisfied,” “I am full,” “I am content,” “I am finished,” “I am done,” “I am complete,” “I am complete and finished,” “I am complete and done,” “I am complete, finished, and done,” “I am satisfied and finished,” “I am satisfied and done,” “I am satisfied, finished, and done,” “I am content and finished,” “I am content and done,” “I am content, finished, and done.”

original: lhag por byas pa gzhan gyis bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhag por byas pa gzhan gyis bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The remainder should be eaten by another” means

analyzed: lhag por byas pa'i zas dge slong gcig gis mnos pa de dge slong gzhan dag gis kyang ba zar rung ngo //
translated: The food that is left over is to be eaten by another bhikṣu who has accepted it.

analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gcig la rung ba gang yin pa de gzhan la yang rung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text here says that what is suitable for one bhikṣu is suitable for another.

original: shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The mind is the chief factor.

original: 'dir yang shes gtso zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shas gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i ming can du sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dir yang shes gtso zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shas gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i ming can du sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Here, the term “chief factor” is applied to the mind, and the term “predominant factor” is applied to perception.

original: gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / spangs pa nyid dang lhag por ma byas pa nyid dag la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / spangs pa nyid dang lhag por ma byas pa nyid dag la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What is the mind’s predominance in the abandonment of food?🔽What is the predominance of perception in the non-abandonment of food?🔽The mind is the chief factor in the abandonment of food.🔽The mind is the chief factor in the non-abandonment of food.

original: bdag nyid kyis spangs pa nyid gang yin pa dang / bza' bar bya ba gzhan gyis lhag por ma byas pa nyid gang yin pa de la dge slong gis kyang de ltar shes par gyur na yul de la de'i 'du shes de gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis spangs pa nyid gang yin pa dang / bza' bar bya ba gzhan gyis lhag por ma byas pa nyid gang yin pa de la dge slong gis kyang de ltar shes par gyur na yul de la de'i 'du shes de gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin te /
translated: If a monk knows that he himself has abandoned it and that the food has not been made leftover by another, then he is the primary agent of the perception of that object.

original: gal te bdag nyid kyis kyang spangs pa nyid yin la bza' bar bya ba de yang lhag por ma byas pa nyid yin par shes na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid kyis kyang spangs pa nyid yin la bza' bar bya ba de yang lhag por ma byas pa nyid yin par shes na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: If he knows that he himself has abandoned it and that the food has not been made leftover by another, this is the meaning.

original: ji zhig @307b rjes su bsgrub na de byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji zhig @307b rjes su bsgrub na de byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If he is the agent of that, what is accomplished?

original: de'i phyir zos na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zos na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore he says, “if he eats it.”

original: mgul du mid par gyur na'o //
analyzed: mgul du mid par gyur na'o //
translated: If he swallows it.

original: ji zhig zos na zhe na /🔽de'i phyir zas tsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji zhig zos na zhe na / de'i phyir zas tsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If he eats what?🔽Therefore he says, “just the food.”

original: bca' bar bya ba tsam yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bca' bar bya ba tsam yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just the morsel. This is the meaning.

original: zas tsam mo zhes bya ba smos pas sha kha ral sogs pa dag la thar bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zas tsam mo zhes bya ba smos pas sha kha ral sogs pa dag la thar bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The expression just food does not allow liberation for those who eat meat, etc.

original: spyir btang ba dang dmigs kyis bsal ba'i tshul gyis dus ma yin par za ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: spyir btang ba dang dmigs kyis bsal ba'i tshul gyis dus ma yin par za ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the case of eating at improper times, etc., which are allowed in general but are prohibited in specific cases.

original: 'dir stan gcig pa'i zas dang por bcas pas de'i phyir de dag thams cad ni de'i rnam par nges pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir stan gcig pa'i zas dang por bcas pas de'i phyir de dag thams cad ni de'i rnam par nges pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the first food of those who sit on one seat is restricted, and therefore all of them should be understood as determined by that restriction.

original: stan gcig pa'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par blangs pa'i dge slong gis ni spangs pa nyid yin yang rung spangs pa nyid ma yin yang rung ste /🔽zos zin phan chad lhag por byas kyang rung /
analyzed: stan gcig pa'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par blangs pa'i dge slong gis ni spangs pa nyid yin yang rung spangs pa nyid ma yin yang rung ste / zos zin phan chad lhag por byas kyang rung /
translated: A bhikṣu who has taken up the ascetic practices of one who sits on one seat should not eat any food that is set out as leftovers, whether it is the leftovers of another or not.

original: lhag por ma byas kyang rung ba'i bca' bar bya ba dang / bza' bar bya ba dag bza' bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: lhag por ma byas kyang rung ba'i bca' bar bya ba dang / bza' bar bya ba dag bza' bar mi bya ste /
translated: He should not eat any food that is set out as leftovers after he has finished eating, whether it is the leftovers of another or not.

original: zos na yi dam ral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zos na yi dam ral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he eats it, he commits an offense of wrongdoing.

original: dam bcas pa'i skyon de ni dge slong phal pa dag las gzhan ba sbyangs pa'i yon tan can dag gi bye brag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i skyon de ni dge slong phal pa dag las gzhan ba sbyangs pa'i yon tan can dag gi bye brag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This fault of the vow should be known as the distinction of those who have the qualities of training from ordinary monks.

original: stan gcig pa'i zas kyi ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /🔽// / spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed smras bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: stan gcig pa'i zas kyi ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to / // / spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed smras bar 'dod nas /
translated: The offense of eating the food of one who has been invited is explained.

original: stobs na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: stobs na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If one says, If you are able,

original: 'dir yang shes gtso bo spangs pa nyid dang / lhag por ma byas pa nyid dag la'o zhes sngar bstan pa'i yan lag de dag khas blangs nas 'di skad brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang shes gtso bo spangs pa nyid dang / lhag por ma byas pa nyid dag la'o zhes sngar bstan pa'i yan lag de dag khas blangs nas 'di skad brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here also, the main thing to be known is the abandonment itself and the non-excessive nature, and having accepted those previously explained branches, it should be said like this:

original: zos shing spangs pa de la zas tsam stobs na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zos shing spangs pa de la zas tsam stobs na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats and abandons, and if one only forces the food, this offense occurs.

original: gang la stobs na zhe na /
analyzed: gang la stobs na zhe na /
translated: If one asks, To whom is it forced?

original: de'i phyir / dge slong la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dge slong la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, To a monk.

original: rung ba'i dngos po dge slong la stobs na'o //
analyzed: rung ba'i dngos po dge slong la stobs na'o //
translated: If one forces a suitable thing to a monk.

original: rung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po dge slong la stobs pa thams cad la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po dge slong la stobs pa thams cad la ni nyes byas so //
translated: In all cases of giving to a monk something that is not suitable, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The offense entailing confession for giving up one’s commitment has already been explained.

original: // /'dus shing za ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /🔽shes gtso bo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: // /'dus shing za ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas / shes gtso bo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The offense entailing confession for eating in a group🔽is stated in the line, “If one wishes to speak…”

original: 'dir yang shes gtso bo zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i ming can du sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dir yang shes gtso bo zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i ming can du sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Here, the term “chief in understanding” is used in the sense of “chief in perception.”

original: gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / so sor nges pa'i zas kyi gnas can dag las gzhan pa'i dge slong dge 'dun du gyur pa @308a * //
analyzed: gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na / de'i phyir / so sor nges pa'i zas kyi gnas can dag las gzhan pa'i dge slong dge 'dun du gyur pa @308a * //
translated: In what sense is one “chief in perception”?🔽The text states, “In relation to those who are not fellow diners, but who are members of the Sangha,

original: mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa dag gis zan lhan cig ma yin pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa dag gis zan lhan cig ma yin pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: and who are staying within the same boundary.”

original: gnas gang na zas tha dad pa nyid du nges pa de ni so sor nges pa'i zas so //
analyzed: gnas gang na zas tha dad pa nyid du nges pa de ni so sor nges pa'i zas so //
translated: “Food that is determined individually” means that the food is determined to be different for each person.

original: dge slong gang dag la gnas de yod pa dag ni so sor nges pa'i zas kyi gnas can dag go //
analyzed: dge slong gang dag la gnas de yod pa dag ni so sor nges pa'i zas kyi gnas can dag go //
translated: Those monks who have that place are those who have a place for certain food.

original: dge slong de dag las gzhan pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun du gyur pa bzhi yan chad mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa dag gi zan lhan cig 'dus shing za ba lhan cig ma yin pa nyid kyi yul de la de ltar shes pa'i 'du shes gang yin🔽pa de gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: dge slong de dag las gzhan pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun du gyur pa bzhi yan chad mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa dag gi zan lhan cig 'dus shing za ba lhan cig ma yin pa nyid kyi yul de la de ltar shes pa'i 'du shes gang yin pa de gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The assembly of monks other than those monks, four or more, who are within the boundary, is the assembly of monks who eat together, not separately. The perception of that place is the dominant condition.

original: tshogs dang dge 'dun logs shig tu 'dus shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang don 'di nyid yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs dang dge 'dun logs shig tu 'dus shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang don 'di nyid yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the other passages, such as “the assembly and the saṅgha gather separately,” should be understood in the same way.

original: ci dge slong gcig pu zhig gi zan lhan cig ma yin pa nyid la yang ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci dge slong gcig pu zhig gi zan lhan cig ma yin pa nyid la yang ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Does this downfall apply to the food of a single monk that is not eaten together?

original: de'i phyir / lhan cig pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / lhan cig pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “together.”

original: gcig pu'i ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig pu'i ma yin no //
translated: It does not apply to a single monk.

original: rnam pa gang dang lhan cig pa'i zhe na ;
analyzed: rnam pa gang dang lhan cig pa'i zhe na ;
translated: With what kind of group is it together?

original: de'i phyir / cig car za ba dang po zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / cig car za ba dang po zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “Simultaneous eating is the first.”

original: dus gcig tu za ba dang lhan cig pa yin gyi rim gyis za ba dang lhan cig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dus gcig tu za ba dang lhan cig pa yin gyi rim gyis za ba dang lhan cig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is simultaneous with eating at one time, not simultaneous with eating in stages.

original: mgo mnyam du za ba dang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mgo mnyam du za ba dang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is eating at the same time, it is said.

original: su dang lhan cig pa'i zhe na /
analyzed: su dang lhan cig pa'i zhe na /
translated: With whom is it simultaneous?

original: de'i phyir / gsum la sogs pa dang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gsum la sogs pa dang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “With three or more.”

original: gsum mam bzhi la sogs pa'i tshogs dang ngo //
analyzed: gsum mam bzhi la sogs pa'i tshogs dang ngo //
translated: It is with a group of three, four, or more.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bzhi po dag las gcig zhal ta byed cing gsum za ba la ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bzhi po dag las gcig zhal ta byed cing gsum za ba la ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says: “There is no offense if one of the four is the manager and three eat.”

original: gsum la sogs pa dang ngo zhes smras na ji bsnyen par rdzogs pa'am 'on te bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'am /
analyzed: gsum la sogs pa dang ngo zhes smras na ji bsnyen par rdzogs pa'am 'on te bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'am /
translated: If it is said: “With three or more,” are they fully ordained or not fully ordained?

original: gang gis gsum la sogs pa dang zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis gsum la sogs pa dang zhe na /
translated: By whom is it said: “With three or more”?

original: de'i phyir / dge slong rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dge slong rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “Of the monks.”

original: dge slong zhes smos pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa rnams kyi yin par shes par bya'o /
analyzed: dge slong zhes smos pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa rnams kyi yin par shes par bya'o /
translated: The term “monk” indicates that this is for fully ordained monks.🔽Here the treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: 'dir gzhung ni ltung ba bstan pa las gsum bsnyen par rdzogs pa yin la gcig bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa yin na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ltung ba bstan pa las gsum bsnyen par rdzogs pa yin la gcig bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa yin na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If three are fully ordained and one is not, then there is no offense.

original: ci dus la lhan cig bab pa thams cad la yang yin nam zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / dge slong rnam pa ji lta bus gos med pa'i zas gnyis pa rnyed pa byed pa po nyid yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ci dus la lhan cig bab pa thams cad la yang yin nam zhe na / de'i phyir / dge slong rnam pa ji lta bus gos med pa'i zas gnyis pa rnyed pa byed pa po nyid yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Does this apply to all who gather at the same time?🔽Therefore it says:🔽Just as a monk who is not fully ordained obtains the second meal that is not left over.

original: ji ltar dge slong dus la ma bab pas gos @308b med pa'i zas gnyis pa rnyed pa yang yang za ba'i byed pa po nyid yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dge slong mi na ba dang las ma byas pa dang lam du ma zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar dge slong dus la ma bab pas gos @308b med pa'i zas gnyis pa rnyed pa yang yang za ba'i byed pa po nyid yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang dge slong mi na ba dang las ma byas pa dang lam du ma zhugs pa dang /
translated: Just as a monk who is not fully ordained obtains the second meal that is not left over and eats it, so too here a monk who is not sick, who has not worked, who has not entered the road,

original: grur ma zhugs pa dang / skam sa'i lam dang chu'i lam du dpag tshad phyed du ma song ba dag gis 'dus pa yin par rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: grur ma zhugs pa dang / skam sa'i lam dang chu'i lam du dpag tshad phyed du ma song ba dag gis 'dus pa yin par rig par bya'o ;
translated: It should be understood that the Saṅgha is split by those who have not boarded a boat, or who have not gone half a krośa on a road on land or in water.

original: / dpag tshad phyed ces gsungs pa'i gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dpag tshad phyed 'das par bgyis nas 'dus pa dang lhan cig 'tshal ma 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: / dpag tshad phyed ces gsungs pa'i gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dpag tshad phyed 'das par bgyis nas 'dus pa dang lhan cig 'tshal ma 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: The text that states “half a krośa” is the question, “Venerable, if a bhikṣu goes beyond half a krośa and eats with the Saṅgha, is there an offense?”

original: nye ba 'khor ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Upāli, there is no offense.”

original: ci dbri bkol med par zan lhan cig ma yin pa nyid thams cad la'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci dbri bkol med par zan lhan cig ma yin pa nyid thams cad la'am zhe na /
translated: Is it the case that it is not permissible to eat together in all cases where there is no invitation?

original: de'i phyir / dus ston chen po las gzhan pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dus ston chen po las gzhan pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “Except for a great festival.”

original: 'dir dus ston chen po zhes bya ba'i gzhung ni zan spags pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dus ston chen po zhes bya ba'i gzhung ni zan spags pa zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text that states “great festival” is the statement “a meal is prepared.”

original: zan spags pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zan spags pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A meal is prepared means

original: zan spags shing skyed mos tshal la sogs pa dag tu khyer ba tshoms so so tha dad par za ba ste /
analyzed: zan spags shing skyed mos tshal la sogs pa dag tu khyer ba tshoms so so tha dad par za ba ste /
translated: Eating in groups means eating in separate groups of four or more.

original: dper na dong ka'i me tog brnga ba la sogs pa'i dus ston bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na dong ka'i me tog brnga ba la sogs pa'i dus ston bzhin te /
translated: For example, it is like the festival of harvesting the dongka flower.

original: de la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense in that.

original: de las gzhan pa la ni ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa la ni ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But there is an offense in other cases.

original: zos na'o zhes 'og nas 'byung na ci dus la ma bab pa'i dge slong gis bza' bar bya ba gang yang rung ba thams cad byed pa po nyid yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: zos na'o zhes 'og nas 'byung na ci dus la ma bab pa'i dge slong gis bza' bar bya ba gang yang rung ba thams cad byed pa po nyid yin nam zhe na /
translated: If one eats, does this refer to any of the foods that are not to be eaten by a fully ordained monk who has entered the time of eating?

original: de'i phyir rtags 'di med pa'i rab tu byung ba'i zas las gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtags 'di med pa'i rab tu byung ba'i zas las gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “other than the food of a renunciate who lacks these signs.”

original: rab tu byung ba gang la rtags 'di med pa de ni rtags 'di med pa'i rab tu byung ba ste /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba gang la rtags 'di med pa de ni rtags 'di med pa'i rab tu byung ba ste /
translated: A renunciate who lacks these signs is a renunciate who lacks these signs.

original: phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: This refers to a non-Buddhist renunciate.

original: de'i zas las gzhan ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i zas las gzhan ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Other than the food of that” means

original: phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba'i zas ma gtogs pa gzhan dag gi zas te /
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba'i zas ma gtogs pa gzhan dag gi zas te /
translated: other than the food of a non-Buddhist renunciate.

original: zas de dus la ma bab pa'i dge slong gis zos na byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: zas de dus la ma bab pa'i dge slong gis zos na byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: If a monk eats that food when it is not the proper time, he is the agent.🔽The texts of the three sutras that teach this are found in the Sutra on Individual Liberation:

original: 'di skad bstan pa'i mdo de gsum gyi gzhung ni so sor thar pa'i mdo las 'dus shing za na dus ma gtogs te ltung byed do ;
analyzed: 'di skad bstan pa'i mdo de gsum gyi gzhung ni so sor thar pa'i mdo las 'dus shing za na dus ma gtogs te ltung byed do ;
translated: “If one eats in a group, it is a downfall, except at the proper time.

original: / de la dus ni 'di yin te /🔽na ba dus so //
analyzed: / de la dus ni 'di yin te / na ba dus so //
translated: The proper time is this:🔽When one is sick,

original: las dus so //
analyzed: las dus so //
translated: when one is working,

original: lam dus so //
analyzed: lam dus so //
translated: when one is on a journey,

original: grur zhugs pa dang / 'dus pa chen po dang / dge slong gi zas dus te de la de ni dus yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: grur zhugs pa dang / 'dus pa chen po dang / dge slong gi zas dus te de la de ni dus yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: when one is staying in a boat, when there is a great gathering, or when it is the monks’ food, that is the proper time.”

original: ji zhig rjes su bsgrub na de byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / zas zos @309a * //
analyzed: ji zhig rjes su bsgrub na de byed pa po nyid yin zhe na / de'i phyir / zas zos @309a * //
translated: What is it that one is to do?

original: na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “If one eats food.”

original: mgul du mid na'o //
analyzed: mgul du mid na'o //
translated: If one swallows it.

original: der 'ong bar bya ba nyid du gnas pa mtshams kyi nang na 'khod pa dag gis 'ong ba nyid ma dris par za na 'da' ba'i phyed yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: der 'ong bar bya ba nyid du gnas pa mtshams kyi nang na 'khod pa dag gis 'ong ba nyid ma dris par za na 'da' ba'i phyed yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one eats without asking whether those who are staying within the boundary have come, it is a partial defeat.

original: der 'ong bar bya ba nyid du gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: der 'ong bar bya ba nyid du gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Those who are staying within the boundary” means

original: gzhi'i 'dug gnas dang khang khyim na gnas pa gang dag mtshams kyi nang na bkad sa 'dug pa der 'ong bar bya ba nyid du gnas pa'i dge slong de dag go //
analyzed: gzhi'i 'dug gnas dang khang khyim na gnas pa gang dag mtshams kyi nang na bkad sa 'dug pa der 'ong bar bya ba nyid du gnas pa'i dge slong de dag go //
translated: Those who are staying in the dwelling place of the basis, the house, are the resident monks who are staying in the assembly hall within the boundary.

original: dir 'ong bar bya ba nyid du gnas pa'i dge slong mtshams kyi nang na 'khod pa de dag gis 'ong ba nyid ma dris par za na 'da' ba'i phyed yin te nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dir 'ong bar bya ba nyid du gnas pa'i dge slong mtshams kyi nang na 'khod pa de dag gis 'ong ba nyid ma dris par za na 'da' ba'i phyed yin te nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If those resident monks who are staying within the boundary do not ask about the resident monks who are coming, then it is half an āpatti of pāyattika, meaning a minor offense.

original: dge slong der 'ong bar bya ba nyid du gnas pa ma yin pa dag gis 'ong ba nyid ma dris par zan ni ltung byed kho na ste mdo las gnas pa zhes smos pas gnas ma yin pa rnams kyi dmigs kyis bsal ba de ma byas pa'i phyir
analyzed: dge slong der 'ong bar bya ba nyid du gnas pa ma yin pa dag gis 'ong ba nyid ma dris par zan ni ltung byed kho na ste mdo las gnas pa zhes smos pas gnas ma yin pa rnams kyi dmigs kyis bsal ba de ma byas pa'i phyir
translated: If those who are not resident monks do not ask about the resident monks who are coming, then it is a full pāyattika. Since the sūtra mentions “resident,” it is an exception for those who are not resident, because it is not done.

original: ro // 'dir gzhung ni gzhi'i 'dug gnas kyi nye na kor na khang khyim dag yod la gzhi'i 'dug gnas su dge slong dag zan za na de dag gis khang khyim gyi 'dug gnas nas dge slong dag 'ongs sam zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: ro // 'dir gzhung ni gzhi'i 'dug gnas kyi nye na kor na khang khyim dag yod la gzhi'i 'dug gnas su dge slong dag zan za na de dag gis khang khyim gyi 'dug gnas nas dge slong dag 'ongs sam zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the text is as follows: “If there are houses in the vicinity of the monastery, and if the monks eat in the monastery, they should ask, ‘Have any monks come from the houses?’

original: ma dris par za na gzhi'i 'dug gnas pa dag la ni nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: ma dris par za na gzhi'i 'dug gnas pa dag la ni nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: If they eat without asking, those in the monastery commit an offense of wrong conduct,

original: khang khyim gyi 'dug gnas pa dag la ni ltung byed do //
analyzed: khang khyim gyi 'dug gnas pa dag la ni ltung byed do //
translated: and those in the houses commit a minor offense.

original: dge slong dag khang khyim gyi 'dug gnas su zan za na de dag gis gzhi'i 'dug gnas nas dge slong dag 'ongs sam zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag khang khyim gyi 'dug gnas su zan za na de dag gis gzhi'i 'dug gnas nas dge slong dag 'ongs sam zhes dri bar bya'o //

original: ma dris par za na khang khyim gyi 'dug gnas pa dag la ni nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: ma dris par za na khang khyim gyi 'dug gnas pa dag la ni nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: If they eat without asking, those in the houses commit an offense of wrong conduct,

original: gzhi'i 'dug gnas pa dag la ni ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhi'i 'dug gnas pa dag la ni ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and those in the monastery commit a minor offense.”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: mtshams gcig gi nang na gzhi'i 'dug gnas logs shig na yod la gzhi'i 'dug gnas de'i phyi rol na khang khyim dag yod cing bkad sa lan 'ga' ni gzhi'i 'dug gnas su byed /
analyzed: mtshams gcig gi nang na gzhi'i 'dug gnas logs shig na yod la gzhi'i 'dug gnas de'i phyi rol na khang khyim dag yod cing bkad sa lan 'ga' ni gzhi'i 'dug gnas su byed /
translated: In one case, the site of the main temple is in a separate location, and outside of that site of the main temple there are houses, and the meal is sometimes held in the site of the main temple.

original: lan 'ga' ni khang khyim dag tu byed la /
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni khang khyim dag tu byed la /
translated: Sometimes it is held in the houses.

analyzed: de na gal te gzhi'i 'dug gnas su bkad sa byed na khang khyim na gnas pa'i dge slong dag kyang zan gyi phyir der 'ong bas /
translated: If the meal is held in the site of the main temple, then the monks who are staying in the houses also come there for the meal.

original: de'i tshe gzhi'i 'dug na gnas pa'i dge slong dag gis khang khyim na gnas pa'i dge slong dag 'ongs @309b sam zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhi'i 'dug na gnas pa'i dge slong dag gis khang khyim na gnas pa'i dge slong dag 'ongs @309b sam zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: In that case, the monks who are staying in the site of the main temple should ask, “Have the monks who are staying in the houses come?”

original: ma dris par za na nyes byas so //
analyzed: ma dris par za na nyes byas so //
translated: If they eat without asking, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: khang khyim na gnas pa'i dge slong der ma lhags pa dag gis kyang gzhi'i 'dug gnas na gnas pa'i dge slong dag 'ongs sam zhes dri bar bya'o /
analyzed: khang khyim na gnas pa'i dge slong der ma lhags pa dag gis kyang gzhi'i 'dug gnas na gnas pa'i dge slong dag 'ongs sam zhes dri bar bya'o /

original: ma dris par za na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma dris par za na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they eat without asking, there is an offense entailing confession.

original: des na gal te khang khyim du bkad sa byed na gzhi'i 'dug gnas na gnas pa'i dge slong dag kyang zan gyi phyir der 'od bas de'i tshe khang khyim na gnas pa'i dge slong dag gis gzhi'i 'dug gnas na gnas pa'i dge slong dag 'ongs sam zhes dri
analyzed: des na gal te khang khyim du bkad sa byed na gzhi'i 'dug gnas na gnas pa'i dge slong dag kyang zan gyi phyir der 'od bas de'i tshe khang khyim na gnas pa'i dge slong dag gis gzhi'i 'dug gnas na gnas pa'i dge slong dag 'ongs sam zhes dri
translated: At that time, the monks who are staying in the house should ask, “Have the monks who are staying in the monastery come?”

original: bar bya'o // ma dris par za na nyes byas so //
analyzed: bar bya'o // ma dris par za na nyes byas so //
translated: If they eat without asking, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gzhi'i 'dug gnas na gnas pa'i dge slong der ma lhags pa dag gis kyang khang khyim na gnas pa'i dge slong dag 'ongs sam zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi'i 'dug gnas na gnas pa'i dge slong der ma lhags pa dag gis kyang khang khyim na gnas pa'i dge slong dag 'ongs sam zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: The monks who are staying in the monastery should also ask, “Have the monks who are staying in the house come?”

original: ma dris par za na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma dris par za na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they eat without asking, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'dir mi 'dri ba ni zan lhan cig ma yin pa nyid kyi dpe tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: 'dir mi 'dri ba ni zan lhan cig ma yin pa nyid kyi dpe tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Here, not asking is merely an example of not eating together.

original: ltung ba'i rgyu ni zan lhan cig ma yin pa nyid kho na yin no //
analyzed: ltung ba'i rgyu ni zan lhan cig ma yin pa nyid kho na yin no //
translated: The cause of the offense is only not eating together.

original: de lta bas na zan lhan cig nyid yin na ni ma dris par zos na yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na zan lhan cig nyid yin na ni ma dris par zos na yang nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, if they are eating together, there is no offense if they eat without asking.

analyzed: de ltar na dge slong nges pa rnams la ni nyi ma gcig gi don la yang dge 'dun gyi bkad sa na smad pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, for certain monks, even for the sake of a single day, it is a downfall to eat in the assembly hall.

original: dge slong ma nges pa rnams la ni kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong ma nges pa rnams la ni kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //

original: da ni don gyis byung ba'i gzhi brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni don gyis byung ba'i gzhi brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the basis of the offense should be stated.

original: gnas nges pa gcig yin la de nyid na dge slong gang dag so so na zan za zhing de dag gis kyang 'dus shing za bar mngon sum du shes sam dogs pa dag yod na dge 'dun gyi khongs su gtogs pa'i dge slong de dag thams cad la
analyzed: gnas nges pa gcig yin la de nyid na dge slong gang dag so so na zan za zhing de dag gis kyang 'dus shing za bar mngon sum du shes sam dogs pa dag yod na dge 'dun gyi khongs su gtogs pa'i dge slong de dag thams cad la
translated: If there is a single certain place, and if there are monks who eat separately in that place, and if they know or suspect that they are eating together, then all the monks who are part of the assembly

original: nyes byas kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyes byas kho nar 'gyur te /

analyzed: gang yang rung ba cung zad cig brims na yang zan gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: bza' bar bya ba gang yang rung ba chung zad cig dge 'dun gyis zan logs shig na za ba la brims kyang rung /
translated: Whether the small amount of food to be eaten is distributed to the Saṅgha for eating in a separate place,

original: zan logs shig na za bas dge 'dun la brims kyang rung ste /
analyzed: zan logs shig na za bas dge 'dun la brims kyang rung ste /
translated: or whether it is distributed to the Saṅgha for eating in a separate place,

original: de'i tshe na zan gcig pa nyid yin zhing tha dad pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na zan gcig pa nyid yin zhing tha dad pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: at that time it is the same food, and it is not different.

analyzed: 'dus shing za ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it does not become a downfall of eating in a group.

original: 'gro bar chas pa dang glo bur du 'ongs pa dang nad pa @310a * //
analyzed: 'gro bar chas pa dang glo bur du 'ongs pa dang nad pa @310a * //
translated: Those who are about to leave, those who have arrived unexpectedly, those who are sick,

original: dang nad g-yog dang dge skos las gzhan pa thams cad kyis ma zos par g-yos mal dang spyi bungs las mnos te bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dang nad g-yog dang dge skos las gzhan pa thams cad kyis ma zos par g-yos mal dang spyi bungs las mnos te bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

translated: The phrase “from the common property” means
