analyzed: de bas na rang gi phyed yol phan chad nas phyi de nyin par gyi skya rengs 'char ba'i bar ni dus ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the time from the end of one’s own afternoon meal until dawn of the following day is the wrong time.

original: gung tshigs kyi skad cig phan chad skya rengs shar ba'i mdun rol gyi bar de ni dus ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gung tshigs kyi skad cig phan chad skya rengs shar ba'i mdun rol gyi bar de ni dus ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The time from the moment after noon until the break of dawn is to be understood as the wrong time.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dus ma lags par bca' bar bgyi ba dang / bza' bar bgyi ba 'tshal @311a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dus ma lags par bca' bar bgyi ba dang / bza' bar bgyi ba 'tshal @311a * //
translated: Here, the text states: “Venerables, a monk should not eat food at the wrong time.

original: la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba mchis sam /
analyzed: la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba mchis sam /
translated: Is there any time when it is not a downfall?

original: yod de 'dzam bu gling pa'i dus kyis gling gsum po dag tu zos na ltung bar mi 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod de 'dzam bu gling pa'i dus kyis gling gsum po dag tu zos na ltung bar mi 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Yes, if one eats in the three continents in the time of Jambudvīpa, it is not a downfall.

original: de nyid la shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid la shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In that very context, the main factor is the perception.

original: dus ma yin pa de nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa de nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The main factor is the perception of the time as being improper.

original: ji zhig kun tu spyad na zhe na /
analyzed: ji zhig kun tu spyad na zhe na /
translated: What is to be practiced?

original: de'i phyir / bca' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba zos na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bca' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba zos na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “if one eats food that is prepared or cooked.”

original: dus ma yin par bca' bar bya ba 'am bza' bar bya ba zos na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: dus ma yin par bca' bar bya ba 'am bza' bar bya ba zos na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: If one eats prepared or cooked food at the improper time, it is a downfall.

original: / dus ma yin par za ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: / dus ma yin par za ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The downfall of eating at the improper time has been explained.🔽The downfall of storing for a month

original: // / sog 'jog gi ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: // / sog 'jog gi ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: If one wishes to explain the downfall of storing for a month,

original: je dang por sog 'jog gi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: je dang por sog 'jog gi mtshan nyid bstan par bya ste /
translated: first the definition of storing for a month should be explained.

original: de'i phyir snga dro ba'i zas byin len byas pa phyi dro ba'i zas su dang de thun tshod las 'das pa lta bu ni sog 'jog byas pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir snga dro ba'i zas byin len byas pa phyi dro ba'i zas su dang de thun tshod las 'das pa lta bu ni sog 'jog byas pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the food of the morning is the food of the evening, and that which is past the time is stored.

original: snga dro ba'i zas bca' bar bya ba dang / bza' bar bya ba'i zas kyi dus ni skya rengs shar nas brtsams nas gung tshigs kyi skad cig ma'i bar te /
analyzed: snga dro ba'i zas bca' bar bya ba dang / bza' bar bya ba'i zas kyi dus ni skya rengs shar nas brtsams nas gung tshigs kyi skad cig ma'i bar te /
translated: The time for the food of the morning, which is both solid and liquid, is from sunrise until the moment of noon.

original: dus der snga dro ba'i zas byin len byas pa byin len de nyid ma zhig par phyi dro ba'i zas kyi dus su gud tshigs las yol bar thal ba ni sog 'jog byas pa yin te /
analyzed: dus der snga dro ba'i zas byin len byas pa byin len de nyid ma zhig par phyi dro ba'i zas kyi dus su gud tshigs las yol bar thal ba ni sog 'jog byas pa yin te /
translated: If the food of the morning, which has been accepted, is not discarded, and it becomes the food of the evening, then it is stored.

original: byin len de zhig na ni sog 'jog byas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byin len de zhig na ni sog 'jog byas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is discarded, it is not stored.

original: de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That means

original: phyi dro ba'i zas te thun tshod du rung ba'i zas so //
analyzed: phyi dro ba'i zas te thun tshod du rung ba'i zas so //
translated: the food of the evening, which is suitable for the time.

original: de yang byin len byas nas byin len de nyid ma zhig par thun tshod las 'das pa'i dus su thal na sog 'jog byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang byin len byas nas byin len de nyid ma zhig par thun tshod las 'das pa'i dus su thal na sog 'jog byas pa yin te /
translated: Further, if one passes the time beyond one day and night without that very acceptance being destroyed, then it is stored.

original: de yang byin len de zhig na ni sog 'jog byas par mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de yang byin len de zhig na ni sog 'jog byas par mi 'gyur ro /
translated: If that very acceptance is destroyed, then it is not stored.

original: gtsug lag las thun tshod ces gsungs pa nyid thun tshod 'di yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag las thun tshod ces gsungs pa nyid thun tshod 'di yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The time period mentioned in the scriptures should be understood as this one day and night.

original: de nyid las shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni /🔽bca' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba za na zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de nyid las shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni / bca' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba za na zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The term “chief cognition” in that passage refers to🔽the chief cognition that is the basis of the name.

original: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term “in that” refers to

original: sog 'jog byas pa de nyid la'o //
analyzed: sog 'jog byas pa de nyid la'o //
translated: the stored food.

original: shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term “chief cognition” refers to🔽the chief cognition that is the basis of the name.

original: 'dir yang shes gtso bo zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes @311b bya ba'i ming can du sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dir yang shes gtso bo zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes @311b bya ba'i ming can du sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Here the term “chief cognition” is applied to the name “chief cognition” and to the name “chief perception.”

original: bca' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba yang sog 'jog byas pa yin la /
analyzed: bca' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba yang sog 'jog byas pa yin la /
translated: The food that is stored is also the food that is chewed and swallowed.

original: dge slong gis kyang de ltar shes na de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin te /
analyzed: dge slong gis kyang de ltar shes na de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin te /
translated: If a monk also knows that, then he is the one who is the primary agent of the perception.

original: de zos na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de zos na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he eats it, he commits a downfall.

original: la gnyar blangs pa mid par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: la gnyar blangs pa mid par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not swallow food that has been held in one’s hand.

original: lag nyar blangs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lag nyar blangs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Held in one’s hand” means

original: byin len ma byas par dge slong rang gis blangs pa'i zas te /🔽de mid par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byin len ma byas par dge slong rang gis blangs pa'i zas te / de mid par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: food that a monk has taken himself without having it first consecrated.🔽“One should not swallow it” means

original: bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: one should not eat it.

original: mtshams kyi nang du btsos pa dang zhag lon par yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du btsos pa dang zhag lon par yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not cook inside the boundaries or keep food overnight there.

original: mtshams kyi nang du btsos pa dang / mtshams kyi nang du zhag lon pa'i zas kyang mid par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du btsos pa dang / mtshams kyi nang du zhag lon pa'i zas kyang mid par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not swallow food that has been cooked inside the boundaries or that has been kept overnight inside the boundaries.

original: mtshams kyi nang du zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi nang rol zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi nang rol zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Inside the boundaries” means inside the boundaries of the monastery.

original: btsos pa zhes bya ba ni bsregs pa dang btsos pa la sogs pa'i g-yos su byas pa'o //
analyzed: btsos pa zhes bya ba ni bsregs pa dang btsos pa la sogs pa'i g-yos su byas pa'o //
translated: “Cooked” means cooked by boiling, baking, or the like.

original: zhag lon pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhag lon pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term having spent the night

original: nyin zhag phyi ma'i skad cig mar gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyin zhag phyi ma'i skad cig mar gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means having been placed in the next moment of the next day.

original: 'dir gzhung ni nang du btsos pa gang zhe na //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni nang du btsos pa gang zhe na //
translated: Here the text is: What is cooking in a place that is not suitable?

original: kun dga' ra ba'i nang du blo mthun par ma byas shing rung ba ma yin pa'i sa gzhir btsos pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba'i nang du blo mthun par ma byas shing rung ba ma yin pa'i sa gzhir btsos pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is cooking in a place that is not suitable, in a monastery, without the consent of the community.

original: nang du zhag lon pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nang du zhag lon pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is spending the night in a place that is not suitable?

original: kun dga' ra ba'i nang du blo mthun par ma byas shing rung ba ma yin pa'i sa gzhir zhag lon pa gang yin ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba'i nang du blo mthun par ma byas shing rung ba ma yin pa'i sa gzhir zhag lon pa gang yin ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is spending the night in a place that is not suitable, in a monastery, without the consent of the community.

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pas bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pas bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: A monk who has received full ordination should not eat it.

original: 'dir kun dga' ra ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gnas kyi gzhi brjod de ;
analyzed: 'dir kun dga' ra ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gnas kyi gzhi brjod de ;
translated: Here the term monastery refers to the site of the monastery,

original: btsos ma ma yin ba'i mtshams dang bcas pa bzung gi / gsol ba la sogs pa'i las kyis bcad pa'i mtshams nyi tshe bzung bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: btsos ma ma yin ba'i mtshams dang bcas pa bzung gi / gsol ba la sogs pa'i las kyis bcad pa'i mtshams nyi tshe bzung bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: including the boundary of the monastery, but not the boundary that is established by a formal act of the community.

original: dge slong gis btsos pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: dge slong gis btsos pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
translated: Also, that cooked by a fully ordained monk.

original: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras mid par mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te ;🔽dge slong gis btsos pa ni mtshams kyi nang du yang rung /
analyzed: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras mid par mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te ; dge slong gis btsos pa ni mtshams kyi nang du yang rung /
translated: The word “also” is connected to “should not be swallowed.”

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du yang rung ste /
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du yang rung ste /
translated: That cooked by a fully ordained monk, whether inside the boundary or outside the boundary,

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pas bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pas bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: should not be eaten by a fully ordained monk.

original: dge slong gis btsos pa de yang dge slong kho nas bza' bar bya ba ma yin gyi /🔽dge slong ma rnams kyis @312a * //
analyzed: dge slong gis btsos pa de yang dge slong kho nas bza' bar bya ba ma yin gyi / dge slong ma rnams kyis @312a * //
translated: That cooked by a fully ordained monk should not be eaten only by fully ordained monks.

original: bza' bar mi bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bza' bar mi bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that it should not be eaten by fully ordained nuns.

original: dge slong mas btsos pa yang dge slong ma kho nas bza' bar bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dge slong mas btsos pa yang dge slong ma kho nas bza' bar bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: That cooked by a fully ordained nun should not be eaten only by fully ordained nuns.

original: dge slong rnams kyis bza' bar mi bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bza' bar mi bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that it should not be eaten by fully ordained monks.

original: sbyin bdag gis rung ba ma yin pa'i gzhir btsos pa'am zhag tu bzhag pa 'bul bar byed pa de la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis rung ba ma yin pa'i gzhir btsos pa'am zhag tu bzhag pa 'bul bar byed pa de la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: If the donor offers food cooked on an inappropriate site or left overnight, there is no fault.

original: sbyin bdag gis mar dang 'bras la sogs pa phul la rang 'ongs nas brim mo zhes zer ba de la ni nyes pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis mar dang 'bras la sogs pa phul la rang 'ongs nas brim mo zhes zer ba de la ni nyes pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If the benefactor says, “I will give butter, rice, etc., and you should come and distribute them,” then there is only a fault,

original: dang po kho nar bdag gir byas par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po kho nar bdag gir byas par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has already taken possession of them.

original: dge slong gis grong dag tu dge slong gi don du dgos pa'i mdzod dang bang ba la sogs pa gang dag byed cing de dag gi nang du dge slong gis nyin mtshan du gnas pas gnas par byed na de ni dge slong gi gnas nyid yin par rig
analyzed: dge slong gis grong dag tu dge slong gi don du dgos pa'i mdzod dang bang ba la sogs pa gang dag byed cing de dag gi nang du dge slong gis nyin mtshan du gnas pas gnas par byed na de ni dge slong gi gnas nyid yin par rig
translated: If a monk makes a storehouse, granary, etc. for the use of monks in a village, and if monks live there day and night, it should be understood that this is a monk’s residence.

original: par bya'o // der gnas pa btang na ni dge slong gi gnas kyi gzhi nyid dang yang bral ba nyid yin no ;
analyzed: par bya'o // der gnas pa btang na ni dge slong gi gnas kyi gzhi nyid dang yang bral ba nyid yin no ;
translated: If the monks leave that residence, then they are no longer in a monk’s residence.

original: / bdag po dag gis gnas 'dir dge slong su yang gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: / bdag po dag gis gnas 'dir dge slong su yang gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: The owners say, “No monk should live in this residence.”

original: zhes gtsug lag khang gi phyogs kyi gnas 'ga' zhig tu dge slong mi 'jug par nges par byas pa de ni dge slong gi gnas nyid dang bral ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: zhes gtsug lag khang gi phyogs kyi gnas 'ga' zhig tu dge slong mi 'jug par nges par byas pa de ni dge slong gi gnas nyid dang bral ba kho na yin no //
translated: In some places in the temple, it is certain that monks are not allowed to enter. That is only the absence of the status of a monk.

original: de bzhin du gtsug lag khang stong par dge slong zhig ngal bso ba'i phyir zhag 'ga' tsam gnas 'cha' bar byed na yang de dge slong gi gnas nyid du gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gtsug lag khang stong par dge slong zhig ngal bso ba'i phyir zhag 'ga' tsam gnas 'cha' bar byed na yang de dge slong gi gnas nyid du gyur pa yin la /
translated: Similarly, if a monk stays for a few days in an empty temple to rest, that becomes the status of a monk.

original: dge slong de nas song na ni dge slong gi gnas nyid dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong de nas song na ni dge slong gi gnas nyid dang bral ba yin no //
translated: If that monk leaves, he loses the status of a monk.

original: lag nyar blangs pa mid bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo gsum po de dag ni sogs 'jog byed pa'i tshal brten pa yin pas na /
analyzed: lag nyar blangs pa mid bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo gsum po de dag ni sogs 'jog byed pa'i tshal brten pa yin pas na /
translated: The three sūtras beginning with What is taken in hand should not be eaten are the basis for the inclusion of the rest.

original: de'i phyir 'dir bsdus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir bsdus so //
translated: Therefore, they are included here.

original: 'dir rjen pa btsos pa gang yin pa ni de'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir rjen pa btsos pa gang yin pa ni de'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, whatever is raw or cooked is that.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here means

original: mtshams kyi nang du btsos pa dang dge slong gis btsos pa'i skabs 'dir ro //
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du btsos pa dang dge slong gis btsos pa'i skabs 'dir ro //
translated: in this context of cooking inside the boundary and cooking by a monk.

original: der ni rjen par btsos pa gang yin pa ni mtshams kyi nang du btsos pa dang / dge slong gis btsos pa de yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: der ni rjen par btsos pa gang yin pa ni mtshams kyi nang du btsos pa dang / dge slong gis btsos pa de yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: There, the raw is what is cooked in the vicinity, and what is cooked by a monk.

original: btsos pa ni byin len byas na yang btso bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btsos pa ni byin len byas na yang btso bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that if cooked food is received, it is to be cooked again.

original: mi snyi ba rnams kyi ni sum cha bangs pa nyid kyi mdun @312b rol du ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi snyi ba rnams kyi ni sum cha bangs pa nyid kyi mdun @312b rol du ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: For those that are not soft, it is the same before they are one-third cooked.

original: mi snyi ba rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi snyi ba rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For those that are not soft means

original: til dang / 'bras dang / sha la sogs pa skam po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: til dang / 'bras dang / sha la sogs pa skam po rnams kyi'o //
translated: for those that are dry, such as sesame seed, rice, meat and so on.

original: de dag gi rjen pa nyid ni sum cha bangs pa nyid kyi mdun rol du de nyid yin no /
analyzed: de dag gi rjen pa nyid ni sum cha bangs pa nyid kyi mdun rol du de nyid yin no /
translated: Their rawness is the same before they are one-third cooked.

original: rjen pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rjen pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is rawness.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽til dang ; 'bras dang / sha skam la sogs pa srab rnams kyi rjen pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / til dang ; 'bras dang / sha skam la sogs pa srab rnams kyi rjen pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is taught.🔽For those that are dry, such as sesame seed, rice, meat and so on,

original: bshur ba la sogs pas sum cha bangs pa nyid ni mdun rol du yin te /
analyzed: bshur ba la sogs pas sum cha bangs pa nyid ni mdun rol du yin te /
translated: their rawness is before they are one-third cooked by boiling and so on.

original: sum cha bangs pa nyid phyin chad ni rjen pa nyid ma yin no //🔽rdzas snyi ba ni phye mar byas pa nyid yin na yang snyi ba nyid dang bral ba nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sum cha bangs pa nyid phyin chad ni rjen pa nyid ma yin no // rdzas snyi ba ni phye mar byas pa nyid yin na yang snyi ba nyid dang bral ba nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that once it has been cooked one third, it is no longer raw.🔽Even when a soft substance is ground to powder, it is not devoid of softness.

original: rdzas sra ba yang phye mar byas ba nyid na sra ba nyid dang bral ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas sra ba yang phye mar byas ba nyid na sra ba nyid dang bral ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: Even when a hard substance is ground to powder, it is not devoid of hardness.

original: dper na gro la sogs pa ha cang zhib mor ma btags pa dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gro la sogs pa ha cang zhib mor ma btags pa dag lta bu'o //
translated: For example, flour made from wheat, etc., is not very finely ground.

original: snyi ba rnams kyi ni kha dog tu gyur pa'i 'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snyi ba rnams kyi ni kha dog tu gyur pa'i 'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The softness of soft substances is the state of being raw.

original: rdzas snyi ba rnams kyi rjen pa nyid ni kha dog tu gyur pa'i mdun rol du de nyid yin te /
analyzed: rdzas snyi ba rnams kyi rjen pa nyid ni kha dog tu gyur pa'i mdun rol du de nyid yin te /
translated: The softness of soft substances is the state of being raw prior to the state of having the color of cooked food.

original: rjen pa nyid yin no //🔽khu ba rnams kyi ni lan gnyis khol bar gyur pa nyid kyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rjen pa nyid yin no // khu ba rnams kyi ni lan gnyis khol bar gyur pa nyid kyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is the state of being raw.🔽The softness of liquid substances is the state of boiling twice.

original: 'o ma la sogs pa'i rdzas khu ba rnams kyi rjen pa nyid ni lan gnyis khol bar gyur pa nyid kyi mdun rol nyid du de nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa'i rdzas khu ba rnams kyi rjen pa nyid ni lan gnyis khol bar gyur pa nyid kyi mdun rol nyid du de nyid yin te /
translated: The softness of liquid substances such as milk, etc., is the state of being raw prior to the state of boiling twice.

original: rjen pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rjen pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is raw.

original: gong ma thams cad la yang mtshams de dag phyin chad ni tshos pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gong ma thams cad la yang mtshams de dag phyin chad ni tshos pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //

original: mes rung bar byas pa ni ma btsos pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mes rung bar byas pa ni ma btsos pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: dgun la sogs pa mes rung bar byas pa ni ma btsos pa ma yin te ;

analyzed: btsos pa kho na yin no //
translated: it is cooked.🔽Therefore, one should not make it fit by fire within the boundary.🔽That which is established by staying is not unestablished.

analyzed: de lta bas na mtshams kyi nang du mes rung bar mi bya'o // 'dug pa'i 'grub pa nyid skye ba la rag las pa ni ma lon pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: 'dug pa gang gi 'grub pa nyid skye ba la rag las pa de ni nang du zhag ma lon pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: 'dug pa de rung ba'i sar 'grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dug pa de rung ba'i sar 'grub pa nyid do //
translated: That which is established by staying

original: 'grub pa nyid gang yin pa de skye ba la rag las pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'grub pa nyid gang yin pa de skye ba la rag las pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That which is established depends on arising.

original: skye ba la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba la ltos pa ste /
translated: That which is established depends on arising.

original: shing @313a * //🔽tog la sogs pa rung ba'i sar 'grub pa nyid gang yin pa de rang gi skye ba'i rgyun rtsa ba dang sdong bu la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa'i sa na 'dug pa dang 'brel ba 'am /
analyzed: shing @313a * // tog la sogs pa rung ba'i sar 'grub pa nyid gang yin pa de rang gi skye ba'i rgyun rtsa ba dang sdong bu la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa'i sa na 'dug pa dang 'brel ba 'am /
translated: For example, a fruit is established in a suitable place.🔽That which is established depends on the continuum of its own arising, which is connected to a root, trunk, etc., that is not in a suitable place.

original: rang gi skye ba'i rgyun rtsa ba dang sdong bu la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa'i sa na 'dug pa de las mis ma brtsal bar rang brul ba skye ba'i rgyun dang 'brel ba rung ba'i sa na 'dug pa rnam pa de gnyi ga yang skye ba
analyzed: rang gi skye ba'i rgyun rtsa ba dang sdong bu la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa'i sa na 'dug pa de las mis ma brtsal bar rang brul ba skye ba'i rgyun dang 'brel ba rung ba'i sa na 'dug pa rnam pa de gnyi ga yang skye ba
translated: Or, that which is established depends on the continuum of its own arising, which is not in a suitable place, and is connected to a root, trunk, etc., that is in a suitable place, but which has not been sought out by a person and has split open by itself.

original: la rag las pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: la rag las pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Both of these are said to depend on arising.

original: ma lon pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma lon pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not that it is not obtained.

original: de ltar shing tog la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa'i sa na 'dug pa'i 'grub pa skye ba la rag las pa rnam pa gnyis po de ni skye ba'i rgyun rung ba ma yin pa'i sa nas byung ba'i dbang gis grub pa yin pas nang du zhag
analyzed: de ltar shing tog la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa'i sa na 'dug pa'i 'grub pa skye ba la rag las pa rnam pa gnyis po de ni skye ba'i rgyun rung ba ma yin pa'i sa nas byung ba'i dbang gis grub pa yin pas nang du zhag
translated: Thus, the two types of establishment of that which is unsuitable to be eaten, such as fruit, that depend on arising are established by the power of arising from an unsuitable place.

original: ma lon pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: ma lon pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: They are not not counted as internal days.

original: zhag lon pa kho na nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhag lon pa kho na nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are counted as internal days.🔽Thus, that which is established as being unsuitable to be eaten that depends on arising is not not counted as an internal day. It is counted as an internal day.

original: de ltar 'dug pa'i 'grub pa nyid skye ba la rag las pa gang yin pa de ni nang du zhag ma lon pa nyid ma yin te lon pa kho na nyid yin pas skye ba'i dbang gis na dngos po rung ba'i sa na 'dug pa de'i 'grub pa
analyzed: de ltar 'dug pa'i 'grub pa nyid skye ba la rag las pa gang yin pa de ni nang du zhag ma lon pa nyid ma yin te lon pa kho na nyid yin pas skye ba'i dbang gis na dngos po rung ba'i sa na 'dug pa de'i 'grub pa
translated: By the power of arising, that which is established as being suitable to be eaten that is placed on a suitable place

original: rung ba ma yin pa'i sa nas byung la /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa'i sa nas byung la /
translated: arises from an unsuitable place.

original: skye ba'i rgyun dang ma bral ba dper na bal po se'u'i shing dang / ma du lung ga la sogs pa'i shing rung ba ma yin pa'i sa nas skyes pa'i 'bras bu yal ga dang 'brel ba rung ba'i sar 'phyang ba lta bu dang / dngos po rung ba'i sa na 'dug pa de'i 'grub pa rung ba ma yin pa'i sa nas byung la /
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyun dang ma bral ba dper na bal po se'u'i shing dang / ma du lung ga la sogs pa'i shing rung ba ma yin pa'i sa nas skyes pa'i 'bras bu yal ga dang 'brel ba rung ba'i sar 'phyang ba lta bu dang / dngos po rung ba'i sa na 'dug pa de'i 'grub pa rung ba ma yin pa'i sa nas byung la /
translated: For example, the fruit of the pomegranate tree and the fruit of the maddula tree and so on, which are not fit to be eaten, are connected to their branches and hang down from an unfit place, but they are on a fit place.

original: skye ba'i rgyun dang bral ba dper na shing ta la la sogs pa rung ba ma yin ba'i sa las skyes pa'i 'bras bu mis ma brtsal bar rang brul ba yal ga dang ma 'brel ba rung ba'i sa nas 'dug pa lta bu dag ni skye ba la
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyun dang bral ba dper na shing ta la la sogs pa rung ba ma yin ba'i sa las skyes pa'i 'bras bu mis ma brtsal bar rang brul ba yal ga dang ma 'brel ba rung ba'i sa nas 'dug pa lta bu dag ni skye ba la
translated: The fruit of the palm tree and so on, which are not fit to be eaten, are not connected to their branches and are on a fit place, but they come from an unfit place.

original: rag las pa'i dbang gis na nang du zhag lon pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rag las pa'i dbang gis na nang du zhag lon pa kho na yin no //
translated: These are said to be ripe only after a day has passed, because they are dependent on arising.

original: sa bon mtshams kyi nang du zhag lon pa mtshams kyi phyi rol du btab pa las rtsa ba dang myu gu la sogs pa skyes pa gang yin pa de ni mtshams kyi nang du zhag lon pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: sa bon mtshams kyi nang du zhag lon pa mtshams kyi phyi rol du btab pa las rtsa ba dang myu gu la sogs pa skyes pa gang yin pa de ni mtshams kyi nang du zhag lon pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: That which is produced from a seed that has been stored inside a boundary and is planted outside the boundary, such as a root, sprout, and so on, is not stored inside the boundary.

original: skye ba gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a different arising.

original: mtshams kyi nang du skyes pa'i dngos po mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'phel bar gyur pa /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du skyes pa'i dngos po mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'phel bar gyur pa /
translated: A thing that is produced inside a boundary and grows outside the boundary,

original: dper na ku sman la sogs pa lta bu dang / de bzhin du @313b nang du zhag lon pa'i 'o ma gnas skabs gzhan du 'phos pa zhor gyur pa lta bu ni nang du zhag lon pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dper na ku sman la sogs pa lta bu dang / de bzhin du @313b nang du zhag lon pa'i 'o ma gnas skabs gzhan du 'phos pa zhor gyur pa lta bu ni nang du zhag lon pa nyid yin no //
translated: for example, a kusha plant, and likewise, milk that is stored inside a boundary and becomes curd through a change in state, is stored inside the boundary.

original: mtshams kyi nang du zhag lon pa'i ba las 'o ma byung ba gang yin pa de yang nang du zhag lon pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du zhag lon pa'i ba las 'o ma byung ba gang yin pa de yang nang du zhag lon pa kho na yin te /
translated: That which is milk produced from a cow stored inside a boundary is also stored inside the boundary.

original: 'o ma de mtshams kyi nang nas byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o ma de mtshams kyi nang nas byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that milk is produced inside the boundary.

original: snod phyogs na 'dug na des kyang sa der btsos pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snod phyogs na 'dug na des kyang sa der btsos pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the vessel is in a place that is not suitable, then the substance to be cooked is also cooked in an unsuitable place.

original: btso bar bya ba'i rdzas kyi gzhir gyur pa snod rung ba ma yin pa'i phyogs na 'dug na rgyu des kyang btso bar bya ba'i rdzas de yang rung ba ma yin pa'i sa der btsos pa nyid yin ba'i sa der btsos pa nyid yin bar rig par bya'o
analyzed: btso bar bya ba'i rdzas kyi gzhir gyur pa snod rung ba ma yin pa'i phyogs na 'dug na rgyu des kyang btso bar bya ba'i rdzas de yang rung ba ma yin pa'i sa der btsos pa nyid yin ba'i sa der btsos pa nyid yin bar rig par bya'o
translated: If the vessel that is the basis of the substance to be cooked is in a place that is not suitable, then by that cause, the substance to be cooked is also cooked in an unsuitable place.

original: // btso bar bya ba'i rdzas nyi tshe rung ba ma yin pa'i sar bzhag pa rung ba ma yin pa'i sar btsos par gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: // btso bar bya ba'i rdzas nyi tshe rung ba ma yin pa'i sar bzhag pa rung ba ma yin pa'i sar btsos par gyur pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: It is not only the substance to be cooked that is placed in an unsuitable place and cooked in an unsuitable place.

original: brgyud pa'i tshul gyis kyang rung ba ma yin pa'i sar btsos par gyur pa yod de /🔽dper na rung ba ma yin pa'i sar mdag ma dag gi steng du skyed bo la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: brgyud pa'i tshul gyis kyang rung ba ma yin pa'i sar btsos par gyur pa yod de / dper na rung ba ma yin pa'i sar mdag ma dag gi steng du skyed bo la sogs pa'am /
translated: It is also cooked in an unsuitable place by way of a continuum.🔽For example, if the substance to be cooked is placed on hot coals in an unsuitable place, or on a tripod, etc.

original: lcags sgyed rkang gsum pa la sogs pa btsugs pa'i steng du /
analyzed: lcags sgyed rkang gsum pa la sogs pa btsugs pa'i steng du /
translated: in an unsuitable place,

original: phru ba la sogs pa'i snod bzhag pa'i nang du sha la sogs pa btsos na //
analyzed: phru ba la sogs pa'i snod bzhag pa'i nang du sha la sogs pa btsos na //
translated: If one cooks meat, etc. in a pot, etc. which is placed on an unfit surface,

original: de yang rung ba ma yin pa'i sar btsos pa nyid yin par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yang rung ba ma yin pa'i sar btsos pa nyid yin par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: then that is also cooked on an unfit surface.

original: 'tshod par byed pa de na 'dug pa nyid kyis ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'tshod par byed pa de na 'dug pa nyid kyis ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the one who cooks is standing on a fit surface, it is not unfit.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is said:

original: btso bar bya ba'i rdzas 'tshod par byed pa'i mi rung ba ma yin pa'i sa de na 'dug pa nyid kyis btso bar bya ba'i rdzas rung ba'i sar btsos pas ni rung ba ma yin pa'i sar btsos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: btso bar bya ba'i rdzas 'tshod par byed pa'i mi rung ba ma yin pa'i sa de na 'dug pa nyid kyis btso bar bya ba'i rdzas rung ba'i sar btsos pas ni rung ba ma yin pa'i sar btsos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The substance to be cooked is cooked on a fit surface, by the one who cooks standing on an unfit surface.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: gal te 'tshod par byed pa'i mi mtshams kyi nang rol na 'dug cang /
analyzed: gal te 'tshod par byed pa'i mi mtshams kyi nang rol na 'dug cang /
translated: If the one who cooks is standing inside the boundary,

original: btso bar bya ba'i rdzas mtshams kyi phyi rol lag pas slebs tsam du 'tshod par byed na btso bar bya ba'i rdzas de mtshams kyi nang du btsos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: btso bar bya ba'i rdzas mtshams kyi phyi rol lag pas slebs tsam du 'tshod par byed na btso bar bya ba'i rdzas de mtshams kyi nang du btsos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the substance to be cooked is being cooked just within reach of his hand outside the boundary, then that substance to be cooked is not cooked inside the boundary.

original: mi ni snod ma yin pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi ni snod ma yin pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not that a person is not a vessel.

original: me mdag ni snod dang 'dra ba nyid ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: me mdag ni snod dang 'dra ba nyid ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that embers are not like a vessel.

original: snod dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: snod dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
translated: They are like a vessel.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa'i me mdag dag gi steng du bsreg par bya ba'i rdzas gang yin pa de bsregs pa ni mtshams kyi nang du btsos pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa'i me mdag dag gi steng du bsreg par bya ba'i rdzas gang yin pa de bsregs pa ni mtshams kyi nang du btsos pa nyid yin no //
translated: When a substance to be burned is burned on embers that are within a boundary, it is cooked within the boundary.

original: me lce'i steng du bsregs pa ni ma yin te /🔽me lce ni nam @314a * //
analyzed: me lce'i steng du bsregs pa ni ma yin te / me lce ni nam @314a * //
translated: It is not burned on the flame.

original: mkha' dang 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mkha' dang 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The flame is like space.

original: de las phyung ba dang byung ba dag ni de nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de las phyung ba dang byung ba dag ni de nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not that what is removed from it or what arises from it is not that.

original: mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa'i me de las 'ga' zhig gis bong ba la sogs pa dag gis me phyir phyung ba dang rlung la sogs pa'i dbang gis me rang byung ba dag ni de nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa'i me de las 'ga' zhig gis bong ba la sogs pa dag gis me phyir phyung ba dang rlung la sogs pa'i dbang gis me rang byung ba dag ni de nyid ma yin te /
translated: When someone removes the fire from within the boundary with a clod of earth, or when the fire arises by itself through the power of the wind, etc., it is not that.

original: sa de'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la sa der gtogs pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sa de'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la sa der gtogs pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of that place, nor does it belong to that place.

original: nyen kor ni gnas nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyen kor ni gnas nyid yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The vicinity is the place itself.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term “place” means

original: der gnas par bya ba yin pas gnas te /
analyzed: der gnas par bya ba yin pas gnas te /
translated: that which is to be inhabited.

original: gnas de'i nyen kor ni gnas nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnas de'i nyen kor ni gnas nyid yin no //
translated: The vicinity of that place is the place itself.

original: nyen kor gyi lam ji sring tshun chad gnas nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: nyen kor gyi lam ji sring tshun chad gnas nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How far is the vicinity of the place?

original: de'i phyir 'dom gang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dom gang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be one fathom.

original: phyi rol gyi rtsig pa la sogs pa'i ngos nas brtsams te 'dom gang tshud chad ni gnas de'i nyen kor yin pas de ni gnas nyid dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rtsig pa la sogs pa'i ngos nas brtsams te 'dom gang tshud chad ni gnas de'i nyen kor yin pas de ni gnas nyid dang 'dra'o //
translated: From the outer wall, etc., up to one fathom is the vicinity of that place.

original: gnas ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gnas ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: A place is of two types:

original: g-yogs pa dang ma g-yogs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yogs pa dang ma g-yogs pa'o //
translated: covered and uncovered.

original: de la re zhig ma g-yogs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la re zhig ma g-yogs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to that, first, with reference to the uncovered,

original: steng du nam mkha' la slebs pa man chad do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: steng du nam mkha' la slebs pa man chad do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said to be up to the sky above.

original: gnas steng ma g-yogs pa la ni steng du nam mkha' la mgo bo rgyu ba dag gis slebs par nus pa man chad kyang gnas nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnas steng ma g-yogs pa la ni steng du nam mkha' la mgo bo rgyu ba dag gis slebs par nus pa man chad kyang gnas nyid yin no //
translated: The upper story is the place where one can reach the sky above, and the space above is also the place.

original: g-yogs pa'i dbang du byas nas nang yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: g-yogs pa'i dbang du byas nas nang yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: With regard to the upper story, the space inside is also the place.

original: gnas steng g-yogs pa la ni nang gi nam mkha' gang yin pa de yang gnas nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnas steng g-yogs pa la ni nang gi nam mkha' gang yin pa de yang gnas nyid yin no //
translated: The upper story is the place where one can reach the sky above, and the space inside the upper story is also the place.

original: steng gi yang tog gzhan yang de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: steng gi yang tog gzhan yang de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The upper story is also the upper story of another lower story.

original: 'og khang gi steng gi yang thog gi kha khyer gzhan yang 'og khang de kho na nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'og khang gi steng gi yang thog gi kha khyer gzhan yang 'og khang de kho na nyid yin te /
translated: The upper story of another lower story is also the lower story.

original: nam mkha'i dkyil ni steng gi yang tog thams cad la mngon sum du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil ni steng gi yang tog thams cad la mngon sum du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The space in the middle of the upper story is directly connected to the upper story of all the lower stories.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gal te dge slong rnams 'og khang na gnas par gyur na steng gi yang tog dag tu rung ba'i khang pa bsko bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: gal te dge slong rnams 'og khang na gnas par gyur na steng gi yang tog dag tu rung ba'i khang pa bsko bar mi bya ste /
translated: If the monks are staying in the lower story, they should not assign the upper story as a suitable dwelling,

original: mi 'chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not allowed.

original: 'dir gzhung ni sil bu dag las btsun pa 'og khang gi rung ba'i khang pa lags ba de'i yang tog kyang rung ba'i khang pa lags sam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni sil bu dag las btsun pa 'og khang gi rung ba'i khang pa lags ba de'i yang tog kyang rung ba'i khang pa lags sam /
translated: “Venerable, is the upper story of a suitable house of a monk who lives in the lower story also a suitable house?”

original: nye ba 'khor yang tog kyang yin te /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yang tog kyang yin te /
translated: Upāli, it is also a suitable house.

original: ngos dag kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ngos dag kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The sides are also like that.

original: gzhan gnas pa nyid ni gzhan gyi gnas nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gnas pa nyid ni gzhan gyi gnas nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not the case that the abode of one is the abode of another.

original: bdag po rigs mi @314b mthun pa gzhan gnas par gyur pa nyid yin na bdag po snga ma gzhan gyi gnas nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag po rigs mi @314b mthun pa gzhan gnas par gyur pa nyid yin na bdag po snga ma gzhan gyi gnas nyid ma yin te /
translated: If the abode of one who is a different master becomes the abode of another, the former abode is not the abode of another.

original: dper na dge slong gi gnas sam dge 'dun gyi gnas su khyim pa gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: dper na dge slong gi gnas sam dge 'dun gyi gnas su khyim pa gnas par gyur na /
translated: For example, if a householder lives in the abode of a monk or in the abode of the Saṅgha,

original: 'di ltar dge slong dag de nyid na gnas su zin kyang de dge slong gi gnas nyid ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong dag de nyid na gnas su zin kyang de dge slong gi gnas nyid ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: in that case, although the monk lives there, it is not the abode of a monk.🔽Here the text is:

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa de nyid na dge slong dang bcas shing de nyid na khyim pa dang bcas na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa de nyid na dge slong dang bcas shing de nyid na khyim pa dang bcas na /
translated: “Venerable, if a monk lives there and a householder lives there,

original: der dgung lags pa dang der bsgral ba 'tshal bar bgyi'am 'tshal bar mi bgyi /
analyzed: der dgung lags pa dang der bsgral ba 'tshal bar bgyi'am 'tshal bar mi bgyi /
translated: Should one who is old or who is to be expelled be allowed to stay?

original: nye ba 'khor bza' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor bza' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Upagupta said, “He should be allowed to stay.”

original: gnas stong par byas pa zhig tu gal te dge slong re zhig gnas par gyur na de yang dge slong gi gnas nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnas stong par byas pa zhig tu gal te dge slong re zhig gnas par gyur na de yang dge slong gi gnas nyid yin no //
translated: If a monk stays for a while in an empty monastery, that is also a monk’s dwelling.

original: khyim pa'i rdzas ma ston na ni stong par byas pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: khyim pa'i rdzas ma ston na ni stong par byas pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: But if the property of a layperson is not displayed, it is not an empty dwelling.

original: dge tshul rnams kyi gang zag gi gnas dang dge tshul gyi tshogs spyir dbang ba'i gnas de ni dge slong gi gnas nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dge tshul rnams kyi gang zag gi gnas dang dge tshul gyi tshogs spyir dbang ba'i gnas de ni dge slong gi gnas nyid ma yin no //
translated: A dwelling for novices or a dwelling belonging to a community of novices is not a monk’s dwelling.

original: dge slong gi gnas sam dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gnas na dge tshul tsam gnas su zin kyang de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: dge slong gi gnas sam dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gnas na dge tshul tsam gnas su zin kyang de lta mod kyi /
translated: Even if a novice stays in a monk’s dwelling or in a dwelling belonging to a community of monks,

original: de dge slong gi gnas nyid yin te /
analyzed: de dge slong gi gnas nyid yin te /
translated: that is a monk’s dwelling.

original: dge tshul rnams ni dge slong gi 'khor yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge tshul rnams ni dge slong gi 'khor yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because novices are part of the community of monks.

original: lag nyar blangs pa dang nang du btsos pa dang / dge slong gis btsos pa de dag dus kyi phyir dgag pa mdzad par 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag ni ma bsdus pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di ni sman gyi phyir byas pa yin te /
analyzed: lag nyar blangs pa dang nang du btsos pa dang / dge slong gis btsos pa de dag dus kyi phyir dgag pa mdzad par 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag ni ma bsdus pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di ni sman gyi phyir byas pa yin te /
translated: and those cooked by a fully ordained monk are not included in the sūtra that states:🔽One should keep for life those that are held in the hand, those cooked in the house and those cooked by a fully ordained monk, but not those that are not included.🔽This sūtra was composed for the sake of medicine.🔽Those that are held in the hand, those cooked in the house and those cooked by a fully ordained monk are not included in the sūtra that states:

original: lag nyar blangs pa dang / nang du btsos pa dang / dge slong gis bcos pa de dag dus kyi phyir dgag pa mdzad par zhes bya ba ni /🔽lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa de dag mu ge byung ba la sogs pa'i dus kha cig tu ni bza' bar bya'o zhes gnang ba mdzad la /
analyzed: lag nyar blangs pa dang / nang du btsos pa dang / dge slong gis bcos pa de dag dus kyi phyir dgag pa mdzad par zhes bya ba ni / lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa de dag mu ge byung ba la sogs pa'i dus kha cig tu ni bza' bar bya'o zhes gnang ba mdzad la /
translated: One should keep for life those that are held in the hand, those cooked in the house and those cooked by a fully ordained monk, but not those that are not included.🔽This refers to the permission to eat those that are held in the hand and so on at certain times such as during famine and so on.

original: mu ge byung ba ma yin pa la sogs pa'i dus kha cig tu ni de dag bza' bar mi bya'o zhes dgag pa mdzad pa der ro //
analyzed: mu ge byung ba ma yin pa la sogs pa'i dus kha cig tu ni de dag bza' bar mi bya'o zhes dgag pa mdzad pa der ro //
translated: And it refers to the prohibition to eat those that are held in the hand and so on at certain times such as when famine does not occur and so on.

original: der 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag ni ma bsdus pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba de dag bza' ba'i phyir ni dus kyi bye brag med de /
analyzed: der 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag ni ma bsdus pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba de dag bza' ba'i phyir ni dus kyi bye brag med de /
translated: Those that are to be kept until one is cured are not included in those that are to be kept for life.

original: de ni 'dir spyi'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dir spyi'i don yin no //
translated: This is the general meaning here.

original: dus kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dus kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For the sake of time means🔽that if one keeps medicine, etc.🔽until noon, or until the next day, one should eat it at that time.🔽If one keeps medicine, etc.

original: gung tshigs tshun chad kyi snga dro dang / de phyin chad thun tshod kyi bar gyi dus de gnyis su lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa byas na mu ge la sogs pa'i dus kyi tshe @315a * //
analyzed: gung tshigs tshun chad kyi snga dro dang / de phyin chad thun tshod kyi bar gyi dus de gnyis su lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa byas na mu ge la sogs pa'i dus kyi tshe @315a * //
translated: until noon, one should eat it at that time.🔽If one keeps medicine, etc.

original: na ; dus de nyid du lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa dag bza' bar bya'i /
analyzed: na ; dus de nyid du lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa dag bza' bar bya'i /
translated: until the next day, one should eat it at that time.

original: dus gzhan du ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: dus gzhan du ma yin pa ste /
translated: One should not eat it at another time.🔽If one keeps medicine, etc.

original: snga dro de la sman lag nyar blangs ba la sogs pa byas ba ni snga dro de nyid la bza' bar bya'i /
analyzed: snga dro de la sman lag nyar blangs ba la sogs pa byas ba ni snga dro de nyid la bza' bar bya'i /
translated: until noon, one should eat it at that time.

original: phyed yol phan chad bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: phyed yol phan chad bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not eat it after noon.

original: de bzhin du phyi dro ba'i zas lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa byas pa yang mu ge la sogs pa'i dus kyi tshe thun tshod kyi mtha' tshun chad du bza' bar bya'i thun tshod las yol ba phan chad du bza' bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi dro ba'i zas lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa byas pa yang mu ge la sogs pa'i dus kyi tshe thun tshod kyi mtha' tshun chad du bza' bar bya'i thun tshod las yol ba phan chad du bza' bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: but not after the time has passed.

original: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba byin gyis brlabs pa rnams la ni cho ga 'di med de /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba byin gyis brlabs pa rnams la ni cho ga 'di med de /
translated: The consecrated medicines that are to be kept as long as life lasts are not subject to this rule.

original: de dag la dus yongs su chad pa med pas dus thams cad du bza' bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag la dus yongs su chad pa med pas dus thams cad du bza' bar bya ba yin no //
translated: They are to be taken at all times, since they are not restricted to a particular time.

original: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba byin gyis ma brlabs pa rnams ni dus kyi phyir bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba byin gyis ma brlabs pa rnams ni dus kyi phyir bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The unconsecrated medicines that are to be kept as long as life lasts are included in the time period.

original: 'bags pa ni zas phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bags pa ni zas phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The defiled is half of the food.

original: lhung bzed la sogs pa la zas la sogs pas 'bags pa gang yin pa de ni zas phyed nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: lhung bzed la sogs pa la zas la sogs pas 'bags pa gang yin pa de ni zas phyed nyid yin gyi /
translated: The defiled refers to the food, etc. that is in the begging bowl, etc.

original: zas rdzogs pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zas rdzogs pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is half of the food, but not the whole of the food,

original: lhung bzed la sogs pa ni bza' ba ma yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhung bzed la sogs pa ni bza' ba ma yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the begging bowl, etc. is not food.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis lhung bzed dang / lhung bzed chung du dang / kha gzar dang / tshva khug dang / lhung bzed kyi snod dang / gos dang / man shel dang / khri dang / khri'u dang / phru ba dang / bum pa dang /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis lhung bzed dang / lhung bzed chung du dang / kha gzar dang / tshva khug dang / lhung bzed kyi snod dang / gos dang / man shel dang / khri dang / khri'u dang / phru ba dang / bum pa dang /
translated: Here the text says that if a monk stores a begging bowl, a small begging bowl, a water filter, a medicine bag, a bowl for a begging bowl, a robe, a mirror, a bed, a bench, a water pot, a water jar,

original: ril ba dang / lde mig dang / lde mig kyog po gsog 'jog byas pas 'bags pa za na thams cad nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ril ba dang / lde mig dang / lde mig kyog po gsog 'jog byas pas 'bags pa za na thams cad nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: a key, or a key ring, and then eats from any of them, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'dir za na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir za na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here “if he eats”

original: de dag la zas kyis 'bags pa de za na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag la zas kyis 'bags pa de za na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means if he eats food that is stuck to them.

original: kha dri ma can gyis bza' ba dang btung ba dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha dri ma can gyis bza' ba dang btung ba dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If he eats food or drinks with a dirty mouth”

original: kha'i nang ma dag pas bza' ba dang / btung ba dag zos sam 'thungs na yang zas kyi phyed nyid do //
analyzed: kha'i nang ma dag pas bza' ba dang / btung ba dag zos sam 'thungs na yang zas kyi phyed nyid do //
translated: means that if he eats food or drinks with an unclean mouth, he commits an offense entailing confession for the amount of food that he has eaten or drunk.

original: kha bkrus te zos pa dang 'thungs pa la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: kha bkrus te zos pa dang 'thungs pa la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if he eats or drinks after rinsing his mouth.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis kha ma bkrus par skom 'thungs na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis kha ma bkrus par skom 'thungs na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text means that if a fully ordained monk drinks water without washing his mouth after eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: kha dri ma can du gyur pas zos sam 'thungs na zas kyi phyed nyid de nyes byas so //
analyzed: kha dri ma can du gyur pas zos sam 'thungs na zas kyi phyed nyid de nyes byas so //
translated: If one eats or drinks with a dirty mouth, one commits an offense of wrong conduct for half of the meal.

original: ji tsam gyis na kha dog pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na kha dog pa yin zhe na /
translated: How dirty is the mouth?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / de'i phyi rol na lce ba'am sas kun nas @315b drud de chus bshal na dag pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de'i phyi rol na lce ba'am sas kun nas @315b drud de chus bshal na dag pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If it is dirty, it is purified by licking the lips or by washing with water.

original: kha de'i phyi rol mchu gnyis ni lci ba 'am sas kun nas drud de chus bshal zhing bkrus na dag pa yin no //
analyzed: kha de'i phyi rol mchu gnyis ni lci ba 'am sas kun nas drud de chus bshal zhing bkrus na dag pa yin no //
translated: If the mouth is dirty, it is purified by licking the lips or by washing with water.

original: nang ni chu mkhur ba do'am gsum gyis bshal na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nang ni chu mkhur ba do'am gsum gyis bshal na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The inside is purified by spitting out water three times.

original: kha'i nang ni chu mkhur ba do'am gsum gyis bshal te bor na dag pa yin no /🔽// / bam po nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa /
analyzed: kha'i nang ni chu mkhur ba do'am gsum gyis bshal te bor na dag pa yin no / // / bam po nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa /
translated: If the inside of the mouth is dirty, it is purified by spitting out water three times.

original: lhung bzed ji tsam gyis dag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: lhung bzed ji tsam gyis dag pa yin zhe na /
translated: How dirty is the alms bowl?

original: de'i phyir / lhung bzed ni bsam pa thag bas lan gnyis sam gsum bkru bshal byas na sgra mi snyan kyang dag pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / lhung bzed ni bsam pa thag bas lan gnyis sam gsum bkru bshal byas na sgra mi snyan kyang dag pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If a monk washes his alms bowl with great care, twice or three times, it is pure even if it is noisy.

original: lhung bzed ni bsam pa thag pas gus par byas te /
analyzed: lhung bzed ni bsam pa thag pas gus par byas te /
translated: If a monk washes his alms bowl with great care, with respect,

original: lan gnyis sam gsum bsgyur log bya zhing bkru bshal byas na sgra mi snyan cing sgra sang sang por ma byung du zin kyang dag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: lan gnyis sam gsum bsgyur log bya zhing bkru bshal byas na sgra mi snyan cing sgra sang sang por ma byung du zin kyang dag pa nyid yin no //
translated: twice or three times, it is pure even if it is noisy and not silent.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gcig gis lhung bzed bkrus te sor mos sgra 'byin par byed pa na sgra mi snyan nas de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gcig gis lhung bzed bkrus te sor mos sgra 'byin par byed pa na sgra mi snyan nas de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Here, the text says: A monk washed his alms bowl and made a sound with his finger. He became remorseful,

original: bsam pa thag pas lan gnyis sam gsum bkru bshal bya zhing gal te sgra mi snyan na yang yongs su longs spyad pa kho nar bya ste /
analyzed: bsam pa thag pas lan gnyis sam gsum bkru bshal bya zhing gal te sgra mi snyan na yang yongs su longs spyad pa kho nar bya ste /
translated: and the Bhagavān said, “If you wash it with great care, twice or three times, you should use it even if it is noisy.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: You should not have remorse about this.”

original: rtsi langs pa la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtsi langs pa la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no offense if the color of the dye has faded.

original: lhung bzed dag par byas pa la kha dog gi dreg pa langs pa ni rtsi langs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed dag par byas pa la kha dog gi dreg pa langs pa ni rtsi langs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The color of the dye has faded means that the color of the dye on the washed bowl has faded.

original: de la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense in that case.

original: 'bags pa med par reg pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bags pa med par reg pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is also no offense if it is not stained.

original: lhung bzed bza' bar bya ba la reg kyang 'bags pa med na de la yang nyes pa med do //🔽'dag rdzas sam lci ba'am sa gang yang rung bas lan gsum bkrus pa la snum pa nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhung bzed bza' bar bya ba la reg kyang 'bags pa med na de la yang nyes pa med do // 'dag rdzas sam lci ba'am sa gang yang rung bas lan gsum bkrus pa la snum pa nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is also no offense if the bowl is not stained even though it is touched by food.🔽There is also no offense if it is washed three times with ashes, clay, or some other substance, and it is still oily.

original: lhung bzed 'dag rdzas sam lci bas sam sa dag las gang yang rung bas lan gsum bkrus pa la snum pa nyid yod pa la yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: lhung bzed 'dag rdzas sam lci bas sam sa dag las gang yang rung bas lan gsum bkrus pa la snum pa nyid yod pa la yang nyes pa med do //
translated: There is also no offense if the bowl is washed three times with ashes, clay, or some other substance, and it is still oily.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong gis lhung bzed 'dag rdzas sam lci ba 'am dog sas lan gsum 'khru bar bgyid cing de yang snum zhing snum bag chags par gyur na yongs su longs spyad par bgyi 'am /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong gis lhung bzed 'dag rdzas sam lci ba 'am dog sas lan gsum 'khru bar bgyid cing de yang snum zhing snum bag chags par gyur na yongs su longs spyad par bgyi 'am /
translated: Should he use it?”

original: nye ba 'khor de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: “Upāli, it is the same.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni tha snyad du bya ba'i phyir mi chog pa'i phyir @316a * //
analyzed: de ni tha snyad du bya ba'i phyir mi chog pa'i phyir @316a * //
translated: Because it is not suitable for conventional use.

original: ro ; /'dir 'dag rdzas la sogs pa smos pa ni dpe tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: ro ; /'dir 'dag rdzas la sogs pa smos pa ni dpe tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Here the mention of ash, etc. is just an example.

original: gzhan dag kyang rung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang rung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that other things are also suitable.

original: langs pa bsal bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: langs pa bsal bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “It should be removed if it appears.”

original: de ltar lhung bzed dag par byas pa la snum bag gam tshon rtsi'i bag skem la sogs pa dang phrad pas langs par gyur na bsal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar lhung bzed dag par byas pa la snum bag gam tshon rtsi'i bag skem la sogs pa dang phrad pas langs par gyur na bsal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: If the bowl becomes oily because it comes in contact with oil, dye, or grease, it should be removed.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong zhig la lhung bzed 'phan can zhig yod nas des der khu ba byin len byas pa na snum bag 'thon cing steng du zhag gi nya mig chags shing 'dug nas dge slong de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong zhig la lhung bzed 'phan can zhig yod nas des der khu ba byin len byas pa na snum bag 'thon cing steng du zhag gi nya mig chags shing 'dug nas dge slong de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: steng gi snum bsal te btung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: steng gi snum bsal te btung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Remove the oil from the top and drink it.”

original: 'bags pa'i phyogs de nyid tshe bkru bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bags pa'i phyogs de nyid tshe bkru bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That very part that is soiled should be washed.

original: lhung bzed kyi phyogs gang du zas la sogs pas 'bags par gyur na /
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi phyogs gang du zas la sogs pas 'bags par gyur na /
translated: If a part of the alms-bowl becomes soiled by food, etc.,

original: lhung bzed kyi phyogs gang du 'bags par gyur pa'i phyogs de nyi tshe bkru bar bya ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi phyogs gang du 'bags par gyur pa'i phyogs de nyi tshe bkru bar bya ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: that very part of the alms-bowl that has become soiled should be washed.

original: ril gyis bkru bar ni bya mi dgos so //
analyzed: ril gyis bkru bar ni bya mi dgos so //
translated: It is not necessary to wash the whole thing.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gi lhung bzed 'phan can zhig des 'khru bar byed pha na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gi lhung bzed 'phan can zhig des 'khru bar byed pha na /
translated: Here, the text is as follows: A monk had a cracked alms-bowl. When he washed it,

original: 'phan der 'bras chan gyi du ma bu song ba zhig mthong nas 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
analyzed: 'phan der 'bras chan gyi du ma bu song ba zhig mthong nas 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: shing bus brus te chus lan gnyis sam gsum bshal nas yongs su longs spyad par bya ste /
translated: “Having dug it out with a stick, wash it two or three times with water and use it.

translated: There is no need to feel remorse about this.”🔽“Oil-impregnated vessels and so on should be submerged in a deep pool of water in order to remove the oil” means

analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa snum can dag snum med par bya ba'i phyir chu'i rdzing bu zab mo'i nang du dpyangs te gzhug par bya'o //
translated: oil-impregnated vessels and so on should be submerged in a deep pool of water in order to remove the oil.

original: dus ji srid kyi bar du gzhug par bya zhe na /
analyzed: dus ji srid kyi bar du gzhug par bya zhe na /
translated: For how long should they be submerged?🔽Therefore it says,

original: de'i phyir / nya'am rus sbal lam sbal pa 'am chu srin byis pa gsod dam nya khri pa dag gis ma lus par ldogs kyi bar du bzhag go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / nya'am rus sbal lam sbal pa 'am chu srin byis pa gsod dam nya khri pa dag gis ma lus par ldogs kyi bar du bzhag go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “They should be left there until they are completely turned over by fish, turtles, frogs, alligators, or crocodiles.”

original: ji srid du nya la sogs pa dag gis snum bag ma lus par ldogs par gyur pa de srid kyi bar du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid du nya la sogs pa dag gis snum bag ma lus par ldogs par gyur pa de srid kyi bar du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: As long as the oil is completely removed from the fish, etc., it should be placed in the fire.

original: bsregs pas kyang snum med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsregs pas kyang snum med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa snum can dag yang na mer bsregs pas @316b kyang snum med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: By burning in the fire, even oily things such as pots become devoid of oil.

analyzed: de ltar ma lus par ldogs pa dang bsregs pa dag gis snum med par gyur pa'i bum pa la sogs pa dag ji ltar dag cing gtsang ba nyid du bya zhe na /
translated: How can pots, etc., which have become devoid of oil through being completely removed and burned, be made pure and clean?🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / snum med par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir / snum med par gyur pa ni /

original: bkru bas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bkru bas so zhes bya ba smras te /

translated: A pot, etc., which has become devoid of oil becomes pure and clean through washing.

original: gang gis bkru zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis bkru zhe na /
translated: By what is it washed?🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / 'dag rdzas sam lci bas 'dag pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'dag rdzas sam lci bas 'dag pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /

original: bum pa la sogs pa snum med par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa snum med par gyur pa ni /

analyzed: 'dag rdzas la sogs pas bkrus na dag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //

original: lan tshva la sogs pa tshva chu dang 'gyur byed kyi chu dang rnyog chur gyur pa ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lan tshva la sogs pa tshva chu dang 'gyur byed kyi chu dang rnyog chur gyur pa ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Salt, etc., that has become salty water, acidic water, or turbid water is half.

analyzed: lan tshva dang 'gyur byed dang rnyog pa dag las /
translated: From salt, acid, and turbid water,🔽salt becomes salty water, acid becomes acidic water, and turbid water becomes turbid water.🔽It is half if one stores it or drinks it without accepting it.

original: lan tshva tshva chur gyur pa dang / 'gyur byed 'gyur byed kyi chu ra gyur pa dang / rnyog pa rnyog chur gyur pa gsog 'jog byas pa'am byin len ma byas par 'thung ba ni phyed nyid de nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lan tshva tshva chur gyur pa dang / 'gyur byed 'gyur byed kyi chu ra gyur pa dang / rnyog pa rnyog chur gyur pa gsog 'jog byas pa'am byin len ma byas par 'thung ba ni phyed nyid de nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means it is a minor offense.

original: de ni thams cad la dus ma yin bar yang rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni thams cad la dus ma yin bar yang rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is suitable even at all times.

original: lan tshva la sogs pa tshva chu la sogs par gyur pa de ni nad pa dang nad pa ma yin ba thams cad la dus ma yin par byin len byas na ma btsags par yang rung pa nyid de nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
analyzed: lan tshva la sogs pa tshva chu la sogs par gyur pa de ni nad pa dang nad pa ma yin ba thams cad la dus ma yin par byin len byas na ma btsags par yang rung pa nyid de nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
translated: If salt and so on become salty water and so forth, then it is permissible to take it out of time for all who are sick and not sick, without straining it. The meaning is that there is no fault.

original: // lan tshva dang / 'gyur byed rang gi bya ba mi byed pa dag la ni med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // lan tshva dang / 'gyur byed rang gi bya ba mi byed pa dag la ni med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In salt and sour that do not perform their own function, there is none.

original: de gnyis lan tshva'i bya ba mi byed pa dang / 'gyur byed kyi bya ba mi byed pa dag la ni phyed nyid kyang med pa nyid de de la ni nyes byas kyi ltung ba yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gnyis lan tshva'i bya ba mi byed pa dang / 'gyur byed kyi bya ba mi byed pa dag la ni phyed nyid kyang med pa nyid de de la ni nyes byas kyi ltung ba yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In those two, salt that does not perform the function of salt and sour that does not perform the function of sour, there is none even in half a measure. The meaning is that there is no offense of a minor fault.

analyzed: 'dir mdo snga ma gsum la lan tshva dang 'gyur byed ces smos la ni lhan cig skyes pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, in the first three sūtras, salt and sour are said to be innate, and should be understood as such.

translated: Among them, that which is established by the power of the source is taught by the following passage from the Kṣudraka Collection: “That which is not manifest in the source is not the number of existing things.”

original: btab pa'i dbang gis nye bar bsgrubs pa de la ni mi mngon yang ltung byed rdzogs pa'i byed pa po nyid yin par rig par bya'o //🔽lhan cig @317a * //

analyzed: chu rnyog pa can ni ka ta ka'i 'bras bus shin tu dangs par 'gyur te /

analyzed: zan gyis kyang chu de shin tu dangs par 'gyur ro //

translated: The flour that is to be put in the water in order to make it very clear is anointed with oil in order to prevent it from being destroyed.
