analyzed: 'byung khungs dag tu btab pa mi mngon pa ni yod pa'i grangs nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The water that is put in the source is not counted as existing.

original: 'byung khungs zhes bya ba 'byung pa'i gnas dag tu zas btab @317b pa mi mngon ba ni yod ba'i grangs nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung khungs zhes bya ba 'byung pa'i gnas dag tu zas btab @317b pa mi mngon ba ni yod ba'i grangs nyid ma yin te /
translated: The water that is put in the source, which is the place of origin, is not counted as existing.

original: 'di ltar med pa'i grangs nyid kho na yin bas de la ni med pa'i tha snyad kho nar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar med pa'i grangs nyid kho na yin bas de la ni med pa'i tha snyad kho nar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it is counted as non-existent, it is said that only the term non-existent should be used for it.🔽This is the meaning.

original: 'dis ni gzhung las dus ston la dge slong mang po 'dus pa dag khron pa dag tu lhung bzed dag 'khru bar byed pa na /
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhung las dus ston la dge slong mang po 'dus pa dag khron pa dag tu lhung bzed dag 'khru bar byed pa na /
translated: Here, in the scriptures, many monks gather for a festival and wash their alms bowls in a well.

original: kun dga' rab pa dang dge bsnyen dag gis de dag tu zhun mar dang 'bru mar dang zho dang sbrang rtsi'i bum pa dag 'khru bar byed pa'i steng du snum gyi nya mig chil chil po dag chags par gyur nas dge slong dag 'gyod pa skyes nas mi
analyzed: kun dga' rab pa dang dge bsnyen dag gis de dag tu zhun mar dang 'bru mar dang zho dang sbrang rtsi'i bum pa dag 'khru bar byed pa'i steng du snum gyi nya mig chil chil po dag chags par gyur nas dge slong dag 'gyod pa skyes nas mi
translated: The monks, feeling guilty, did not drink the water.

original: 'thung ba'i skabs de dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'thung ba'i skabs de dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag gis 'bags pa des zas kyi bya ba byar mi rung gis /
analyzed: dge slong dag gis 'bags pa des zas kyi bya ba byar mi rung gis /
translated: “Monks, it is not suitable to use food that is contaminated.

original: bsal la btung bar bya ste /
analyzed: bsal la btung bar bya ste /
translated: You should remove the contamination and drink it.🔽There is no need to feel guilty about this.”

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa de bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa de bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This is the summary of that.

original: de lta bas na chu dag gi nang du zan la sogs pa bcug pa mi mngon ba nyid ni 'byung khungs su btab pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na chu dag gi nang du zan la sogs pa bcug pa mi mngon ba nyid ni 'byung khungs su btab pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, if rice and so on is put in water and is not visible, it is considered to be a source.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dres par gyur na de nyi tshe ba bsal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dres par gyur na de nyi tshe ba bsal ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is mixed in one place, it is considered to be a temporary contamination.

original: zas kyi phyogs gcig tu rung ba ma yin nam byin len ma byas par 'dres par gyur na phyogs de nyid tshe bsal bar bya ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: zas kyi phyogs gcig tu rung ba ma yin nam byin len ma byas par 'dres par gyur na phyogs de nyid tshe bsal bar bya ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: Is it not suitable as one part of food? If it becomes mixed without being received, that part itself should be removed.

original: lhag ma gzhan ni bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma gzhan ni bza' bar bya'o //
translated: The rest should be eaten.

original: kha'i mchus reg pa nyid la ni than kor yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha'i mchus reg pa nyid la ni than kor yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is touched by the lips, the surrounding area is also defiled.

original: zas kha'i mchus reg par gyur pa nyid la ni gang du reg pa'i phyogs de nyid dang de'i than kor yang bsal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: zas kha'i mchus reg par gyur pa nyid la ni gang du reg pa'i phyogs de nyid dang de'i than kor yang bsal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: If food is touched by the lips, the area touched and its surrounding area should be removed.

original: mdo snga ma shos kyis ni lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa bsal to //
analyzed: mdo snga ma shos kyis ni lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa bsal to //
translated: The former sūtra removes the fault of holding it in the hand, etc.

original: phyi ma shos kyis ni btsog pa nyid kyi nyes pa bsal to //
analyzed: phyi ma shos kyis ni btsog pa nyid kyi nyes pa bsal to //
translated: The latter removes the fault of defilement.

original: de dang 'brel ba'i rgyun gyis reg pa ni de la reg pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dang 'brel ba'i rgyun gyis reg pa ni de la reg pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Contact with the continuum connected to it is not contact with it.

original: ril ba la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'i 'o ma la sogs pa'i rgyun gyis lhung bzed la reg pa ni ril ba la sogs pa de la reg pa nyid kyang ma yin la ril pa la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'i'o ma la sogs pa dag btsog pa nyid
analyzed: ril ba la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'i 'o ma la sogs pa'i rgyun gyis lhung bzed la reg pa ni ril ba la sogs pa de la reg pa nyid kyang ma yin la ril pa la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'i'o ma la sogs pa dag btsog pa nyid
translated: It is not that the stream of milk and so on connected to the water vessel and so on touches the alms bowl, but the milk and so on connected to the water vessel and so on is not pure.

original: du gyur pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: du gyur pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The stream of milk, etc. that is connected with the water pot, etc. does not touch the alms bowl, nor does the milk, etc. that is connected with the water pot, etc. become defiled.

original: mdo 'di ni btsog pa nyid spang ba'i phyir byas so //
analyzed: mdo 'di ni btsog pa nyid spang ba'i phyir byas so //
translated: This sūtra was composed in order to eliminate the idea that the alms bowl is defiled.

original: nor ba dang brjed pas kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /🔽nor bas bza' bar bya ba la sogs pa la reg pa dang brjed pas reg pa ni bza' bar bya ba la sogs pa la reg pa @318a * //
analyzed: nor ba dang brjed pas kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni / nor bas bza' bar bya ba la sogs pa la reg pa dang brjed pas reg pa ni bza' bar bya ba la sogs pa la reg pa @318a * //
translated: Nor is it by mistake or by forgetfulness.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: The touching of what is to be eaten, etc. by mistake or by forgetfulness is not the touching of what is to be eaten, etc.

original: de gnyis kyis sbos pa gzhag pa'i phyir yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis sbos pa gzhag pa'i phyir yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Nor is it in order to set aside what has been set aside by those two.

original: nor ba dang brjed pa de gnyis kyis bza' bar bya ba la sogs pa gnas nas spos pa phyir gzhag par bya ba'i don du reg pa yang reg pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: nor ba dang brjed pa de gnyis kyis bza' bar bya ba la sogs pa gnas nas spos pa phyir gzhag par bya ba'i don du reg pa yang reg pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The touching of what is to be eaten, etc. in order to set aside what has been set aside by those two, mistake and forgetfulness, is not the touching.

original: mdo 'di ni lag nyar blangs pa nyid spang ba'i phyir byas so //
analyzed: mdo 'di ni lag nyar blangs pa nyid spang ba'i phyir byas so //
translated: This sūtra was composed in order to abandon the very grasping of the hand.

original: gnas kyi thag shin tu nye bar bskur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas kyi thag shin tu nye bar bskur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The place should be very close to the one who is sent.

original: nor ba dang brjed pa dag gis bza' bar bya ba la sogs pa gnas nas spos pa de'i phyir gzhag bar bya ba'i don du bskur bar bya ba yang gnas gang du bar skabs kyi thag shin tu nye ba yod pa der bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: nor ba dang brjed pa dag gis bza' bar bya ba la sogs pa gnas nas spos pa de'i phyir gzhag bar bya ba'i don du bskur bar bya ba yang gnas gang du bar skabs kyi thag shin tu nye ba yod pa der bskur bar bya ste /
translated: Because of error and forgetfulness, the food, etc. should be moved from the place. Therefore, the meaning of the placement should be sent to the place where there is a very close interval.

original: gnas kyi thag shin tu ring bar khyer na de la reg pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas kyi thag shin tu ring bar khyer na de la reg pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the place is carried to a very distant place, there is the fault of contact with it.

original: g-yel bas lag nyar blangs pa nyid dang byin len blangs pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: g-yel bas lag nyar blangs pa nyid dang byin len blangs pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The very grasping of the hand and the very taking of the gift are not neglected.

original: g-yel ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: g-yel ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Neglect is

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'dul ba la ma mos ba'am the tshom za bas bslab pa'i gzhi thams cad la g-yel ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'dul ba la ma mos ba'am the tshom za bas bslab pa'i gzhi thams cad la g-yel ba yin gyi /
translated: not having faith in the Buddha's discipline or having doubts about it, one neglects all the bases of training.

original: phan ba byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phan ba byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a benefit that has arisen.

original: des lag nyar blangs pa yang lag nyar blangs pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: des lag nyar blangs pa yang lag nyar blangs pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: That which is taken up by him is not just taken up.

original: des byin len byas pa yang byin len byas pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: des byin len byas pa yang byin len byas pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: That which is received by him is not just received.

original: byin len stobs par 'os pa dang 'brel ba ma bral ba'i blangs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: byin len stobs par 'os pa dang 'brel ba ma bral ba'i blangs pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: That which is taken up by one who is connected with a person who is suitable to receive is not disconnected.

original: bza' bar bya ba gang la byin len stobs par 'os pa'i gang zag dang 'brel ba gang yin ba de dang ji srid du ma bral ba de srid kyi bar du bza' bar bya ba de'i blang bar bya ba yang lag nyar blangs pa nyid kyang ma yin
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba gang la byin len stobs par 'os pa'i gang zag dang 'brel ba gang yin ba de dang ji srid du ma bral ba de srid kyi bar du bza' bar bya ba de'i blang bar bya ba yang lag nyar blangs pa nyid kyang ma yin
translated: That which is to be eaten is connected with the person who is suitable to receive. As long as it is not disconnected from that, for that long, that which is to be eaten is not just taken up.

original: la / byin len byas pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: la / byin len byas pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: That which is received is not just received.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: byin len stobs pa'i gang zag gis bza' bar bya ba bzung ba gang yin pa de srid du des reg cing 'dzin gyi bar du de lag nyar blangs pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: byin len stobs pa'i gang zag gis bza' bar bya ba bzung ba gang yin pa de srid du des reg cing 'dzin gyi bar du de lag nyar blangs pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: That which is to be eaten is taken up by the person who is suitable to receive. As long as it is not disconnected from that, for that long, that which is to be eaten is not just taken up.

original: byin len byas pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: byin len byas pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: That which is received is not just received.

original: des bzung ba'i thag pa la sogs pa dang 'brel ba nyid ni 'brel ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des bzung ba'i thag pa la sogs pa dang 'brel ba nyid ni 'brel ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The connection with the rope, etc. that it apprehends is the connection.

original: byin len stobs par 'os pa'i gang zag des thag pa la sogs pa gang bzung ba'i thag pa la sogs pa de dang zas su 'brel pa nyid yin na zas dang 'brel pa nyid yin no //🔽sdom pas mnyam par lta ba tha mi dad pa dag gis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / byin len byas pa dang / lag nyar blangs @318b ba dag ni gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byin len stobs par 'os pa'i gang zag des thag pa la sogs pa gang bzung ba'i thag pa la sogs pa de dang zas su 'brel pa nyid yin na zas dang 'brel pa nyid yin no // sdom pas mnyam par lta ba tha mi dad pa dag gis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / byin len byas pa dang / lag nyar blangs @318b ba dag ni gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the food is connected with the rope, etc. that is held by the person who is fit to receive the gift, then it is connected with the food.🔽The storage, the receiving of the gift, and the holding in hand are the same for those who have the same view and vows.

original: sdom pas mnyam ba'i dge slong dag dang / dge slong ma dag dang / dge slong ma lta ba tha mi dad pa dag gis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / byin len byas pa dang / lag nyar blangs pa dag ni gcig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sdom pas mnyam ba'i dge slong dag dang / dge slong ma dag dang / dge slong ma lta ba tha mi dad pa dag gis gsog 'jog byas pa dang / byin len byas pa dang / lag nyar blangs pa dag ni gcig pa nyid yin no //
translated: The storage, the receiving of the gift, and the holding in hand are the same for monks and nuns who have the same view and vows.

original: dge slong gcig gis gsog 'jog byas pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag dge slong gzhan thams cad kyi yang yin la /
analyzed: dge slong gcig gis gsog 'jog byas pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag dge slong gzhan thams cad kyi yang yin la /
translated: One monk’s storage of goods and so on is also that of all other monks.🔽Similarly, one nun’s storage of goods and so on is also that of all other nuns, and one female novice’s storage of goods and so on is also that of all other female novices.

original: de bzhin du dge slong ma gcig gis gsog 'jog byas pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang dge slong ma gzhan thams cad kyi yin pa dang / dge slong ma gcig gis gsog 'jog byas pa la sogs pa gang dag yin ba de dag kyang dge slob ma gzhan thams cad kyi yin par de dag nang mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong ma gcig gis gsog 'jog byas pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang dge slong ma gzhan thams cad kyi yin pa dang / dge slong ma gcig gis gsog 'jog byas pa la sogs pa gang dag yin ba de dag kyang dge slob ma gzhan thams cad kyi yin par de dag nang mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are similar in that they are equal.🔽They are equal in that they are similar in view.

original: dge slong dang dge slong ma dang dge slob ma sdom pas mtshungs pa de dag kyang lta ba tha dad par gyur na ni gsog 'jog la sogs pa yang mi gcig par 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'dir lta ba tha mi dad pa dag gi zhes bya ba smos
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong ma dang dge slob ma sdom pas mtshungs pa de dag kyang lta ba tha dad par gyur na ni gsog 'jog la sogs pa yang mi gcig par 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'dir lta ba tha mi dad pa dag gi zhes bya ba smos
translated: If they are equal in that they are similar in view, but are not equal in that they are similar in storage of goods and so on, then they are not equal in that they are similar in view.

original: so // lta ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa rjes su khas ma blangs par rjes su khas blangs pa'i byin len bgyis pa 'tshal bar bgyi'am /
analyzed: so // lta ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa rjes su khas ma blangs par rjes su khas blangs pa'i byin len bgyis pa 'tshal bar bgyi'am /
translated: “Venerable, is it permissible to accept the gift of a monk who has not accepted the view of one who has accepted it?”

original: nye ba 'khor mi bya'o //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi bya'o //
translated: “Upāli, it is not permissible.”

original: btsun pa rjes su khas blangs pas rjes su khas ma blangs pa'i byin len bgyis 'tshal bar bgyi'am /
analyzed: btsun pa rjes su khas blangs pas rjes su khas ma blangs pa'i byin len bgyis 'tshal bar bgyi'am /
translated: “Venerable, is it permissible to accept the gift of one who has accepted the view of a monk who has not accepted it?”

original: nye ba 'khor mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Upāli, it is not permissible.”

original: mchog dang mchog ma yin par ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchog dang mchog ma yin par ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The best and worst.

original: sdom pas zhes bya par sbyar te /
analyzed: sdom pas zhes bya par sbyar te /
translated: This is applied to “through vows.”

original: mchog dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchog dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The best is

original: sdom pa mchog dang ldan pa dang ngo ;
analyzed: sdom pa mchog dang ldan pa dang ngo ;
translated: endowed with the best vows.

original: / mchog ma yin par ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / mchog ma yin par ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The worst is

original: sdom pa mchog ma yin ba dang ldan par gcig nyid do //
analyzed: sdom pa mchog ma yin ba dang ldan par gcig nyid do //
translated: endowed with the worst vows.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: sdom pa mchog dang ldan pa'i dge slong ma dang bslab pa byin pa mo dang / sdom pa mchog ma yin pa dang ldan ba'i dge slob mar ni gso ga 'jog byas pa la sogs pa gcig pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: sdom pa mchog dang ldan pa'i dge slong ma dang bslab pa byin pa mo dang / sdom pa mchog ma yin pa dang ldan ba'i dge slob mar ni gso ga 'jog byas pa la sogs pa gcig pa nyid yin la /
translated: The nun who possesses the supreme vow, the probationary nun who has been given the precepts, and the female novice who possesses the non-supreme vow are the same in that they are allowed to store for one month.

original: sdom pa mchog ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i dge slob ma dang // sdom pa mchog dang ldan ba'i dge slong ma dang / bslab pa byin pa mor ni gsog 'jog byas pa la sogs pa gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: sdom pa mchog ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i dge slob ma dang // sdom pa mchog dang ldan ba'i dge slong ma dang / bslab pa byin pa mor ni gsog 'jog byas pa la sogs pa gcig pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The female novice who possesses the non-supreme vow, the nun who possesses the supreme vow, and the probationary nun are not the same in that they are not allowed to store.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong ma dang bslab pa byin ba mos gsog @319a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong ma dang bslab pa byin ba mos gsog @319a * //
translated: Here the text says: The nun and the probationary nun who have stored

original: 'jog byas pa ni dge slob ma'i gsog 'jog byas pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'jog byas pa ni dge slob ma'i gsog 'jog byas pa nyid yin la /
translated: are the same in that they are female novices who have stored.

original: dge slob mas gsog 'jog byas pa ni de gnyis kyis gsog 'jog byas pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slob mas gsog 'jog byas pa ni de gnyis kyis gsog 'jog byas pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The female novice who has stored is not the same in that she is not one who has stored for those two.

original: sdom pas mnyam pa dag gi ni gcig pa nyid yin no zhes smos pas skyes pa dang bud med dag gi yang gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sdom pas mnyam pa dag gi ni gcig pa nyid yin no zhes smos pas skyes pa dang bud med dag gi yang gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Since it is said that vows are the same for those of equal status, it is implied that vows are the same for males and females.

original: skyes pa dang bud med dag ni phan tshun khyim pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽dper na khyim pas lag nyar byas pa dang / byin len byas pa dang / gsog 'jog byas pa dge slong la sogs pa'i lag nyar blangs pa dang / byin len byas pa dang / gsog 'jog byas pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du /🔽dge slong mas byas pa yang dge slong dang bslab pa byin pa'i lag nyar blangs pa dang / byin len byas pa dang / gsog 'jog byas pa ma yin la /
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med dag ni phan tshun khyim pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba smras te / dper na khyim pas lag nyar byas pa dang / byin len byas pa dang / gsog 'jog byas pa dge slong la sogs pa'i lag nyar blangs pa dang / byin len byas pa dang / gsog 'jog byas pa nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du / dge slong mas byas pa yang dge slong dang bslab pa byin pa'i lag nyar blangs pa dang / byin len byas pa dang / gsog 'jog byas pa ma yin la /
translated: But this is refuted by the statement: Males and females are like laypeople.🔽For example, laypeople hold things in their hands, consume food and store things, but monks do not hold things in their hands, consume food and store things.🔽Similarly, that which is held in the hands, consumed and stored by nuns is not held in the hands, consumed and stored by monks and those who have received the precepts.

original: dge slong gis byas pa yang dge slong ma dang / bslab pa byin pa mo dang / dge slob ma rnams kyis ma yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis byas pa yang dge slong ma dang / bslab pa byin pa mo dang / dge slob ma rnams kyis ma yin no //
translated: That which is held in the hands, consumed and stored by monks is not held in the hands, consumed and stored by nuns, those who have received the precepts and female novices.

original: dge tshul dag gis de la reg pa nas sbed pa'i bar la nyes par 'gyur ba de bzhin no zhes bya ba la dge tshul dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge tshul dag gis de la reg pa nas sbed pa'i bar la nyes par 'gyur ba de bzhin no zhes bya ba la dge tshul dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: “ Novices” means

original: dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dag go //
analyzed: dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dag go //
translated: novices and female novices.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Their” means

original: dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dag dbang ba'i bza' bar byas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dag dbang ba'i bza' bar byas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: the food, etc., belonging to novices and female novices.

original: de la reg pa nas sbed pa'i bar la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la reg pa nas sbed pa'i bar la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Touching it, etc., up to concealing it” means

original: dge slong gis reg pa nas sbed pa'i bdag nyid kyi reg pa'i bar la'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis reg pa nas sbed pa'i bdag nyid kyi reg pa'i bar la'o //
translated: from touching it up to concealing it, as in the case of the monks.

original: nyes par 'gyur ba ni de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyes par 'gyur ba ni de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ The same is true” means

original: dge slong la nyes par 'gyur ba yang dge tshul dag bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong la nyes par 'gyur ba yang dge tshul dag bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: that the offense for the monks is to be understood as it is for the novices.

original: dper na dge slong dbang ba'i bza' bar bya ba la /
analyzed: dper na dge slong dbang ba'i bza' bar bya ba la /
translated: For example, it is like the case of food belonging to a monk.

original: dge tshul dag gis reg pa lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dge tshul dag gis reg pa lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: The offense for novices touching it, holding it in their hands, etc., is not the same as for the monks.

original: dge tshul dbang ba'i bza' bar bya ba la dge slong dag gis reg pa la yang lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur te /🔽dge tshul dbang ba gang yin pa de dge slong gis sbed par byed du zin kyang des dge slong nyid dang dge slong gzhan dag la rung ba ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge tshul dbang ba'i bza' bar bya ba la dge slong dag gis reg pa la yang lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa'i nyes par mi 'gyur te / dge tshul dbang ba gang yin pa de dge slong gis sbed par byed du zin kyang des dge slong nyid dang dge slong gzhan dag la rung ba ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur la /
translated: Also, when the food belonging to a novice monk is touched by fully ordained monks, there is no fault of holding it in one's hand and so on.🔽Even if a fully ordained monk hides what belongs to a novice monk, it is not unsuitable for that fully ordained monk or other fully ordained monks.

original: dge @319b tshul ma dbang ba gang yin ba de dge slong mas sbed par byed du zin kyang des dge slong ma de nyid dang dge slong ma gzhan dag la rung ba ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge @319b tshul ma dbang ba gang yin ba de dge slong mas sbed par byed du zin kyang des dge slong ma de nyid dang dge slong ma gzhan dag la rung ba ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Even if a fully ordained nun hides what belongs to a novice nun, it is not unsuitable for that fully ordained nun or other fully ordained nuns.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pas byin pa na btang ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pas byin pa na btang ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is given with dependence, it is not relinquished.

original: lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa'i rdzas de yang phyir blang ngo snyam pa'i 'dod pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis phar byin pa ni btang ba nyid ma yin te bsam pa thag pa nas ma btang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa'i rdzas de yang phyir blang ngo snyam pa'i 'dod pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis phar byin pa ni btang ba nyid ma yin te bsam pa thag pa nas ma btang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, the substance that is taken into one's possession and so on, if one gives it with a mind that has the desire to take it back, it is not giving, because it is not given from the heart.

original: ltos pa med par btang ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ltos pa med par btang ba la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Giving without regard is half, when there is regard.

original: la gnyar blangs pa la sogs pa'i rdzas ltos pa med par btang ba gang yin pa de la yang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na byin len byas te zos pa'i tshe phyed nyid de nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: la gnyar blangs pa la sogs pa'i rdzas ltos pa med par btang ba gang yin pa de la yang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na byin len byas te zos pa'i tshe phyed nyid de nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Whatever substance, such as what is taken into one's possession and so on, is given without regard, that is half, when there is regard, when one eats it after receiving it in the mouth.

original: de'i phyir de blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, one should not take it.

original: gang gi phyir lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa'i rdzas ltos pa med pa'i sems kyis btang ba de yang ltos pa'i sems kyis phyir slong na nyes byas su 'gyur ba de'i phyir de bza' ba'i phyir bslang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa'i rdzas ltos pa med pa'i sems kyis btang ba de yang ltos pa'i sems kyis phyir slong na nyes byas su 'gyur ba de'i phyir de bza' ba'i phyir bslang bar mi bya ste /
translated: Because if one gives without regard to the substance, such as what is held in the hand, and then takes it back with a mind that is regardful, one commits an offense. Therefore, one should not take back what is given to eat.

original: yang slong na gdon mi za bar ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang slong na gdon mi za bar ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one takes it back, then one will certainly generate a mind that is regardful.

original: shes bzhin du mi blang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes bzhin du mi blang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not take it back knowingly.

original: gang gi phyir ltos ba med par btang ba de shes bzhin du phyir blangs na ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur la mi shes na mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir shes bzhin du mi blang ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ltos ba med par btang ba de shes bzhin du phyir blangs na ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur la mi shes na mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir shes bzhin du mi blang ste /
translated: Because if one takes back what was given without regard, but with a mind that is regardful, then one will have a mind that is regardful. If one does not know, then one will not. Therefore, one should not take it back knowingly.

original: mi shes pas blangs pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mi shes pas blangs pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one takes it back unknowingly.

original: rigs pa 'di nyid kyis na gsog 'jog byas pa dang / lag nyar blangs pa dang / nang du zhag lon pa dang ; nang du btsos pa dang / dge slong gis btsos pa la sogs pa dag kyang bsam pa thag pa nas tshig bzhin byed pa gzhan la btang na rung ba ma yin pa nyid dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rigs pa 'di nyid kyis na gsog 'jog byas pa dang / lag nyar blangs pa dang / nang du zhag lon pa dang ; nang du btsos pa dang / dge slong gis btsos pa la sogs pa dag kyang bsam pa thag pa nas tshig bzhin byed pa gzhan la btang na rung ba ma yin pa nyid dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: By this very reasoning, it is not proper to give to others what has been stored up, what has been kept in hand, what has been kept overnight, what has been cooked overnight, what has been cooked by a monk, and so on, if one has acted in accordance with the words with a firm intention.

original: de'i pa phyir de zos na nye sa pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de'i pa phyir de zos na nye sa pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, if one eats it, there is no fault at all.🔽Here, the text of the Vinaya says:

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis kun dga' rab ba'am dge tshul la zas stsal ba de gnyis kyis de nyid la slar stsal na 'tshal bar bgyi'am /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis kun dga' rab ba'am dge tshul la zas stsal ba de gnyis kyis de nyid la slar stsal na 'tshal bar bgyi'am /
translated: “Venerable, if a monk gives food to a novice or a novice monk, and if the two give it back to him, should he eat it?

original: gal te mngon par ma bsams na bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te mngon par ma bsams na bza' bar bya'o //
translated: If he does not think about it, he should eat it.

original: bslang bar bgyi'am /
analyzed: bslang bar bgyi'am /
translated: Should he ask for it?

original: nye ba 'khor mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽mngon par ma bsams na zhes bya ba ni 'thob bo @320a * //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // mngon par ma bsams na zhes bya ba ni 'thob bo @320a * //
translated: Upāli, he should not.”🔽“If he does not think about it” means “if he obtains it.”

original: snyam du yid kyis ma bsams na'o //
analyzed: snyam du yid kyis ma bsams na'o //
translated: If he does not think with the mind, “I will obtain it.”

original: gleng gzhi dag las kyang ltos pa dang bcas pa zos na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gleng gzhi dag las kyang ltos pa dang bcas pa zos na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “If one eats what is related to the field of cultivation, etc.”🔽“If the condition of the field of cultivation, etc. is not spoiled, then the mere contact is not a transgression.”

original: shas mnos pa de brub pa'i phyir reg pa ni rkyen de lta bu dag yod na rung ba ma yin ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /🔽zhing ba dag las 'bras la sogs pa'i thog shas thob pa de dag mnod ba'i phyir de la reg pa ni rung ba ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shas mnos pa de brub pa'i phyir reg pa ni rkyen de lta bu dag yod na rung ba ma yin ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni / zhing ba dag las 'bras la sogs pa'i thog shas thob pa de dag mnod ba'i phyir de la reg pa ni rung ba ma yin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the condition of the field of cultivation, etc. is not spoiled, then the mere contact is not a transgression.🔽For example, if the condition of the harvest, etc. is not spoiled, then the mere contact is not a transgression.🔽Similarly, if the condition of the harvest, etc. is not spoiled, then the mere contact is not a transgression.🔽“If the condition of the field of cultivation, etc. is spoiled, then the mere contact is a transgression.”🔽“If the condition of the field of cultivation, etc. is spoiled, then the mere contact is a transgression.”

original: de bzhin du 'bras la sogs pa mnos pa dag bang ba la sogs pa dag tu brub ba'i phyir reg pa yang rung ba ma yin ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //🔽ci dus thams cad du 'am zhen de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras la sogs pa mnos pa dag bang ba la sogs pa dag tu brub ba'i phyir reg pa yang rung ba ma yin ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro // ci dus thams cad du 'am zhen de'i phyir /

original: rkyen de lta bu dag yod na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rkyen de lta bu dag yod na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “If the condition of the field of cultivation, etc. is spoiled, then the mere contact is a transgression.”🔽“If the

original: chud za ba'i rkyen dag nye bar gyur pa'am bsnyen bar ma rdzogs pa dag med dam 'brub par byed pa gzhan dag med pa la sogs pa'i rkyen de lta bu dag yod na'o //
analyzed: chud za ba'i rkyen dag nye bar gyur pa'am bsnyen bar ma rdzogs pa dag med dam 'brub par byed pa gzhan dag med pa la sogs pa'i rkyen de lta bu dag yod na'o //
translated: or if the conditions for its destruction are present, or if the conditions for its completion are not present, or if there are no other conditions for its destruction, etc.

original: shing rta la ni kha lo ba'i stan ma gtogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shing rta la ni kha lo ba'i stan ma gtogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the case of a cart, except for the seat of the driver.

original: 'di dag thams cad kyang rkyen de lta bu dag yod na zhes bya ba'i rjes su sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyang rkyen de lta bu dag yod na zhes bya ba'i rjes su sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that all of these are to be supplied with the phrase “if the conditions for its destruction are present.”

original: bza' bar bya ba bkal ba'i shing rta la reg par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba bkal ba'i shing rta la reg par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not touch the food that is to be eaten which is in the cart.

original: gal te de la rkyen de lta bu dag yod par gyur na de'i tshe na kha lo ba'i stan 'ba' zhig ma gtogs pa nyid kyi shing rta la reg par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de la rkyen de lta bu dag yod par gyur na de'i tshe na kha lo ba'i stan 'ba' zhig ma gtogs pa nyid kyi shing rta la reg par bya'o //
translated: If the conditions for its destruction are present, then one should touch the cart except for the seat of the driver alone.

original: shing rta nyi tshe la reg pas ni shing rta'i nang na 'dug pa'i zas mi rung ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing rta nyi tshe la reg pas ni shing rta'i nang na 'dug pa'i zas mi rung ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By touching the cart alone, the food in the cart does not become unfit to eat.

original: de gang ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de gang ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, if it is full.

original: 'bras la sogs pas gang ba'i shing rta la yang mi reg tu mi rung ba'i phyir rkyen de lta bu dag yod na de'i tshe kha lo ba'i stan de ma gtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras la sogs pas gang ba'i shing rta la yang mi reg tu mi rung ba'i phyir rkyen de lta bu dag yod na de'i tshe kha lo ba'i stan de ma gtogs pa nyid do //
translated: Because it is not suitable to touch a cart filled with grain, etc., if such conditions exist, then at that time, except for the seat of the driver.

original: nad pa gzhan pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nad pa gzhan pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, for another sick person.

original: zas kyis stong ba'i shing rtar nad pa bzhon zhing brgal ba la yang dge slong gis mi reg tu mi rung ba'i rkyen de lta bu dag yod na de'i tshe yang kha lo ba'i stan de ma gtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: zas kyis stong ba'i shing rtar nad pa bzhon zhing brgal ba la yang dge slong gis mi reg tu mi rung ba'i rkyen de lta bu dag yod na de'i tshe yang kha lo ba'i stan de ma gtogs pa nyid do //
translated: If such conditions exist, then at that time, except for the seat of the driver, it is not suitable for a monk to touch a sick person riding in a cart filled with food.

original: grul ni ru skya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: grul ni ru skya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A boat is a ferry.

original: bza' bar bya ba bcug pa'i gru dang 'bras la sogs pas gang ba'i gru dang grur nad pa gzhug pa la yang de slong gis mi reg tu mi rung ba'i rkyen de lta bu dag yod na de'i tshe gru de la ni ru skya ma gtogs pa nyid
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba bcug pa'i gru dang 'bras la sogs pas gang ba'i gru dang grur nad pa gzhug pa la yang de slong gis mi reg tu mi rung ba'i rkyen de lta bu dag yod na de'i tshe gru de la ni ru skya ma gtogs pa nyid
translated: If such conditions exist, then at that time, except for the rudder, it is not suitable for a monk to touch a sick person riding in a boat filled with grain, etc.

original: do // grur nad pa ma yin pa yang gzhug tu rung ste /
analyzed: do // grur nad pa ma yin pa yang gzhug tu rung ste /
translated: It is suitable for a sick person who is not a monk to ride in a boat.

original: de la yang tshul de kho na bzhin no //
analyzed: de la yang tshul de kho na bzhin no //
translated: The same method applies here.

original: de 'dzin pa'i stan yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de 'dzin pa'i stan yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The same rule applies to the seat of the helmsman.

original: bza' @320b bar bya ba bcug pa'i gru dang 'bras la sogs pas gang ba'i gru dang grur nad pa dang mi na ba dag gzhug pa la yang dge slong gis mi reg tu mi rung ba'i rkyen de lta bu dag yod na de'i tshe gru de la ru
analyzed: bza' @320b bar bya ba bcug pa'i gru dang 'bras la sogs pas gang ba'i gru dang grur nad pa dang mi na ba dag gzhug pa la yang dge slong gis mi reg tu mi rung ba'i rkyen de lta bu dag yod na de'i tshe gru de la ru
translated: If there is a boat filled with food and drink, or a boat filled with rice and so on, and a sick or healthy monk is on board, then if there are such conditions that it is not suitable for the monk to touch, at that time the monk should not touch the boat.

original: skya 'dzin pa'i stan yang ma gtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: skya 'dzin pa'i stan yang ma gtogs pa nyid do //
translated: However, the seat of the helmsman is an exception.

original: kha lo ba'i stan dang ru skya 'dzin pa'i stan dag la dge slong gis brdos par gyur na de'i tshe shing rta dang gru sman par mi nus pas de'i phyir dge slong la rkyen de lta bu dag yod du zin kyang de dag la reg pa dgag pa
analyzed: kha lo ba'i stan dang ru skya 'dzin pa'i stan dag la dge slong gis brdos par gyur na de'i tshe shing rta dang gru sman par mi nus pas de'i phyir dge slong la rkyen de lta bu dag yod du zin kyang de dag la reg pa dgag pa
translated: If the seat of the helmsman and the seat of the helmsman's assistant are damaged, then at that time the chariot and boat cannot be steered. Therefore, even if there are such conditions for the monk, touching them is prohibited.

original: mdzad do // dge 'dun gyi sman dag lud pa na bskyam pa dang dbyung ba dang gzar bu'i las dang dpog pa dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdzad do // dge 'dun gyi sman dag lud pa na bskyam pa dang dbyung ba dang gzar bu'i las dang dpog pa dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When the Saṅgha's medicines are being distributed, in the work of carrying, pouring, using a ladle, and measuring, there is also.

original: dge 'dun gyi bza' ba la sogs pa sman dag dang gang zag gi yang rung ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi bza' ba la sogs pa sman dag dang gang zag gi yang rung ste /
translated: The medicine of the Saṅgha, such as food, and that of individuals,

original: de dag lud pa na bskyam pa la sogs pa'i phyir dge slong gis reg pa la yang mi rung ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag lud pa na bskyam pa la sogs pa'i phyir dge slong gis reg pa la yang mi rung ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: are not unfit to be touched by a bhikṣu when they overflow or boil over, etc.

original: lud pa na zhes bya ba ni thab tu bskol ba'i tshe gyen du lud pa na'o //🔽bskyam pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lud pa na zhes bya ba ni thab tu bskol ba'i tshe gyen du lud pa na'o // bskyam pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When they boil over, they boil over when heated on a stove.🔽When they overflow, they overflow when heated in a pot.

original: bskyod pa'o ; / dbyung ba zhes bya ba ni gnas nas phyir dbyung ba'o //🔽gzar bu'i las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bskyod pa'o ; / dbyung ba zhes bya ba ni gnas nas phyir dbyung ba'o // gzar bu'i las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When they are removed, they are removed from the place where they are heated.

original: gzar bus phyar ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzar bus phyar ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The action of a ladle is to be ladled with a ladle, etc.

original: dbog pa zhes bya ba ni bskol pa'i gnas sgyed po dag las shod du dbog pa'o //
analyzed: dbog pa zhes bya ba ni bskol pa'i gnas sgyed po dag las shod du dbog pa'o //
translated: When they are poured, they are poured down from the place where they are heated.

original: tshig de dag gis rdzas chud mi za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis rdzas chud mi za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: These words are used because the substance is not wasted.

original: ci bskyam pa de la dang po nyid nas reg par bya ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci bskyam pa de la dang po nyid nas reg par bya ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it to be touched from the very beginning when it boils over?

original: de'i phyir / dang por shing dbri ba dang me bsad pa dang gos kyi thu ba la sogs pas rlung g-yab pa 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dang por shing dbri ba dang me bsad pa dang gos kyi thu ba la sogs pas rlung g-yab pa 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: First, one should make an effort to remove the wood, extinguish the fire, and fan with the corner of one's robe, etc.

original: dge 'dun gyi sman de bskyam pa na dang po kho nar lud pa ni bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi sman de bskyam pa na dang po kho nar lud pa ni bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: When that medicine of the Saṅgha is being removed, first of all, in order to remove the phlegm,

original: shing dbri ba la sogs pa dag gis 'bad par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: shing dbri ba la sogs pa dag gis 'bad par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: one should apply oneself to removing the wood, etc.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught as follows:

original: lud pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang po kho nar re zhig dud shing dbri bar bya //
analyzed: lud pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang po kho nar re zhig dud shing dbri bar bya //
translated: In order to pacify the phlegm, first of all, one should remove the wood.

original: me gsad par bya /
analyzed: me gsad par bya /
translated: One should extinguish the fire.

original: gos kyi thu ba la sogs pas rlung g-yab par bya'o //
analyzed: gos kyi thu ba la sogs pas rlung g-yab par bya'o //
translated: One should fan with the corner of one's robe, etc.

original: 'on kyang zhi bar ma gyur na de'i tshe gzod bskyam pa la sogs pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhi bar ma gyur na de'i tshe gzod bskyam pa la sogs pas rig par bya'o //
translated: But if it is not pacified, then at that time one should know to remove it, etc.

original: des na 'di ltar shes te /
analyzed: des na 'di ltar shes te /
translated: Therefore, it is understood like this:

original: dang por bud shing dbri ba la sogs pas zhi bar ma gyur na de'i 'og tu gzod bskyam pa la sogs pa bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dang por bud shing dbri ba la sogs pas zhi bar ma gyur na de'i 'og tu gzod bskyam pa la sogs pa bya ba yin no //
translated: If it is not pacified by first removing the wood, etc., then afterwards one should do the removal, etc.

original: chu klung rgal ba'i phyir ram khur tsa ba bsnyag pa'i phyir lag nyar blangs pa'i lam rgyags rung ste /
analyzed: chu klung rgal ba'i phyir ram khur tsa ba bsnyag pa'i phyir lag nyar blangs pa'i lam rgyags rung ste /
translated: It is proper to eat the provisions for the road that are held in the hand in order to cross a river or in order to carry a load.

original: cho ga ma 'byor tam lam rgyags gzhan med na'o zhes @321a * //
analyzed: cho ga ma 'byor tam lam rgyags gzhan med na'o zhes @321a * //
translated: But if the rite is not performed or if there are no other provisions for the road.

original: bya ba ni /🔽dge slong chu klung rgal ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: bya ba ni / dge slong chu klung rgal ba'i phyir ram /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: lam rgyags khyer ba'i khur tsa ba bsnyag pa'i phyir ni lag nyar blangs pa'i lam rgyags bzar rung ngo //
analyzed: lam rgyags khyer ba'i khur tsa ba bsnyag pa'i phyir ni lag nyar blangs pa'i lam rgyags bzar rung ngo //
translated: It is proper for a monk to eat the provisions for the road that are held in the hand in order to cross a river or in order to carry a load.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When is it proper?

original: cho ga ma 'byor tam zhes bya ba smras te /🔽rung bar byed pa'i dge sbyong la sogs pas reg na lag nyar blangs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i cho ga ma 'byor na dge slong de nyid kyis chu klung rgal bar bya ba dang gnas gang na khur tsa ba 'dug pa der yang dge
analyzed: cho ga ma 'byor tam zhes bya ba smras te / rung bar byed pa'i dge sbyong la sogs pas reg na lag nyar blangs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i cho ga ma 'byor na dge slong de nyid kyis chu klung rgal bar bya ba dang gnas gang na khur tsa ba 'dug pa der yang dge
translated: If the rite is not performed.🔽If the rite of making it proper is not performed by a monk who is a proper person, then the provisions for the road that are held in the hand will not become provisions for the road that are held in the hand.

original: slong de nyid kyis bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: slong de nyid kyis bskur bar bya'o //
translated: The monk himself should cross the river and carry the load to the place where the provisions for the road are kept.

original: lag rgyags gzhan med na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lag rgyags gzhan med na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there are no other provisions for the road.

original: lam rgyags rung ba gzhan med na yang de'i tshe lam rgyags kyi don du lag nyar blangs pa bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: lam rgyags rung ba gzhan med na yang de'i tshe lam rgyags kyi don du lag nyar blangs pa bza' bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no other suitable provision for the journey, then at that time one should eat what has been taken for the purpose of provisions for the journey.

original: khur tsa ba med na sbyin bdag spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khur tsa ba med na sbyin bdag spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there is no porter, one should request the patron.

original: lam rgyags de khyer ba'i khur tsa ba gzhan med na sbyin bdag gis de bskur bar spro ba bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: lam rgyags de khyer ba'i khur tsa ba gzhan med na sbyin bdag gis de bskur bar spro ba bskyed par bya'o //
translated: If there is no other porter to carry those provisions for the journey, one should request the patron to carry them.

original: khyer ba med na rang gis so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyer ba med na rang gis so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there is no one to carry them, then oneself.

original: sbyin bdag la bcol ba yang ma grub na de'i tshe dge slong rang gis lam rgyags bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin bdag la bcol ba yang ma grub na de'i tshe dge slong rang gis lam rgyags bskur bar bya'o //
translated: If one is not able to request the patron, then at that time the monk should carry the provisions for the journey himself.

original: de nyid las sbyin pas brje zhing blang ba bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid las sbyin pas brje zhing blang ba bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In that very text, it is said, “One should obtain them by exchanging one’s own provisions.”

original: gzhan khyer du gzhug pa ma grub cing rang gis khyer bar gyur na rang gis khyer ba de nyid las gzhan la sbyin pas lam rgyags brje zhing blang ba bsgrub par bya'o ;
analyzed: gzhan khyer du gzhug pa ma grub cing rang gis khyer bar gyur na rang gis khyer ba de nyid las gzhan la sbyin pas lam rgyags brje zhing blang ba bsgrub par bya'o ;
translated: If one is not able to make another carry them and one oneself becomes the carrier, then one should obtain provisions for the journey by exchanging one’s own provisions.

original: /'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: /'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gal te rung ba gzhan ma grub na de'i tshe rang gis khyer ba'i lam rgyags de nyid las bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la skal ba sbyin par bya zhing /
analyzed: gal te rung ba gzhan ma grub na de'i tshe rang gis khyer ba'i lam rgyags de nyid las bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la skal ba sbyin par bya zhing /
translated: If one does not obtain another suitable one, then one should give one’s own portion to one who is not fully ordained.

original: de'i 'og tu bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa de'i skal ba de rang gi skal bas brje zhing bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa de'i skal ba de rang gi skal bas brje zhing bza' bar bya'o //
translated: After that, one should exchange one’s own portion with the portion of one who is not fully ordained and eat it.

original: de yang ma grub na de bza' bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang ma grub na de bza' bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If that is not obtained, then that should be eaten.

original: rang gis khyer ba de nyid las brje zhing blang ba de yang ma grub na rang gis khyer ba de yang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no //🔽byin len stobs pa med na byin len ma byas pa de 'am gzhan yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang gis khyer ba de nyid las brje zhing blang ba de yang ma grub na rang gis khyer ba de yang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no // byin len stobs pa med na byin len ma byas pa de 'am gzhan yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one does not obtain the exchange of that which one has carried, then that which one has carried should be eaten.

original: byin len stobs par byed pa'i mi gzhan med na de'i tshe byin len ma byas par rang gis khyer ba de'am gzhan khyer du bcug pa gzhan yang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: byin len stobs par byed pa'i mi gzhan med na de'i tshe byin len ma byas par rang gis khyer ba de'am gzhan khyer du bcug pa gzhan yang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: If there is no other person who can perform the rite of receiving, then that which one has carried without receiving or that which one has caused another to carry should be eaten.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: rang gis khyer ba'i lam rgyags de bza' bar bya ba nyid yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: rang gis khyer ba'i lam rgyags de bza' bar bya ba nyid yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is that food carried by oneself to be eaten,

original: de nyid dam gzhan byin len ma byas pa yang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de nyid dam gzhan byin len ma byas pa yang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: but also that given by others, even without being received.

original: @321b rang gis khyer ba dang byin len ma byas pa de gnyis dge slong gang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: @321b rang gis khyer ba dang byin len ma byas pa de gnyis dge slong gang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: What is the food carried by oneself and not received that a monk should eat?

original: de'i phyir / zan gcad par byas pa'i 'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / zan gcad par byas pa'i 'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said: “of one who has taken a vow of fasting.”

original: dge slong gang gis sngar nyin gcig zan gcad pa de ni zan gcad par byas pa ste de'i'o //
analyzed: dge slong gang gis sngar nyin gcig zan gcad pa de ni zan gcad par byas pa ste de'i'o //
translated: That of which a monk has previously taken a vow of fasting is the food of one who has taken a vow of fasting.

original: nyi ma gang la ji tsam bza' bar bya ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: nyi ma gang la ji tsam bza' bar bya ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: On what day is it to be eaten?

original: de'i phyir nyi ma dang po la spar gang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyi ma dang po la spar gang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said: “On the first day, a handful.”

original: sngar nyin gcig zan gcad par byas pa'i phyi de nyin par zan bza' ba'i dus la bab pa ni nyi ma dang po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sngar nyin gcig zan gcad par byas pa'i phyi de nyin par zan bza' ba'i dus la bab pa ni nyi ma dang po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The day on which the time for eating food arrives after the previous day of fasting is called the first day.

original: de la ni spar gang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la ni spar gang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: On that day, a handful is to be eaten.

original: sbar gang zhes bya ba ni lag pa khas spub pa'i sor mo sgu por bkram pa dag gis phye la sogs pa ji tsam bzung bar nus pa de ni spar gang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbar gang zhes bya ba ni lag pa khas spub pa'i sor mo sgu por bkram pa dag gis phye la sogs pa ji tsam bzung bar nus pa de ni spar gang zhes bya'o //
translated: A handful is the amount that can be held by the cupped hands turned downward with the fingers extended.

original: gnyis pa la ni de'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni de'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: On the second day, that much.

original: nyi ma gnyis pa la ni spar ba do bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no //🔽gsum pa la ni ji tsam gyis chog ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyi ma gnyis pa la ni spar ba do bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no // gsum pa la ni ji tsam gyis chog ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: On the second day, one should eat that much.🔽On the third day, as much as one likes.

original: nyi ma gsum pa la ni ji tsam gyis chog par 'gyur pa de tsam bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: nyi ma gsum pa la ni ji tsam gyis chog par 'gyur pa de tsam bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: On the third day, one should eat as much as one likes.

original: shing tog rung bar ma byas pa dang byin len ma byas pa dang lag nyar blangs pa dag kyang dus ma yin par bza' bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shing tog rung bar ma byas pa dang byin len ma byas pa dang lag nyar blangs pa dag kyang dus ma yin par bza' bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Fruits that are not suitable, that have not been offered, and that have not been received in the hand are also to be eaten at the wrong time.

original: dge slong zan gcad pa byas pas dgun la sogs pa shing tog rung bar ma byas pa dang // byin len ma byas pa dang / lag nyar blangs pa dag kyang dus ma yin par yang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: dge slong zan gcad pa byas pas dgun la sogs pa shing tog rung bar ma byas pa dang // byin len ma byas pa dang / lag nyar blangs pa dag kyang dus ma yin par yang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: , even out of season, if it is not prepared, if it is not received, or if it is held in the hand.

original: kyang zhes bya ba dang yang zhes bya ba kha gnyis su smos pa ni gnyi ga yang nyes pa med do zhes bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba dang yang zhes bya ba kha gnyis su smos pa ni gnyi ga yang nyes pa med do zhes bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The words “also” and “even” are used to indicate that there is no fault in either case.

original: de dag thams cad kyang gzhan ma grub na zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang gzhan ma grub na zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa nyid yin no //
translated: And all of these are governed by the phrase “if the other is not available.”🔽To whom do these belong?

original: de dag su'i bza' bar bya ba nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir zan med pa'i 'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de dag su'i bza' bar bya ba nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir zan med pa'i 'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The text says, “of one who has no food.”

original: dge slong zas med pa'i 'o //
analyzed: dge slong zas med pa'i 'o //
translated: They belong to a monk who has no food.

original: ci gnas skabs thams cad du 'am zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci gnas skabs thams cad du 'am zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Is this permitted at all times?

original: shin tu bkres pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: shin tu bkres pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The text says, “when he is very hungry.”

original: shin tu bkres pa'i dngos po ni shin tu bkres pa nyid de dge slong de shin tu bkres pa nyid yin na bza' bar bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: shin tu bkres pa'i dngos po ni shin tu bkres pa nyid de dge slong de shin tu bkres pa nyid yin na bza' bar bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: The state of being extremely hungry is the state of being hungry. If a monk is in the state of being hungry, he should eat.

original: bkres pas shin tu srog la thug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bkres pas shin tu srog la thug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he is in danger of losing his life due to hunger.

original: rtsa ba dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang /🔽dge slong zan med pa shin tu bkres pa nyid na rtsa ba rung bar ma byas pa la sogs pa dag kyang dus ma @322a * //
analyzed: rtsa ba dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang / dge slong zan med pa shin tu bkres pa nyid na rtsa ba rung bar ma byas pa la sogs pa dag kyang dus ma @322a * //
translated: Also roots.🔽If a monk is without food and in the state of being extremely hungry, he should eat even unprocessed roots, etc.

original: yin bar yang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no //🔽rang gis kyang btog pa nyid dang dbyung ba nyid dang bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yin bar yang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin no // rang gis kyang btog pa nyid dang dbyung ba nyid dang bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: at the improper time.🔽Also, he should himself pull them up, dig them up, and prepare them.

original: rang gis kyang zhes smos pa'i kyang gi sgras ni gzhan byed du gzhug pa yang bsdu'o //
analyzed: rang gis kyang zhes smos pa'i kyang gi sgras ni gzhan byed du gzhug pa yang bsdu'o //
translated: The word also in the phrase “also himself” includes having others do it.

original: dge slong zan med pa shin tu bkres pa nyid ni rang gis gyang shing tog la sogs pa btog pa nyid dang / rtsa ba la sogs pa dbyung ba nyid dang / btso bar bya ba bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyang byar rung la gzhan byed du gzhug tu yang rung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong zan med pa shin tu bkres pa nyid ni rang gis gyang shing tog la sogs pa btog pa nyid dang / rtsa ba la sogs pa dbyung ba nyid dang / btso bar bya ba bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyang byar rung la gzhan byed du gzhug tu yang rung ngo //
translated: Monks who are very hungry and have no food may gather fruit from trees and so on, dig up roots and so on, and cook them themselves or have others cook them.

original: byin len ma bstabs pa dang rung bar ma byas pa dang dus ma yin bar bza' ba la sogs pa rung bar bya ba dag la rtsom pa 'dod pa ni byang gi sgra mi snyan na grags pa'i yid la byed pa bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byin len ma bstabs pa dang rung bar ma byas pa dang dus ma yin bar bza' ba la sogs pa rung bar bya ba dag la rtsom pa 'dod pa ni byang gi sgra mi snyan na grags pa'i yid la byed pa bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you wish to eat food that has not been offered and accepted, that has not been made permissible, or at an inappropriate time, you should apply the mental state known as the practice of the northern continent of Kuru.

original: dge slong zan med pa shin tu bkres pa nyid na byin len ma bstabs pa dang / rung bar ma byas pa dang dus ma yin bar za ba la sogs pa rung ba bya ba dag la rtsom pa'i mdun rol du rtsom pa 'dod pa'i tshe na dge slong des byang gi sgra mi snyan na grags pa'i yid la byed pa bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong zan med pa shin tu bkres pa nyid na byin len ma bstabs pa dang / rung bar ma byas pa dang dus ma yin bar za ba la sogs pa rung ba bya ba dag la rtsom pa'i mdun rol du rtsom pa 'dod pa'i tshe na dge slong des byang gi sgra mi snyan na grags pa'i yid la byed pa bya ste /
translated: When a monk is very hungry and has no food, he should first generate the thought of desire to commence the rite of eating food without having received it, or without having made it permissible, or at the wrong time.

original: 'di ltar byang gi sgra mi snyan na gzhan dang 'brel ba'i tha snyad med cing sems can de dag kyang bye brag tu mi rtog pas rang gis blang ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang gi sgra mi snyan na gzhan dang 'brel ba'i tha snyad med cing sems can de dag kyang bye brag tu mi rtog pas rang gis blang ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad byed pa yin te /
translated: Then he should generate the mental contemplation renowned in Uttarakuru, because in Uttarakuru there is no conventional expression related to others and those sentient beings do not discriminate, so they engage in conventional expressions such as taking for themselves.🔽Since their thoughts are honest and virtuous, they do not discriminate in terms of such distinctions as this is my food or the food of others or food taken from others.

original: bsam pa drang zhing dge ba yin pa'i phyir bdag gi zhe 'am gzhan gyi zhe 'am gzhan las blang bar bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i bye brag tu rtog pa de na med pa kho na yin pas dge slong des kyang de'i tshe byin len ma
analyzed: bsam pa drang zhing dge ba yin pa'i phyir bdag gi zhe 'am gzhan gyi zhe 'am gzhan las blang bar bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i bye brag tu rtog pa de na med pa kho na yin pas dge slong des kyang de'i tshe byin len ma
translated: Therefore the monk should generate the thought of desire to commence the rite of eating food without having received it, or without having made it permissible, or at the wrong time.

original: bstabs pa la sogs pa de dag thams cad la de lta bu'i bsam pas rang gis bya'o //
analyzed: bstabs pa la sogs pa de dag thams cad la de lta bu'i bsam pas rang gis bya'o //
translated: One should do all of these things, such as serving, with such an attitude.

original: lag bsnyal ba dang 'dab ma dag yod na skyogs kyis skom mi btung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lag bsnyal ba dang 'dab ma dag yod na skyogs kyis skom mi btung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there is a water dipper and leaves, one should not drink water from a bowl.

original: lag bsnyal ba dang 'dab ma dag yod na /
analyzed: lag bsnyal ba dang 'dab ma dag yod na /
translated: If there is a water dipper and leaves,

original: skyogs kyi nang nas skom btung bar mi bya ba'o //🔽med na ma bsgribs par mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽lag bsnyal ba dang 'dab ma dag med na skyogs kyis skom btung ba ma bsgribs par btung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: skyogs kyi nang nas skom btung bar mi bya ba'o // med na ma bsgribs par mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni / lag bsnyal ba dang 'dab ma dag med na skyogs kyis skom btung ba ma bsgribs par btung bar mi bya'o //
translated: one should not drink water from a bowl.🔽If there is no water dipper and leaves, one should not drink water from an uncovered vessel.🔽If there is no water dipper and leaves, one should not drink water from an uncovered vessel.

original: de chu dang bcas pa nyid yin na kha ma bcad pa nyid du mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de chu dang bcas pa nyid yin na kha ma bcad pa nyid du mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is wet, one should not leave it uncovered.

original: skyogs de chu dang bcas pa nyid yin na kham bcad pa nyid du mi gzhag ste /
analyzed: skyogs de chu dang bcas pa nyid yin na kham bcad pa nyid du mi gzhag ste /
translated: If that vessel is wet, one should not leave it uncovered.

original: kha gab med par bcang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: kha gab med par bcang bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not carry it without a cover.

original: 'dir chu dang bcas pa nyid ces smos pa ni mtshon pa tsam du zad @322b de ;
analyzed: 'dir chu dang bcas pa nyid ces smos pa ni mtshon pa tsam du zad @322b de ;
translated: Here, the mention of “wet” is just an illustration.

original: chu med na yang kha ma bcad pa nyid du mi gzhag go //
analyzed: chu med na yang kha ma bcad pa nyid du mi gzhag go //
translated: If there is no water, it should not be left uncovered.

original: de'i kha gab ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de'i kha gab ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The cover for it is of three types:

original: shing las byas pa dang / rdo las byas pa dang / sa las byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shing las byas pa dang / rdo las byas pa dang / sa las byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: made of wood, made of stone, and made of earth.

original: skyogs de'i kha gab ni rnam pa 'di gsum las byar rung ba'o //
analyzed: skyogs de'i kha gab ni rnam pa 'di gsum las byar rung ba'o //
translated: The cover for that bowl is suitable to be made of these three types.

original: skyogs gzhi shing las byas pa'am rdo las byas pa bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skyogs gzhi shing las byas pa'am rdo las byas pa bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: A bowl base made of wood or stone should be kept.

original: gang du skyogs gzhag par bya ba de ni skyogs gzhi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang du skyogs gzhag par bya ba de ni skyogs gzhi zhes bya ste /
translated: The place where the bowl is to be placed is called a “bowl base.”

original: de shing las byas pa'am rdo las byas pa bcang par bya'o //🔽'dab ma dag snod nyid du spyod pa na byin len ma byas pa nyid la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de shing las byas pa'am rdo las byas pa bcang par bya'o // 'dab ma dag snod nyid du spyod pa na byin len ma byas pa nyid la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That should be made of wood or stone and kept.🔽When leaves are used as a container, there is no fault in not doing a ritual of receiving.

original: 'dab ma dag sder nyid du spyod pa na byin len ma bstabs pa nyid la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'dab ma dag sder nyid du spyod pa na byin len ma bstabs pa nyid la nyes pa med de /
translated: When leaves are used as a plate, there is no fault in not doing a ritual of receiving.

original: 'dab ma byin len ma byas pa dag gi steng du zas la sogs pa'i bya ba byed na de'i tshe nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma byin len ma byas pa dag gi steng du zas la sogs pa'i bya ba byed na de'i tshe nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no offense if one performs the action of eating, etc. on leaves that have not been received.

original: 'di la brngas pa dang ma brngas pa dag la ni khyad par med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la brngas pa dang ma brngas pa dag la ni khyad par med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no difference between those that have been cut and those that have not been cut.

original: snod nyid du spyod pa 'di la 'dab ma dag shing ljon pa la sogs pa dag las brngas pa dang ma brngas pa dag ni byin len bstabs pa nyid kyi phyir khyad par med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snod nyid du spyod pa 'di la 'dab ma dag shing ljon pa la sogs pa dag las brngas pa dang ma brngas pa dag ni byin len bstabs pa nyid kyi phyir khyad par med par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this practice of using leaves as a vessel, there is no difference between those that have been cut and those that have not been cut from trees, etc., because they have been consecrated.

original: gzhan med na ma brngas pa dag spyad do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan med na ma brngas pa dag spyad do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there are none, one may use those that have not been cut.

original: 'dab ma brdas pa gzhan dang snod gzhan med na snod du bya ba'i phyir 'dab ma ma brdas pa dag spyad par bya zhing sder du bya'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma brdas pa gzhan dang snod gzhan med na snod du bya ba'i phyir 'dab ma ma brdas pa dag spyad par bya zhing sder du bya'o //
translated: If there are no other cut leaves or other vessels, one may use and carry those that have not been cut as a vessel.

original: gzhan yod na ni shing ljon pa la sogs pa dag dang 'brel ba'i 'dab mas skom la sogs pa 'thung bar byed pa bzhad gad du 'gyur bas mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yod na ni shing ljon pa la sogs pa dag dang 'brel ba'i 'dab mas skom la sogs pa 'thung bar byed pa bzhad gad du 'gyur bas mi bya'o //
translated: But if there are others, it would be ridiculous to drink water, etc. with leaves that are connected to trees, etc.

original: gsog 'jog gi ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to //
analyzed: gsog 'jog gi ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to //
translated: The downfall of hoarding has been explained.

original: byin len ma byas par za ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: byin len ma byas par za ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: If one wishes to speak of the downfall of eating without having received the food in one’s hands,

original: gzhan dang byin len stobs pa med na sbyin bdag gis bsam pa thag pas btang ba rang gis blangs te bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhan dang byin len stobs pa med na sbyin bdag gis bsam pa thag pas btang ba rang gis blangs te bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: and if there is no one to offer the food and receive the commitment, one may take the food oneself, if the donor is willing.

original: byin len ma bstabs par bza' ba thams cad la yang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus su byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes thams cad du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byin len ma bstabs par bza' ba thams cad la yang byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus su byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes thams cad du shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that all foods may be consecrated for consumption in the northern continent of Kuru.

original: byin len byas zin pa'i zan gzhan med dam byin len stobs pa'i mi la sogs pa med na zas de sbyin bdag gis bsam pa thag pas btang ba yin na rang gis blangs te bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: byin len byas zin pa'i zan gzhan med dam byin len stobs pa'i mi la sogs pa med na zas de sbyin bdag gis bsam pa thag pas btang ba yin na rang gis blangs te bza' bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no other food that has been received, and no one to receive the commitment, one may take the food oneself, if the donor is willing.

original: gang yang rung ba cig yod na ni nyes pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba cig yod na ni nyes pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If any of these conditions is not fulfilled, one commits an offense.

original: 'dir gzhan med @323a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan med @323a * //
translated: If there is no one else to receive the commitment,

original: pa'i gzhung ni dge slong cig gis bsod snyoms blangs te gtsug lag khang du bzhag nas phyi rol du byung ba dang / khyim bdag cig gis kyang bsod snyoms shig khyer te 'ongs nas de nyid kyi steng du bzhag pa na bsod snyoms pa phyir 'ongs nas de'i steng du bsod snyoms gzhan bzhag pa mthong nas de 'gyod pa skyes te /
analyzed: pa'i gzhung ni dge slong cig gis bsod snyoms blangs te gtsug lag khang du bzhag nas phyi rol du byung ba dang / khyim bdag cig gis kyang bsod snyoms shig khyer te 'ongs nas de nyid kyi steng du bzhag pa na bsod snyoms pa phyir 'ongs nas de'i steng du bsod snyoms gzhan bzhag pa mthong nas de 'gyod pa skyes te /
translated: A monk took alms and placed them in the monastery. He went outside and a householder also came and placed alms on top of the first. The monk who had returned saw the other alms placed on top and felt regret.

original: mi za ba'i skabs de dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mi za ba'i skabs de dge slong dag gis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When he did not eat the alms, the monks reported this to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said:

original: gal te byin len stobs pa yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te byin len stobs pa yod na ni /
translated: “If there is one who can do the receiving,

original: byin len byas pa de bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: byin len byas pa de bza' bar bya'o //
translated: then the received alms should be eaten.

original: ji ste med na ni phyis byin pa gang yin ba de bsal zhing snga ma shos bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: ji ste med na ni phyis byin pa gang yin ba de bsal zhing snga ma shos bza' bar bya ste /
translated: If there is none, then the later alms should be removed and the earlier eaten.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: There is no need to feel regret about this.”

original: byin len stobs pa med pa'i gzhung ni de nyid las tshong pa rab tu mang po dag gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun bshos la spyan drangs te /
analyzed: byin len stobs pa med pa'i gzhung ni de nyid las tshong pa rab tu mang po dag gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun bshos la spyan drangs te /
translated: Many merchants invited the Buddha and the saṅgha of monks to a meal.

original: de dag gis zas dag spyi bungs su bcer ba dang tshong khang dag tu me shor nas de dag me gsod pa'i phyir dong pa dang gdugs tshod kyang bab par gyur nas dge slong dag gis ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: de dag gis zas dag spyi bungs su bcer ba dang tshong khang dag tu me shor nas de dag me gsod pa'i phyir dong pa dang gdugs tshod kyang bab par gyur nas dge slong dag gis ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba mi shes pa dang /
translated: They left the food in a common area and a fire broke out in the shops. They went to put out the fire and it was noon. The monks did not know what to do.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: de dag gis bsam pa thag pas btang ba yin pas byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus su byin gyi sa brlab cing bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gis bsam pa thag pas btang ba yin pas byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus su byin gyi sa brlab cing bza' bar bya ste /
translated: “Since they gave with a pure intention, you should receive and eat it as if it were the time of the northern continent Kuru.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Do not regret this.”

original: byin len gyi mtshan nyid smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: byin len gyi mtshan nyid smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: Desiring to explain the characteristics of receiving,

original: mngon sum du mtshams kyi nang du 'thob pa'i phyogs na gnas pa lag pa bkan pas lus sam de dang 'brel pas gyen du 'degs nus pa rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa mi ma yin pa las kyang sbyin par 'dod pas yan lag gis sam de dang 'brel ba'i
analyzed: mngon sum du mtshams kyi nang du 'thob pa'i phyogs na gnas pa lag pa bkan pas lus sam de dang 'brel pas gyen du 'degs nus pa rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa mi ma yin pa las kyang sbyin par 'dod pas yan lag gis sam de dang 'brel ba'i
translated: If one is in a place within the boundary where one can directly receive it, then if one is not fully ordained, one can receive it from a nonhuman who is able to raise one’s body or something connected to it by extending an arm.

original: byin pa mnos pa ni byin len no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: byin pa mnos pa ni byin len no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: One who receives it is called a receiver.

original: mngon sum du zhes bya ba ni drang thad nas blangs na byin len yin gyi glo 'am rgyab nas blangs pa ni byin len ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum du zhes bya ba ni drang thad nas blangs na byin len yin gyi glo 'am rgyab nas blangs pa ni byin len ma yin no //
translated: Directly means that if one receives it in a straight line, it is a proper reception. If one receives it from the side or from behind, it is not a proper reception.

original: mtshams kyi nang du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Within the boundary means

original: mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa'i dge slong gis blangs na byin len yin gyi /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa'i dge slong gis blangs na byin len yin gyi /
translated: if a fully ordained monk who is within the boundary receives it, it is a proper reception.

original: sgo 'phar la sogs pas bar du chod pa'i mtshams kyi phyi rol na gnas pas blangs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgo 'phar la sogs pas bar du chod pa'i mtshams kyi phyi rol na gnas pas blangs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If one who is outside the boundary receives it, it is not a proper reception.

original: 'thob pa'i phyogs na @323b gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'thob pa'i phyogs na @323b gnas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In a place where one can receive it means🔽if one is in a place where one can receive it, it is a proper reception.

original: phyogs gang du byin len 'thob pa'i phyogs de na gnas pa'i dge slong gis blangs na byin len yin gyi /
analyzed: phyogs gang du byin len 'thob pa'i phyogs de na gnas pa'i dge slong gis blangs na byin len yin gyi /
translated: If a bhikṣu who is in the direction in which the food is given receives it, it is a receiving.

original: khang steng la sogs pa na 'dug pa las 'og na 'dug pa'i dge slong gis blangs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khang steng la sogs pa na 'dug pa las 'og na 'dug pa'i dge slong gis blangs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But if a bhikṣu is below, it is not a receiving, if he is in a different house, or on a different floor, etc.

original: lag pa bkan pas zhes bya ba ni /🔽gang gis lag pa gnyis bkan pa de ni lag pa bkan ba ste /
analyzed: lag pa bkan pas zhes bya ba ni / gang gis lag pa gnyis bkan pa de ni lag pa bkan ba ste /
translated: “With an extended hand” means🔽with both hands extended.

original: des blangs na byin len yin gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des blangs na byin len yin gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: If he receives with that, it is a receiving. But if he receives with the other, it is not.

original: lus sam zhes bya ba ni lag pa la sogs par mnos pa'o //
analyzed: lus sam zhes bya ba ni lag pa la sogs par mnos pa'o //
translated: “With the body” means with the hands, etc.
