original: de dang 'brel bar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dang 'brel bar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In connection with that” means

original: lag pa dang 'brel ba'i lhung bzed la sogs par mnos pa ste /
analyzed: lag pa dang 'brel ba'i lhung bzed la sogs par mnos pa ste /
translated: in connection with the bowl, etc.

original: da gnyis su mnos pa ni byin len gyi gzhan du mnos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: da gnyis su mnos pa ni byin len gyi gzhan du mnos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If he receives in both, it is a receiving. But if he receives in the other, it is not.

original: gyen du 'degs nus pa las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gyen du 'degs nus pa las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If he is able to raise it” means

original: gang gis sbyin par bya ba'i zas de gyen du 'degs nus pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis sbyin par bya ba'i zas de gyen du 'degs nus pa ste /
translated: if he is able to raise the food that is to be given.

original: de las mnos na byin len yin gyi de las gzhan pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las mnos na byin len yin gyi de las gzhan pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: If one receives it from that, it is a formal acceptance. It is not from another.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa las zhes bya ba ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa las mnos na byin len yin gyi /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa las zhes bya ba ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa las mnos na byin len yin gyi /
translated: From one not fully ordained means: if one receives it from one not fully ordained, it is a formal acceptance.

original: dge slong las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dge slong las ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not from a fully ordained monk.

original: mi ma yin pa las kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa las kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From a non-human means:

original: glang po che cang shes la sogs pa dag las kyang mnos na byin len yin pa'o //
analyzed: glang po che cang shes la sogs pa dag las kyang mnos na byin len yin pa'o //
translated: If one receives it from an elephant, horse, or monkey that is a magical creation, it is a formal acceptance.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dgon pa pa rnams la dgon pa na gnas pa'i glang po che cang shes pa dang / rta cang shes dang / spre'u cang shes dag gis shing tog dag 'bul ba dge slong dag mi len pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dgon pa pa rnams la dgon pa na gnas pa'i glang po che cang shes pa dang / rta cang shes dang / spre'u cang shes dag gis shing tog dag 'bul ba dge slong dag mi len pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Here, the text says: “The monks in the wilderness did not accept the fruits offered by the magical elephants, horses, and monkeys in the wilderness. The Blessed One said:

original: gang la gyen du 'degs pa yod pa de la byin len yang yod pas bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang la gyen du 'degs pa yod pa de la byin len yang yod pas bza' bar bya ste /
translated: ‘Since there is formal acceptance in that which is raised up, it should be eaten.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Do not regret it.’

original: sbyin par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyin par 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase one who wishes to give means

original: sbyin par 'dod pas byin pa mnos pa byin len yin gyi /
analyzed: sbyin par 'dod pas byin pa mnos pa byin len yin gyi /
translated: that one who wishes to give gives, and that is the giving of the gift.

original: sbyin par mi 'dod pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyin par mi 'dod pas ni ma yin te /
translated: But one who does not wish to give does not give.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dbang med pa la sogs pas sbyin par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dbang med pa la sogs pas sbyin par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text says, One does not give through being forced, and so on.

original: yan lag gis sam zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: yan lag gis sam zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: The phrase by means of a limb means

original: lag pas so //
analyzed: lag pas so //
translated: by means of a hand.

original: de dang 'brel bas byin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dang 'brel bas byin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase by means of what is connected with that means

original: lag pa dang 'brel ba'i ril ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: lag pa dang 'brel ba'i ril ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: by means of a bowl, and so on, which is connected with a hand,

original: zas la sogs pa byin pa'o //
analyzed: zas la sogs pa byin pa'o //
translated: and by means of food, and so on, which is given.

original: dge slong rnam pa de lta bus byin len stobs pa rnam pa de lta bu las zas la sogs pa mnos pa ni byin len yin no /🔽// / @324a * //  bam po nyi shu dgu pa /🔽yul gyi mi smad par bya ba nyid yin na dkyil 'khor gyi steng du zhog shig ces bstan na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong rnam pa de lta bus byin len stobs pa rnam pa de lta bu las zas la sogs pa mnos pa ni byin len yin no / // / @324a * //  bam po nyi shu dgu pa / yul gyi mi smad par bya ba nyid yin na dkyil 'khor gyi steng du zhog shig ces bstan na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase the gift is received by the monk who gives and receives in this way means that the food, and so on, is received by the monk who gives and receives in this way.🔽The phrase if the people of the country are to be respected, then place it on the mandala means

original: gal te mi rnams rang gi yul na smad par bya ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te mi rnams rang gi yul na smad par bya ba nyid yin na /
translated: that if the people of the country are to be respected,

original: de'i phyir yul gyi mi smad par bya ba nyid de la dkyil 'khor 'di'i steng du zhog shig ces de skad bstan na de yang byin len mnos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul gyi mi smad par bya ba nyid de la dkyil 'khor 'di'i steng du zhog shig ces de skad bstan na de yang byin len mnos pa yin gyi /
translated: If one says, “Place it on the maṇḍala of this one who has received the gift,” then that is also receiving the gift.

original: lus sam de dang 'brel par mnos pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
analyzed: lus sam de dang 'brel par mnos pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do //
translated: It is not only received by the body or in connection with it.

original: lhung bzed dang de'i gzhi dag ni gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang de'i gzhi dag ni gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A bowl and its base are the same.

original: lhung bzed dang lhung bzed kyi gzhi dag ni 'dra ba nyid de /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang lhung bzed kyi gzhi dag ni 'dra ba nyid de /
translated: A bowl and the base of a bowl are similar.

original: lhung bzed du mnos pa dang de'i gzhir 'jog pa ni byin len byas pa nyid yin te gzhan du yang de bzhin no //🔽spre'u rnams kyi spyod yul ni yal ga yin pas de nas de'i phyir mi 'thob pa'i sa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhung bzed du mnos pa dang de'i gzhir 'jog pa ni byin len byas pa nyid yin te gzhan du yang de bzhin no // spre'u rnams kyi spyod yul ni yal ga yin pas de nas de'i phyir mi 'thob pa'i sa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Receiving the gift in a bowl and placing it on its base is receiving the gift. It is the same for others.🔽The domain of the monkeys is the branches. Therefore, it is not the case that it is not obtained from that.

original: spre'u rnams kyi spyod yul ni yal ga dag yin pas yal ga de nas spre'u las byin len bstabs pa de'i phyir mi 'thob pa'i sa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: spre'u rnams kyi spyod yul ni yal ga dag yin pas yal ga de nas spre'u las byin len bstabs pa de'i phyir mi 'thob pa'i sa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The domain of the monkeys is the branches. Therefore, it is not the case that it is not obtained from that branch where the gift is received from the monkey.

original: yal ga la gnas pa'i spre'u las byin len byar rung ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: yal ga la gnas pa'i spre'u las byin len byar rung ba kho na yin no //
translated: The only exception is a monkey living in a tree.

original: shing tog dag man shel dang khri dang khri'u dang thu ba dang lhung bzed kyi gzhi dag gis byin len mnod du mi rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shing tog dag man shel dang khri dang khri'u dang thu ba dang lhung bzed kyi gzhi dag gis byin len mnod du mi rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not the case that fruit, a crystal, a bed, a bench, a pillow, or a bowl rest are unsuitable for receiving.

original: shing tog dag man shel dang khri dang / khri'u dang thu ba dang lhung bzed kyi gzhi byed par gyur pa de dag gi byin len mnod du mi rung ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: shing tog dag man shel dang khri dang / khri'u dang thu ba dang lhung bzed kyi gzhi byed par gyur pa de dag gi byin len mnod du mi rung ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that fruit, a crystal, a bed, a bench, a pillow, or a bowl rest are unsuitable for receiving.

original: byin len mnod du rung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: byin len mnod du rung ba nyid yin no //
translated: They are suitable for receiving.

original: de dag gnas pa dag gis cang mi smra bas so sor brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gnas pa dag gis cang mi smra bas so sor brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They should be examined by the resident monks in silence.

original: shing tog de dag gnas pa slob ma dang nye gnas dag gis cang mi smra bas so sor brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: shing tog de dag gnas pa slob ma dang nye gnas dag gis cang mi smra bas so sor brtag par bya'o //
translated: Those fruits should be examined by the resident monks in silence.

original: snyoms par 'drim par byed pa mos par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snyoms par 'drim par byed pa mos par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The distributor should be approved.

original: gang snyoms par 'drim pa'i phyir 'jug pa de ni snyoms par 'drim par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang snyoms par 'drim pa'i phyir 'jug pa de ni snyoms par 'drim par byed pa ste /
translated: That which is distributed evenly is distributed evenly.

original: de mos par bya ba mos pa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de mos par bya ba mos pa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: One should generate interest in that which is to be generated.

original: 'dir gzhung ni de 'drim pa'i phyir khyim pa rnams shing tog dag mi snyoms par 'drim par byed nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de 'drim pa'i phyir khyim pa rnams shing tog dag mi snyoms par 'drim par byed nas /
translated: Here, the text is as follows: When householders distribute fruits unevenly because they distribute them evenly,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said:

original: dge tshul dag 'drim du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: dge tshul dag 'drim du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: “Novices should be made to distribute them.”

original: dge tshul dag kyang mi snyoms par 'drim par byed nas /
analyzed: dge tshul dag kyang mi snyoms par 'drim par byed nas /
translated: When the novices also distribute them unevenly,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said:

original: dge slong dag gis lag pa dag bsnyal te byin len byas @324b nas brim par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽dge slong byin len byas pas brim pa nyid ni rung ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong dag gis lag pa dag bsnyal te byin len byas @324b nas brim par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // dge slong byin len byas pas brim pa nyid ni rung ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Monks should receive them with their hands and distribute them.”🔽It is proper for a monk who has received the food to distribute it.

original: dge slong zas byin len byas pas brim pa nyid ni rung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: dge slong zas byin len byas pas brim pa nyid ni rung ba nyid yin te /
translated: It is proper for a monk who has received the food to distribute it.

original: tshul dang mi mthun pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul dang mi mthun pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not improper.

original: zhun mar dang / 'bru mar dang / sprang rtsi dang / bu ram gyi dbu ba'i bum pa dag 'drim na rtsva dang lo ma dag la sogs pa dag gis gos dag bskyab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhun mar dang / 'bru mar dang / sprang rtsi dang / bu ram gyi dbu ba'i bum pa dag 'drim na rtsva dang lo ma dag la sogs pa dag gis gos dag bskyab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If they are served with ghee, oil, honey, or molasses, one should protect one’s robes with grass, leaves, and so on.

original: zhun mar dang / 'bru mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / bu ram gyi dbu ba'i phru ba dag 'drim par byed pa'i dge slong gis rtsva dang 'dab ma la sogs pa dag gis gos dag bskyab par bya ste ;
analyzed: zhun mar dang / 'bru mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / bu ram gyi dbu ba'i phru ba dag 'drim par byed pa'i dge slong gis rtsva dang 'dab ma la sogs pa dag gis gos dag bskyab par bya ste ;
translated: If a monk is serving ghee, oil, honey, or molasses, he should protect his robes with grass, leaves, and so on.

original: bar du gos ma rung bar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir g-yogs par bya'o //
analyzed: bar du gos ma rung bar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir g-yogs par bya'o //
translated: He should cover them so that they are not damaged in the middle.

original: brim par bya ba gces pa dang bar ma dang tha ma dag so sor bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brim par bya ba gces pa dang bar ma dang tha ma dag so sor bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The best, middling, and worst of what is to be served should be distributed separately.

original: brim par bya ba'i zas rgun la sogs pa gces pa dang / bar ma dang tha ma dag so sor brim par bya ste /
analyzed: brim par bya ba'i zas rgun la sogs pa gces pa dang / bar ma dang tha ma dag so sor brim par bya ste /
translated: The best, middling, and worst of the food to be served, such as grapes, should be distributed separately.

original: mi bsre bar brim par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi bsre bar brim par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that they should be distributed without mixing them.

original: aa mra zhim po rnams logs shig tu bsal te brim par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: aa mra zhim po rnams logs shig tu bsal te brim par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The best mangoes should be set aside and distributed separately.

original: aa mra zhim po mchog logs shig tu bsal te brim par bya ba ste /
analyzed: aa mra zhim po mchog logs shig tu bsal te brim par bya ba ste /
translated: The best mangoes should be set aside and distributed separately.

original: mdo 'di ni mi snyoms pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir byas so //
analyzed: mdo 'di ni mi snyoms pa nyid bsal ba'i phyir byas so //
translated: This sūtra was composed in order to eliminate inequality.

original: de yang mdo snga ma'i spros pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang mdo snga ma'i spros pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is an elaboration of the previous sūtra,

original: 'di ltar aa mra gces pa zhim po dag dang / bar ma dang tha ma dang 'bring dang mi zhim pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro //🔽'drim par byed pa'i ni mkhan po 'am slob dpon gyis mnod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar aa mra gces pa zhim po dag dang / bar ma dang tha ma dang 'bring dang mi zhim pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro // 'drim par byed pa'i ni mkhan po 'am slob dpon gyis mnod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because there are cherished mangoes that are best, middling, and worst, and there are those that are sweet and those that are not.🔽The portion of the distributor should be taken by the preceptor or teacher.

original: 'drim par byed pa'i skal ba ni mkhan po 'am slob dpon gyis mnod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'drim par byed pa'i skal ba ni mkhan po 'am slob dpon gyis mnod par bya ba'o //
translated: The portion of the distributor should be taken by the preceptor or teacher.

original: mi 'thob pa thob na drung na 'dug pas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi 'thob pa thob na drung na 'dug pas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one does not obtain a portion, one should take it from the one sitting next to oneself.

original: mkhan po 'am slob dpon gyis 'drim par byed pa'i skal ba mnod pa na de gnyis rgan pa'i phyir 'drim par byed pas mi 'thob pa 'thob par mi rigs pa shin tu bsod pa dag 'thob pa lta na de ni mi 'thob pa thob pa yin pas mi
analyzed: mkhan po 'am slob dpon gyis 'drim par byed pa'i skal ba mnod pa na de gnyis rgan pa'i phyir 'drim par byed pas mi 'thob pa 'thob par mi rigs pa shin tu bsod pa dag 'thob pa lta na de ni mi 'thob pa thob pa yin pas mi
translated: If the preceptor or master takes the portion that is to be distributed, since they are senior, it is not logical that they obtain what is not obtained.

original: 'thob pa thob na de mi rigs pas de'i tshe mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis mi mnod par 'drim par byed pa rang gi drung na 'dug pa'i grogs gang yin pa des mnod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa thob na de mi rigs pas de'i tshe mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis mi mnod par 'drim par byed pa rang gi drung na 'dug pa'i grogs gang yin pa des mnod par bya'o //
translated: If they obtain what is not obtained, that is illogical. Therefore, at that time, the preceptor or master does not take it, but the companion who is sitting in front of them takes it.🔽Here the text states:

original: 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de dag gi ni mkhan po dang slob dpon dag gis mnod par bya'o //🔽de dag @325a * //
analyzed: de dag gi ni mkhan po dang slob dpon dag gis mnod par bya'o // de dag @325a * //
translated: “Their preceptors and masters should take it.”🔽They

original: gis bsod pa dag 'thob nas /
analyzed: gis bsod pa dag 'thob nas /
translated: obtained what is not obtained.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de dag gi drung na 'dug pa dag gis mnod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi drung na 'dug pa dag gis mnod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Those sitting in front of them should take it.”

original: du ma nyid yin na stan las ma 'phags pas ji tsam len nus pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: du ma nyid yin na stan las ma 'phags pas ji tsam len nus pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there are many portions, then one should take as much as one can carry without rising from one’s seat.

original: 'drim par byed pa du ma nyid yin na drung na 'dug pa'i dge slong stan las ma 'phags pa gang yin pa des de dag gi skal ba ji tsam len nus pa de tsam mnod par bya zhing /
analyzed: 'drim par byed pa du ma nyid yin na drung na 'dug pa'i dge slong stan las ma 'phags pa gang yin pa des de dag gi skal ba ji tsam len nus pa de tsam mnod par bya zhing /
translated: If there are many portions, then the monk who is sitting nearby should take as much as he can carry without rising from his seat.

original: gzhan ni gzhan dag gis mnod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan dag gis mnod par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be taken by others.

original: 'dril ba ni rang gnas nas ma 'phags pas len nus pa 'di yin na byin len ma zhig go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dril ba ni rang gnas nas ma 'phags pas len nus pa 'di yin na byin len ma zhig go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is a lump, then it is permissible to take it without rising from one’s seat.

original: byin len byas pa'i zas 'dril zhing gnas nas gud du song ba gang yin pa de ni rang stan las ma 'phags pas len nus pa nyid yin na byin len ma zhig pa yin la gzhan du na zhig pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: byin len byas pa'i zas 'dril zhing gnas nas gud du song ba gang yin pa de ni rang stan las ma 'phags pas len nus pa nyid yin na byin len ma zhig pa yin la gzhan du na zhig pa kho na yin no //
translated: If it is a lump of food that has been consecrated, then it is permissible to take it without rising from one’s seat. Otherwise, it is permissible to take it after rising from one’s seat.

original: sbrang bu dang grog sbur la sogs pa dag gis reg pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbrang bu dang grog sbur la sogs pa dag gis reg pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is touched by flies, ants, and so on, it is also permissible to take it without rising from one’s seat.

original: sbrang bu dang grog sbur la sogs pa dag gis reg pas kyang byin len ma zhig go //
analyzed: sbrang bu dang grog sbur la sogs pa dag gis reg pas kyang byin len ma zhig go //
translated: It is also lost through contact with flies, ants, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni byi phrug byung ma thag pa'i tshad pas kyang chung ba ni skye ba po phra mo dag bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni byi phrug byung ma thag pa'i tshad pas kyang chung ba ni skye ba po phra mo dag bsdu'o //
translated: The words “etc.” include the contact of the smallest living beings, such as the newly hatched young of insects.

original: dge slong gis ma btang ba la gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong gis ma btang ba la gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is also lost through contact with others, if the monk does not relinquish it.

original: dge slong gis 'dzin pa ma btang ba la mi la sogs pa gzhan gyis reg pas kyang byin len ma zhig pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis 'dzin pa ma btang ba la mi la sogs pa gzhan gyis reg pas kyang byin len ma zhig pa yin no //
translated: It is also lost through contact with others, such as humans, if the monk does not relinquish it.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The text says, “The Blessed One said:

original: de nyid kyis byin len bya zhing de la yang bgo bsha' byas te bza' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis byin len bya zhing de la yang bgo bsha' byas te bza' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It should be received by him, and it should be eaten after it is shared with him.”

original: byi bas ni zhig par byed do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byi bas ni zhig par byed do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is lost through contact with rats.

original: byi bas reg pas ni byin len zhig par byed do //
analyzed: byi bas reg pas ni byin len zhig par byed do //
translated: It is lost through contact with rats.

original: 'dir gzhung ni de ltar sprang bu dang grog sbur dang / byi ba'i bar dag byung nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de ltar sprang bu dang grog sbur dang / byi ba'i bar dag byung nas /
translated: The text says, “If flies, ants, and rats appear in this way,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: byi mang la sogs pa'i byi ba dag gis reg pa ni byin len byas te bza' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byi mang la sogs pa'i byi ba dag gis reg pa ni byin len byas te bza' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “If a rat or other rodent touches the food, then having received the gift, one should eat it.”

original: byin len byas pa'i byin len stobs pa ni mi rigs pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byin len byas pa'i byin len stobs pa ni mi rigs pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not unreasonable to receive the gift again of food that has already received the gift.

original: byin len bstabs zin pa la yang stobs par byed pa ni mi rigs pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: byin len bstabs zin pa la yang stobs par byed pa ni mi rigs pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not unreasonable to receive the gift again of food that has already received the gift.

original: rigs pa kho na yin no /
analyzed: rigs pa kho na yin no /
translated: It is reasonable.

original: de ni 'di la gzhan dag gis reg par ma gyur tam snyam pa'i the tshom bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di la gzhan dag gis reg par ma gyur tam snyam pa'i the tshom bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it removes the doubt of others that it has been touched by them.

original: shes @325b gtso bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes @325b gtso bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The chief of cognition

original: 'dir yang shes gtso bo zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i ming can du sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dir yang shes gtso bo zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i ming can du sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Here, the term “chief of cognition” is applied to the name “chief of perception” and the name “chief of cognition.”

original: gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: With regard to what is the chief of perception?

original: de'i phyir byin len ma bstabs pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir byin len ma bstabs pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “with regard to that which has not received the gift.”

original: byin len ma bstabs pa'i dngos po ni byin len ma bstabs pa nyid de de la'o //
analyzed: byin len ma bstabs pa'i dngos po ni byin len ma bstabs pa nyid de de la'o //
translated: The thing that is not formally accepted is just that which is not formally accepted.

original: gal te 'di ltar zas 'di byin len ma bstabs pa yin no zhes bya bar shes na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar zas 'di byin len ma bstabs pa yin no zhes bya bar shes na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one knows that this food is not formally accepted, this is the meaning.

original: gang gis byin len ma bstabs pa nyid la zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis byin len ma bstabs pa nyid la zhe na /
translated: By whom is it known that it is not formally accepted?

original: de'i phyir / chu dang so shing ma gtogs par bza' bar bya ba'i 'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / chu dang so shing ma gtogs par bza' bar bya ba'i 'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “except for water and tooth cleaners, it is of what is to be eaten.”

original: chu dang so shing ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i bza' bar bya ba'i byin len ma bstabs pa nyid du shes na'o //
analyzed: chu dang so shing ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i bza' bar bya ba'i byin len ma bstabs pa nyid du shes na'o //
translated: Except for water and tooth cleaners, it is of what is to be eaten other than that, if it is known that it is not formally accepted.

original: 'dir chu dang so shing zhes smos pas ni dpe tsam du zad de kha sbyang ba'i 'dag rdzas dang lci ba dag kyang 'dis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir chu dang so shing zhes smos pas ni dpe tsam du zad de kha sbyang ba'i 'dag rdzas dang lci ba dag kyang 'dis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, by mentioning “water and tooth cleaners,” it is just an example. One should understand that mouth-rinsing water and clay are also included.

original: de yang kha sbyang ba'i phyir de skad smras pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang kha sbyang ba'i phyir de skad smras pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, it is said that it is for mouth-rinsing,

original: mgul du mid pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mgul du mid pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: but not for swallowing.

original: mgul du mid pa la ni ltung byed kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mgul du mid pa la ni ltung byed kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it falls into the throat, there is only a downfall.

original: khar ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khar ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the mouth means

original: rna ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis ma yin no //
translated: not in the ear, etc.🔽What is accomplished by eating?

original: ji zhig rjes su bsgrub na bza' bar bya ba byed pa po yin zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / zos na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji zhig rjes su bsgrub na bza' bar bya ba byed pa po yin zhe na / de'i phyir / zos na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The text says, “if one eats it.”

original: bca' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bca' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It refers to what is to be chewed and what is to be swallowed, etc.

original: ci yul thams cad du 'am zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci yul thams cad du 'am zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: In what realm?

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan ma gtogs par ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan ma gtogs par ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The text says, “except in the northern continent.”

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling ma gtogs par ro //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling ma gtogs par ro //
translated: Except in the northern continent of Uttarakuru.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las kyang byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling na ni zas ma byin par kha'i sgo nas za bar byed de /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las kyang byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling na ni zas ma byin par kha'i sgo nas za bar byed de /
translated: Here, the text of the Vinaya says, “In the northern continent of Uttarakuru, one eats food by the mouth without giving it.”

original: gal te byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus su byin gyis rlob na ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gal te byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus su byin gyis rlob na ni ltung ba med do //
translated: If one consecrates it as belonging to the northern continent, there is no offense.

original: ji ste byin gyis mi rlob na ni nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ste byin gyis mi rlob na ni nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one does not consecrate it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nad pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa med na bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa las zan mnod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽nad pa'i khar zan mnod par bsnyen par rdzogs par med na /
analyzed: nad pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa med na bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa las zan mnod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni / nad pa'i khar zan mnod par bsnyen par rdzogs par med na /
translated: If the sick one is not fully ordained, he should receive food from one who is not fully ordained.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa las kyang mnod par bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa las kyang mnod par bya'o //
translated: If the sick one is not fully ordained, he should receive food from one who is not fully ordained.

original: mi na pas ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa yod du zin kyang mi sdug pa'i phyir 'di mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: mi na pas ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa yod du zin kyang mi sdug pa'i phyir 'di mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: If he is not sick, he should not do this, even if he is fully ordained, because it is ugly.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽nad pa kho nas te nad pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas bsnyen par rdzogs @326a * //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas bza' bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni / nad pa kho nas te nad pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas bsnyen par rdzogs @326a * //
translated: One who is not fully ordained should eat it.

original: pa dag gis bstabs pa bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: pa dag gis bstabs pa bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Only the sick one who is not fully ordained should eat the food offered by those who are fully ordained.

original: byin len ma byas par za ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: byin len ma byas par za ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The downfall of eating without having received it has been explained.

original: // / bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: // / bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: The downfall of begging for delicacies is explained.

original: 'o ma dang / zho dang / mar dang / nya sha dang / sha skam lta bu ni zas bsod pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te ;
analyzed: 'o ma dang / zho dang / mar dang / nya sha dang / sha skam lta bu ni zas bsod pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te ;
translated: Milk, curd, butter, fish, meat, and dried meat are called “fine foods.”

original: 'o ma dang / zho dang / mar dang / nya sha dang / sha dang / sha skam lta bu ni zas bsod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o ma dang / zho dang / mar dang / nya sha dang / sha dang / sha skam lta bu ni zas bsod pa yin no //
translated: Milk, curd, butter, fish, meat, and dried meat are called “fine foods.”

original: lta bu zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam pa zhes pa'i don te rnam pa de lta bu dag dang mar khu la sogs pa dag ni zas bsod pa yin no //
analyzed: lta bu zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam pa zhes pa'i don te rnam pa de lta bu dag dang mar khu la sogs pa dag ni zas bsod pa yin no //
translated: The word “etc.” means “and so on.” Such things as oil and so on are called “fine foods.”

original: de ni byed pa po'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni byed pa po'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “That is the agent” means:

original: zas bsod pa de ni ltung ba nyid byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: zas bsod pa de ni ltung ba nyid byed pa po yin no //
translated: That fine food is the agent of the downfall.

original: sbyin par byed pa nye du ma yin pa khyim pa nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin par byed pa nye du ma yin pa khyim pa nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: “The giver is a layperson who is not a relative” means:

original: nye du ma yin pa'i khyim pa ni /
analyzed: nye du ma yin pa'i khyim pa ni /
translated: A layperson who is not a relative

original: nye du ma yin pa'i khyim pa ste /
analyzed: nye du ma yin pa'i khyim pa ste /
translated: is a layperson who is not a relative.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: That is the nature of that.

original: gal te sbyin par byed pa nye du ma yin pa khyim pa nyid yin na de yang ltung ba 'di'i byed pa po yin no /
analyzed: gal te sbyin par byed pa nye du ma yin pa khyim pa nyid yin na de yang ltung ba 'di'i byed pa po yin no /
translated: If the giver is a layperson who is not a relative, then that person is the agent of this downfall.

original: nye du ma yin pa zhes smos pa la gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: nye du ma yin pa zhes smos pa la gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: The text of the rule is stated in the Questions of Upāli:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis bro ma 'tshal bar bdag nyid kyi slad du khyim dag nas zas bsod pa bslangs te 'cha' 'am 'tshal la de la ltung bar mi 'gyur ba mchis sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis bro ma 'tshal bar bdag nyid kyi slad du khyim dag nas zas bsod pa bslangs te 'cha' 'am 'tshal la de la ltung bar mi 'gyur ba mchis sam /
translated: “Venerable! Is there a case where a monk who is not sick eats delicious food that he himself has requested from households and it does not become an offense?”

original: yod de nye du las bslangs te zos na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: yod de nye du las bslangs te zos na ltung ba med do //
translated: “There is, if he eats it after requesting it from relatives.”

original: gal te rtags 'di la sbyin bdag yin na de'i tshe yang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gal te rtags 'di la sbyin bdag yin na de'i tshe yang ltung ba med do //
translated: If the donor is a layperson, then there is no offense.

original: gal te phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba sbyin bdag yin na ni nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba sbyin bdag yin na ni nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If the donor is a renunciate of another religion, then there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gang gi tshe de gnyis byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / rang gis bslangs te zos na'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽rang gis blangs shing zos na ste ;
analyzed: gang gi tshe de gnyis byed pa po nyid yin zhe na / de'i phyir / rang gis bslangs te zos na'o zhes bya ba smras te / rang gis blangs shing zos na ste ;
translated: When are both of these the actual doer?🔽Therefore it says, “If he eats it after requesting it himself.”🔽If he eats it after requesting it himself.

original: / gal te 'o ma la sogs pa dag gis bslangs te rang gis zos na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / gal te 'o ma la sogs pa dag gis bslangs te rang gis zos na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If he eats it after requesting it himself, it means that he eats it after requesting it with milk, etc.

original: za ba las gzhan pa slong ba tsam la kha na ma tho ba cir 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /🔽mi na bas bslangs pa dang slong du bcug pa nyid de la ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: za ba las gzhan pa slong ba tsam la kha na ma tho ba cir 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir / mi na bas bslangs pa dang slong du bcug pa nyid de la ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What is the offense if one merely begs for food, but does not eat it?🔽The text states:🔽For one who is not sick, the act of begging or causing another to beg is a wrong action.

original: mi na bas rang gis bslangs pa tsam la yang de gnyis nyes byas kho na'i byed pa po yin la /
analyzed: mi na bas rang gis bslangs pa tsam la yang de gnyis nyes byas kho na'i byed pa po yin la /
translated: For one who is not sick, the mere act of begging is a wrong action.

original: min par gzhan slong du bcug pa nyid yin na slong du bcug ste zos pa de la ni de gnyis nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: min par gzhan slong du bcug pa nyid yin na slong du bcug ste zos pa de la ni de gnyis nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin no //
translated: If one is not sick, but causes another to beg, and then eats the food, the act of causing another to beg is a wrong action.

original: na ba la ni thams cad du ltung ba med do //
analyzed: na ba la ni thams cad du ltung ba med do //
translated: But if one is sick, there is no offense in any of these acts.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the teaching.

original: mi na bar gang gi tshe rang slong @326b ngam gzhan slong du bcug ste thob nas zas bsod pa za bar mi byed na de'i tshe nyes byas so //
analyzed: mi na bar gang gi tshe rang slong @326b ngam gzhan slong du bcug ste thob nas zas bsod pa za bar mi byed na de'i tshe nyes byas so //
translated: If one is not sick, but begs oneself or causes another to beg, and then does not eat the food, it is a wrong action.

original: mi na bar gang gi tshe gzhan slong du bcug kyang za bar mi byed na ni de'i tshe sbyor ba las byung ba'i nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi na bar gang gi tshe gzhan slong du bcug kyang za bar mi byed na ni de'i tshe sbyor ba las byung ba'i nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
translated: If one who is not sick does not eat when invited by another, then one commits a subtle misdeed arisen from preparation.

original: na ba la ni thams cad du cir yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na ba la ni thams cad du cir yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if one is sick, then there is no fault in any case.🔽Do these two, not accepting what is offered and not eating what is offered, apply to all who are not sick?

original: mi na ba thams cad la de gnyis kha nam tho ba 'di'i byed pa po yin nam zhe na de'i phyir ci bder bstabs pa ma byas pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mi na ba thams cad la de gnyis kha nam tho ba 'di'i byed pa po yin nam zhe na de'i phyir ci bder bstabs pa ma byas pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The text says, “In not accepting what is offered.”

original: gang las slong bar byed pa des dge slong gang la ci bde ba'i bdag nyid du bstabs pa ma byas pa de ni ci bder bstabs pa ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: gang las slong bar byed pa des dge slong gang la ci bde ba'i bdag nyid du bstabs pa ma byas pa de ni ci bder bstabs pa ma byas pa ste /
translated: In not accepting what is offered means that one who is invited by another does not accept what is offered to any monk.

original: dge slong mi na bde la de gnyis kha na ma tho ba 'di'i byed pa po dag yin no //
analyzed: dge slong mi na bde la de gnyis kha na ma tho ba 'di'i byed pa po dag yin no //
translated: These two, not accepting what is offered and not eating what is offered, apply to monks who are not sick.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: dge slong bsod snyoms la rgyu ba khyim dag tu nye bar phyin pa na bud med zas khyer te phyir byung bas dge slong cang mi smra bas sam /
analyzed: dge slong bsod snyoms la rgyu ba khyim dag tu nye bar phyin pa na bud med zas khyer te phyir byung bas dge slong cang mi smra bas sam /
translated: When a monk who goes for alms arrives at a house, a woman comes out with food. If the monk does not speak,

original: phyir spong ba la bud med kyis 'phags pa 'o na ji slong zhes 'dri na bstabs pa yin par brjod par bya ste ci 'dod pa bslangs kyang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: phyir spong ba la bud med kyis 'phags pa 'o na ji slong zhes 'dri na bstabs pa yin par brjod par bya ste ci 'dod pa bslangs kyang ltung ba med do //
translated: If a woman asks an arya, “What do you want?” in order to give something, then it is said that she is offering.🔽There is no offense if one asks for whatever one wants.

original: sbyin bdag gis ci bder byas par gyur na yang ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis ci bder byas par gyur na yang ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If the donor says, “Do whatever you like,” then there is no offense.

original: de'i phyir ngan pa 'am bsod pa'am tha mal pa'am bzang po 'thob pa ni gal te bslangs na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngan pa 'am bsod pa'am tha mal pa'am bzang po 'thob pa ni gal te bslangs na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, if one asks, one may obtain something bad, good, ordinary, or excellent.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir bstabs pa kho na 'ba' zhig ltung ba las 'byin pa yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir bstabs pa kho na 'ba' zhig ltung ba las 'byin pa yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: If one does not accept an offering, then one is not released from the offense.

original: dge slong bstabs pa ma byas pa des ngan ba'am bsod pa'am tha mal pa'am /
analyzed: dge slong bstabs pa ma byas pa des ngan ba'am bsod pa'am tha mal pa'am /
translated: Therefore, if a monk sees that he will obtain something bad, good, ordinary, or excellent,

original: bzang po 'thob pa mthong ba na gal te zas bsod pa'i yul la slong bar byed na /
analyzed: bzang po 'thob pa mthong ba na gal te zas bsod pa'i yul la slong bar byed na /
translated: if he asks for food in a place where there is good food,

original: de lta na yang zas bsod pa'i mtshan nyid dang nye du ma yin pa khyim pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yan lag de gnyis blangs na ni nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin la /
analyzed: de lta na yang zas bsod pa'i mtshan nyid dang nye du ma yin pa khyim pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yan lag de gnyis blangs na ni nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin la /
translated: However, if one accepts those two branches, the characteristics of good food and the characteristics of a layperson who is not a relative, one is an agent of an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de sngon du btang ste zos na ni dngos gzhi'i byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: de sngon du btang ste zos na ni dngos gzhi'i byed pa po yin no //
translated: If one eats after accepting those, one is an agent of the actual basis.

original: ngan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Bad means

analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa las gzhan pa 'bru mar la sogs pa'o //
translated: other than milk and so on, such as oil.

original: bsod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Good means

original: 'o ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: milk and so on.

original: tha mal pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha mal pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Ordinary means

analyzed: 'o ma de nyid ra la sogs pa'i yin pa'o //

analyzed: bzang po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Excellent means

original: 'o ma de nyid ba la sogs pa'i yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'o ma de nyid ba la sogs pa'i yin pa'o //

analyzed: yang na ngan pa zhes bya ba ni ra'i 'o ma'o //
translated: Alternatively, bad means the milk of a goat.

original: bsod pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras kyi 'o thug mar dang sha kha ra dang bsres pa'o //
analyzed: bsod pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras kyi 'o thug mar dang sha kha ra dang bsres pa'o //
translated: Good means rice soup mixed with butter, meat and sugar.

original: tha mal pa zhes bya ba ni ba'i 'o ma'o //
analyzed: tha mal pa zhes bya ba ni ba'i 'o ma'o //
translated: Ordinary means the milk of a cow.

original: bzang po zhes bya ba ni gong ma sreg la sogs pa'i @327a * //
analyzed: bzang po zhes bya ba ni gong ma sreg la sogs pa'i @327a * //
translated: “Good” means the above-mentioned meat and so on.

original: sha bal po se'u'i khu pa na le sham la sogs pa spod kyi bye brag dag dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: sha bal po se'u'i khu pa na le sham la sogs pa spod kyi bye brag dag dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: “Bad” means the various spices such as ginger, cardamom, and so on.

original: ngan pa 'di la ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngan pa 'di la ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Half” means

analyzed: zas bsod pa blangs te / za ba la ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa byas pa gang yin pa de ngan pa rang gis blangs te za ba 'di la ni phyed nyid de sbyor ba la yang nyes byas yin la /
translated: that if one takes good food and

analyzed: dngos gzhi la yang nyes byas yin no //
translated: eats it, then the downfall is established. If one takes bad food and eats it, then it is half, that is, a wrong action in the preparation and a wrong action in the actual act.

original: gzhan slong du bcug pa zos na ni nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan slong du bcug pa zos na ni nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats after having asked another person to get it, then it is a minor offense.

original: 'dir ltung ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir ltung ba ni /
translated: Here, the downfall is incurred

original: dge slong gis 'o ma 'thob pa na zho slong bar byed na de slong ba la ni nyes byas la 'thungs na ni ltung byed do //
analyzed: dge slong gis 'o ma 'thob pa na zho slong bar byed na de slong ba la ni nyes byas la 'thungs na ni ltung byed do //
translated: if a monk obtains milk and asks for yogurt, then he commits an offense for asking and an offense of wrongdoing for drinking it.

original: dge slong gis bsod pa 'thob pa na ngan pa slong bar byed na de slong ba la yang nyes byas la zos pa la yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong gis bsod pa 'thob pa na ngan pa slong bar byed na de slong ba la yang nyes byas la zos pa la yang nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk asks for good food when he has received bad food, then he commits an offense of wrong conduct in asking, and an offense of wrong conduct in eating.

original: ngan pa mi 'thob pa nyid na ni thams cad du nyes byas kyi byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: ngan pa mi 'thob pa nyid na ni thams cad du nyes byas kyi byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: If he does not receive bad food, then he commits an offense of wrong conduct in all cases.

original: ci bder bstabs pa'i mtshan nyid smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: ci bder bstabs pa'i mtshan nyid smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: The characteristic of being served as one wishes is stated:🔽If the donor comes out with food and asks, “What do you want?”

original: zas khyer te phyir byung bas cang mi smra pa'am phyir spang ba la 'o na ci slong zhes dris pa ni ci bder bstabs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zas khyer te phyir byung bas cang mi smra pa'am phyir spang ba la 'o na ci slong zhes dris pa ni ci bder bstabs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: if the monk is silent or refuses, saying, “I don’t need this,” then that is being served as one wishes.

original: zas khyer te phyir byung ba'i sbyin pa pos dge slong cang mi smra ba'am /
analyzed: zas khyer te phyir byung ba'i sbyin pa pos dge slong cang mi smra ba'am /
translated: If the donor comes out with food and the monk is silent or refuses, saying, “I don’t need this,”

original: kho bo la 'di mi dgos so zhes phyir spong ba la gal te de'i tshe 'di skad ces 'o na ci slang zhes dri bar gyur na de skad dris pa de ni ci bder bstabs pa yin no //
analyzed: kho bo la 'di mi dgos so zhes phyir spong ba la gal te de'i tshe 'di skad ces 'o na ci slang zhes dri bar gyur na de skad dris pa de ni ci bder bstabs pa yin no //
translated: if the donor asks, “What do you want?” then that is being served as one wishes.

original: bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /🔽// / srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to / // / srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: The second downfall is to use water containing living beings.🔽The basis is water containing living beings.

original: rang spyad pa'i don gnyis la 'jug pa dang 'jug tu 'dzud pa dag la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rang spyad pa'i don gnyis la 'jug pa dang 'jug tu 'dzud pa dag la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The action is to use it oneself or to make others use it.🔽The affliction is any of the three mental poisons.

original: rang nyid nye bar spyad pa ni rang spyad pa'o //🔽de nyid don yin te de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: rang nyid nye bar spyad pa ni rang spyad pa'o // de nyid don yin te de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: The completion is the use of the water for one’s own purposes.🔽The downfall is accrued when the water is used for one’s own purposes, either by oneself or by someone else.🔽The third downfall is to speak of the faults of a layperson or a renunciate.

original: de la bdag nyid 'jug pa dang gzhan 'jug tu 'dzud pa dag gang yin pa de gnyis la'o //
analyzed: de la bdag nyid 'jug pa dang gzhan 'jug tu 'dzud pa dag gang yin pa de gnyis la'o //
translated: The basis is a layperson or a renunciate.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: The action is to speak of his or her faults.🔽The affliction is any of the three mental poisons.🔽The completion is the understanding of the meaning of one’s words by the person of whom one speaks.🔽The downfall is accrued when the other person understands the meaning of one’s words.🔽The fourth downfall is to praise oneself and disparage others in order to obtain material gain.🔽The basis is a person who is suitable to be a patron.

original: bdag nyid kyi don du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la sogs pa spyod pa la rang 'jug pa dang gzhan 'jug tu 'dzud par byed na rang spyod pa'i don nyid la rang 'jug pa dang / gzhan 'jug tu 'dzud par byed pa'i ltung byed de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi don du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la sogs pa spyod pa la rang 'jug pa dang gzhan 'jug tu 'dzud par byed na rang spyod pa'i don nyid la rang 'jug pa dang / gzhan 'jug tu 'dzud par byed pa'i ltung byed de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The action is to praise oneself and disparage others in order to obtain material gain.🔽The affliction is any of the three mental poisons.🔽The completion is the expression of the praise and disparagement.🔽The downfall is accrued when the other person understands the meaning of one’s words.🔽The fifth downfall is to give up the training and return to a life of worldly pursuits.🔽The basis is the thought of giving up the training.🔽The action is to give up the training and return to a life of worldly pursuits.🔽The affliction is any of the three mental poisons.🔽The completion is the expression of the intention to give up the training.🔽The downfall is accrued when the other person understands the meaning of one’s words.

original: gzhan spyad pa'i don nyid la 'jug pa dang gzhan 'jug tu 'dzud pa de gnyis ni sngar srog chags ngang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed bstan pa de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan spyad pa'i don nyid la 'jug pa dang gzhan 'jug tu 'dzud pa de gnyis ni sngar srog chags ngang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed bstan pa de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The two, engaging in the very object of using what belongs to others and causing others to engage in it, are the chief motivators of the downfall of using what has living beings.

original: shes @327b gtso'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes @327b gtso'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term “chief”

original: 'dir yang shes gtso zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i ming can du sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dir yang shes gtso zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i ming can du sbyor bar byed do //
translated: is also applied here to the term “chief motivator” and the term “chief motivator of the downfall of using what has living beings.”

original: gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: What is the chief motivator?

original: de'i phyir srog chags dang bcas pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir srog chags dang bcas pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “it is the very thing that has living beings.”

original: chu la sogs pa gang la srog chags dag dang lhan cig 'jug pa de ni srog chags dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: chu la sogs pa gang la srog chags dag dang lhan cig 'jug pa de ni srog chags dang bcas pa'o //
translated: That which has living beings is that in which living beings enter together with water and so on.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: That very thing is its nature.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa nyid de la der 'du shes pa ni kha na ma tho ba 'di'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa nyid de la der 'du shes pa ni kha na ma tho ba 'di'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The agent of this offense is one who perceives the water, etc., as containing living beings.

original: gal te chu la sogs pa yang srog chags dang bcas pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gal te chu la sogs pa yang srog chags dang bcas pa nyid yin la /
translated: If the water, etc., does contain living beings,

original: dge slong gis kyang de ltar shes bzhin du spyad na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge slong gis kyang de ltar shes bzhin du spyad na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and the monk uses it with that knowledge, then this is an offense.

original: gang zhig srog chags dang bcas pa nyid la yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig srog chags dang bcas pa nyid la yin zhe na /
translated: What is the offense for using water, etc., that does not contain living beings?🔽Therefore, the text says:

original: de'i phyir chu dang / zhun mar dang / 'bru mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / bu ram gyi dbu ba dang / 'o ma dang / zho dang / mar dang / tshva dang / 'bru'i tsha dang / zho ga chu dang / rtsab mo dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir chu dang / zhun mar dang / 'bru mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / bu ram gyi dbu ba dang / 'o ma dang / zho dang / mar dang / tshva dang / 'bru'i tsha dang / zho ga chu dang / rtsab mo dang /
translated: “One should use water, oil, sesame oil, honey, molasses, milk, curd, ghee, salt, grain, grain-flour, sugarcane juice, and roots,

original: shing tog dang / bca' bar bya ba la sogs par nye bar spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: shing tog dang / bca' bar bya ba la sogs par nye bar spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: fruits, and vegetables that are free of living beings.”

original: chu dang / zhun mar dang / 'bru mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / bu ram gyi dbu ba dang / 'o ma dang / zho dang / mar dang / tshva dang / 'bru'i tsha dang / zho ga chu dang / rtsa ba mo dang /
analyzed: chu dang / zhun mar dang / 'bru mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / bu ram gyi dbu ba dang / 'o ma dang / zho dang / mar dang / tshva dang / 'bru'i tsha dang / zho ga chu dang / rtsa ba mo dang /
translated: water, oil, ghee, honey, molasses, milk, curd, butter, salt, grain, grain flour, grain water, and root vegetables.

original: shing tog dang / bca' bar bya ba la sogs pa nye bar sbyar bar bya ba srog chags dang bcas pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: shing tog dang / bca' bar bya ba la sogs pa nye bar sbyar bar bya ba srog chags dang bcas pa nyid la'o //
translated: The term “and so on” includes fruit and other things that are to be eaten.

original: nye bar spyar bar bya ba de dag srog chags ji lta bu dag gis srog chags dang bcas pa nyid la yin zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar spyar bar bya ba de dag srog chags ji lta bu dag gis srog chags dang bcas pa nyid la yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of living beings are found in these things that are to be used?

original: de'i phyir snang ba dag gis so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba dag gis so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “by those that are visible.”

original: gang dag ltar nus pa de dag gi ni snang ba dag ste /
analyzed: gang dag ltar nus pa de dag gi ni snang ba dag ste /
translated: Those that are visible are those that can be seen.

original: de'i phyir de dag gis srog chags ngang bcas pa nyid la yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gis srog chags ngang bcas pa nyid la yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, these things are said to contain living beings because of those living beings that are visible.

original: mi snang ba dag gis srog chags dang bcas pa nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi snang ba dag gis srog chags dang bcas pa nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: However, these things are not said to contain living beings because of those living beings that are not visible.

original: gang gi tshe srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa de kha na ma tho ba 'di'i byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa de kha na ma tho ba 'di'i byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If one engages in sexual union with a living being, then at that time one is the agent of this misdeed.

original: de'i phyir shi na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shi na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “when dead.”

original: srog chags dag gi srog gi dbang po 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skad cig ma gnyis pa la'o //
analyzed: srog chags dag gi srog gi dbang po 'gag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skad cig ma gnyis pa la'o //
translated: When the life faculty of a living being ceases, that is, in the second moment.

original: ci srog chags du ma shi na yang kha na ma tho ba gcig gi byed pa po nyid yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci srog chags du ma shi na yang kha na ma tho ba gcig gi byed pa po nyid yin nam zhe na /
translated: If many living beings die, is one the agent of one misdeed?

original: de'i phyir srog chags re re'i'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽dud @328a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir srog chags re re'i'o zhes bya ba smras te / dud @328a * //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “for each living being.”

original: 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags ji snyed sbyor ba'i de'i dbang gis srog bcad de dus byas na de snyed kho na'i ltung byed du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags ji snyed sbyor ba'i de'i dbang gis srog bcad de dus byas na de snyed kho na'i ltung byed du 'gyur te /
translated: For as many living beings born in the animal birth state as one engages in sexual union with, for that many one commits a downfall, since one kills them and they die through one’s power.

original: dngos gzhi 'di ni nges pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos gzhi 'di ni nges pa yin no //
translated: This is the definite actual basis.

original: sbyor ba ni rtsom pa'i dbang gis ma nges te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rtsom pa'i dbang gis ma nges te /
translated: The preparation is indefinite, since it depends on the effort.

original: rtsom pa gcig gis sngar mang po de dag shi bar gyur na yang sbyor ba'i kha na ma tho ba gcig kho na'i yin la /🔽ji ste srog chags ji snyed pa rtsom pa la yang de snyed kyis bsad na ni sbyor ba yang de snyed kho nar so sor 'gyur bas /
analyzed: rtsom pa gcig gis sngar mang po de dag shi bar gyur na yang sbyor ba'i kha na ma tho ba gcig kho na'i yin la / ji ste srog chags ji snyed pa rtsom pa la yang de snyed kyis bsad na ni sbyor ba yang de snyed kho nar so sor 'gyur bas /
translated: Although many die due to a single action, it is only one action of killing.🔽But if as many living beings are killed as there are actions, then there would be that many actions of killing.

original: rtsom pa ji snyed pa de snyed kho na'i sbyor ba'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsom pa ji snyed pa de snyed kho na'i sbyor ba'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there would be that many actions of killing as there are actions.

original: spyod pa ni lus kyir nye bar spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spyod pa ni lus kyir nye bar spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The performance is the performance of the body.

original: lus kyir nye bar spyad pa yin te /
analyzed: lus kyir nye bar spyad pa yin te /
translated: It is the performance of the body.

original: de ni spyod pa mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni spyod pa mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught from the point of view of the characteristics of performance.

original: da ni spyod pa ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni spyod pa ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach performance from the point of view of its nature,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is said:

original: khrus dang btung ba dang so shing dor ba dang lag pa dang rkang ba bkru ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: khrus dang btung ba dang so shing dor ba dang lag pa dang rkang ba bkru ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is like bathing, drinking, spitting out the tooth stick, and washing the hands and feet.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is like this is the teaching.

original: khrus dang btung ba dang so shing dor ba dang lag pa dang rkang ba bkru ba lus kyi nye bar spyad pa ni spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //🔽lus kyi yo byad dag tu nye bar sbyar ba gang yin pa de ni lus kyi nye bar spyad pa kho na yin par shes par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khrus dang btung ba dang so shing dor ba dang lag pa dang rkang ba bkru ba lus kyi nye bar spyad pa ni spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no // lus kyi yo byad dag tu nye bar sbyar ba gang yin pa de ni lus kyi nye bar spyad pa kho na yin par shes par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Bathing, drinking, cleaning the teeth, washing the hands and feet are the nature of bodily utilization.🔽In order to demonstrate that what is applied to the requisites of the body is only the utilization of the body, he says:

original: yo byad dag tu nye bar spyad pa gang yin pa de ni lus kying yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yo byad dag tu nye bar spyad pa gang yin pa de ni lus kying yin no zhes bya ba smras te /

translated: The term and so on includes all the remaining examples.🔽The term and so on in the root text also includes the examples of blocking and releasing the flow of water and planting and uprooting trees.🔽The term and so on in the root text also includes the examples of blocking and releasing the flow of water and planting and uprooting trees.

analyzed: kyi steng gi nam mkha' la gzhag par bya zhing dgang ba dang btsags par bya ba'i chu zed par byed pa tshags so //

original: tshags de gdags pa zhes bya ba ni //

translated: The placing of the strainer is

original: gdags pa de nyid bya ba yin te /

analyzed: lcags gzer gang dag la zed par byed pa tshags de gdags par bya dgos pa ste /

analyzed: de ni zed snod kyi steng gi nam mkha' la gzhag par bya zhing dgang ba dang btsags par bya ba'i chu zed par byed pa tshags gdags par bya ba'i lcags gzer dag yin no //

translated: are the three pieces of wood that are fixed in the space above the trough and that hold the nails that are fixed in the space above the trough and that hold the water that is to be poured in and strained.

analyzed: dpyang tshags gang la shing bu gsum yod pa de ni shing bu gsum dang ldan pa yin no //

original: de zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

original: dpyang tshags zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dpyang tshags zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /

analyzed: chu btsags pa'i phyir dpyang tshags bcang bar bya'o //
translated: A strainer should be used to strain water.

original: de ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhig ce na /

analyzed: dpyang tshags gang la shing bu gsum snol mar sbrel zhing de la yang lcags gzer dag chu tshags gdags pa'i don du btab pa yin no //

original: chu tshags khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
analyzed: chu tshags khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /

analyzed: dgang bar bya ba dang btsags par bya ba'i chu zed par byed pa'o //

original: de phyogs gang du gzhag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de phyogs gang du gzhag par bya zhe na /

original: sa la gzhag pa'i snod bum pa la sogs pa chu tshags nas 'dzag pa'i chu zed par byed pa gang yin pa de'i steng gi nam mkha' de la shing bu gsum la btags te gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sa la gzhag pa'i snod bum pa la sogs pa chu tshags nas 'dzag pa'i chu zed par byed pa gang yin pa de'i steng gi nam mkha' de la shing bu gsum la btags te gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The water-pot is placed on the ground, and the water-pot is placed on the ground, and the water is drawn up by the water-pot. On the space above that, three sticks are tied and placed.

original: de ltar yang 'ding gzhung ni /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'ding gzhung ni /
translated: Also, the text is as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: dpyang chags bya zhing de'i yang thog tu lcags gzer gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: dpyang chags bya zhing de'i yang thog tu lcags gzer gdab par bya'o //

original: de la chu tshags gdags par bya zhing de'i 'og tu bum pa gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de la chu tshags gdags par bya zhing de'i 'og tu bum pa gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The water-pot should be placed on that, and below that, the pot should be placed.

analyzed: chu snod kyi bum pa dgang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //

original: 'dir chu snod kyi bum pa dgang bar bya'o zhes @330b gsungs pa'i don ni /
analyzed: 'dir chu snod kyi bum pa dgang bar bya'o zhes @330b gsungs pa'i don ni /
translated: Here, the meaning of the pot of the water-container should be filled with water is as follows:

original: chu snod kyi chu tshags kyi nang du chus dgang bar bya zhing chu chags des btsags pa'i chus zed snod kyi bum pa 'og ma gang bar 'gyur ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chu snod kyi chu tshags kyi nang du chus dgang bar bya zhing chu chags des btsags pa'i chus zed snod kyi bum pa 'og ma gang bar 'gyur ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The water-pot of the water-container should be filled with water, and by that drawn-up water, the lower pot of the water-container should be filled with water. This is to be understood.

original: chu gnas par bya ba'i phyir chu tshags su gcal gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chu gnas par bya ba'i phyir chu tshags su gcal gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
