original: chu gnas par bya ba'i phyir chu tshags de'i nang du gcal gzhug par bya ba ste /
analyzed: chu gnas par bya ba'i phyir chu tshags de'i nang du gcal gzhug par bya ba ste /
translated: A strainer should be placed in that water-pot in order to keep the water.

original: tshig 'di ni dge slong gis spyad pa'i chu tshags zin pa'i 'og tu tshags kyi nang na gnas pa'i chu myur du zad na de na gnas pa'i srog chags rnams 'chi bar 'gyur ba de yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig 'di ni dge slong gis spyad pa'i chu tshags zin pa'i 'og tu tshags kyi nang na gnas pa'i chu myur du zad na de na gnas pa'i srog chags rnams 'chi bar 'gyur ba de yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This statement is to avoid the quick exhaustion of the water remaining in the strainer after the monk has used the water-pot, so that the living beings in the water will not die.

original: gcal ji zhig gzhug par bya zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gcal ji zhig gzhug par bya zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What kind of strainer should be placed in the water-pot?

original: bye ma'am lci ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bye ma'am lci ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is said: “sand or ashes.”

original: de gnyis gang yang rung ba gcal du gzhug go //🔽yang na tshags rten snod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de gnyis gang yang rung ba gcal du gzhug go // yang na tshags rten snod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Either of those two should be placed in the strainer.🔽Or, the water-pot is a container for the strainer.🔽In order to keep the water, a container for the strainer should be placed in the water-pot.

original: chu gnas par bya ba'i phyir chu tshags la yang na tshags rten snod gzhug gi / de ji 'dra ba zhig ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: chu gnas par bya ba'i phyir chu tshags la yang na tshags rten snod gzhug gi / de ji 'dra ba zhig ce na de'i phyir /
translated: What is it like?

original: sa dang zangs ma las byas pa gang yang rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /🔽gang yang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni sa las byas pa yang rung /
analyzed: sa dang zangs ma las byas pa gang yang rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te / gang yang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni sa las byas pa yang rung /
translated: It is made of either wood or copper.

original: zangs ma las byas pa yang rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de ni shing bu gsum gyi thog ma la gdags so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zangs ma las byas pa yang rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de ni shing bu gsum gyi thog ma la gdags so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Either” means it is made of either wood or copper.

original: tshags rten snod de ni shing bu gsum gyi thog ma la gdags pa'o //
analyzed: tshags rten snod de ni shing bu gsum gyi thog ma la gdags pa'o //
translated: “ It is attached to the first of the three sticks” means that the container for the support is attached to the first of the three sticks.

original: thabs gang gis she na de'i phyir /
analyzed: thabs gang gis she na de'i phyir /
translated: “ By what means?”

original: bu gur lung byas te'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bu gur lung byas te'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “ It is attached by means of a hole.”

original: bu gu pug nas deng lung btags te de shing bu gsum gyi thog ma la btags so //🔽de ni ngos gnyis nas btags na yang 'dug tu btub po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bu gu pug nas deng lung btags te de shing bu gsum gyi thog ma la btags so // de ni ngos gnyis nas btags na yang 'dug tu btub po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A hole is made in the first stick, and the container for the support is attached to it.

original: bu gu du ma zhig dgos na yang tshags rten snod la bu gu du ma tsam gyis shing bu la gdags su rung ba de snyed kyi bu gu bya'o //
analyzed: bu gu du ma zhig dgos na yang tshags rten snod la bu gu du ma tsam gyis shing bu la gdags su rung ba de snyed kyi bu gu bya'o //
translated: “ It can be attached from two sides” means that if many holes are needed, as many holes are made as there are sticks to be attached to the container for the support.

original: phyi rol gyi ngos su tshags rten snod bzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ngos su tshags rten snod bzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The outer side of the water strainer should be placed in a container.

original: gal te chu tshags kyi nang rol du tshags rten snod gzhag par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te chu tshags kyi nang rol du tshags rten snod gzhag par gyur na /
translated: If the container for the strainer is placed inside the water strainer,

original: de'i tshe tshags rten snod kyi 'og tu song ba'i srog chags dag 'chi bar 'gyur srid pas nyes dmigs der mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshags rten snod kyi 'og tu song ba'i srog chags dag 'chi bar 'gyur srid pas nyes dmigs der mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //
translated: then the creatures that go under the container for the strainer might die. This sūtra was composed to prevent that fault.

original: de ji zhig gis gdags she na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ji zhig gis gdags she na de'i phyir /
translated: By what are they to be fastened? Therefore it is said:

original: snga ma ni tha gus so //
analyzed: snga ma ni tha gus so //
translated: The former with a cord,

original: phyi ma ni lcags thag 'jam pos so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phyi ma ni lcags thag 'jam pos so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: the latter with a soft iron chain.

original: snga ma las byas pa ni tha gus gdags so //
analyzed: snga ma las byas pa ni tha gus gdags so //
translated: The former, which is made of leather, is fastened with a cord.

original: phyi ma zangs las byas pa ni lcags thag 'jam @331a * //
analyzed: phyi ma zangs las byas pa ni lcags thag 'jam @331a * //
translated: The latter, which is made of copper, is fastened with a soft iron chain.

original: pos gdags so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pos gdags so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshags rten snod de gang zag gis kyang bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshags rten snod de gang zag gis kyang bcang bar bya'o //
translated: That should be carried by the person.

original: chu mi 'dzag na shing leb kyis chu tshags la dal bu dal bus yang dang yang du brdab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chu mi 'dzag na shing leb kyis chu tshags la dal bu dal bus yang dang yang du brdab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If water does not drip, then the water strainer should be slowly and repeatedly tapped with a wooden board.

original: gal te chu tshags las chu mi 'dzag na de'i tshe shing leb kyis chu tshags la dal bu dal bus yang dang yang du brdab par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te chu tshags las chu mi 'dzag na de'i tshe shing leb kyis chu tshags la dal bu dal bus yang dang yang du brdab par bya'o //
translated: If water does not drip from the water strainer, then at that time the water strainer should be slowly and repeatedly tapped with a wooden board.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gal te chu tshags gru gsum la sogs pa thags bzang bas chu mi 'dzag na de la shing leb kyis chu tshags la dal bu dal bus yang dang yang du brdab par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te chu tshags gru gsum la sogs pa thags bzang bas chu mi 'dzag na de la shing leb kyis chu tshags la dal bu dal bus yang dang yang du brdab par bya'o //
translated: If water does not drip from the water strainer due to its good weaving, then it should be slowly and repeatedly tapped with a wooden board.

original: bum tshags gce'u can ni tshegs chung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bum tshags gce'u can ni tshegs chung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A water strainer with a spout is less troublesome.

original: bum tshags gce'u can ni tshegs chung zhing bya sla ba yin pas /
analyzed: bum tshags gce'u can ni tshegs chung zhing bya sla ba yin pas /
translated: A water strainer with a spout is less troublesome and easier to make.

original: de la 'dod pa bskyed par bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa bskyed par bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that desire should be generated for that.

original: bum tshags gce'u can ni de nas chu'i sgra tig tig sgrog cing 'dzag pa'am yang na de'i nang du chu'i sgra sgrog cing 'gro ba dang 'bab pa dang 'dzag par 'gyur ba'i phyir sgra sgrog ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bum tshags gce'u can ni de nas chu'i sgra tig tig sgrog cing 'dzag pa'am yang na de'i nang du chu'i sgra sgrog cing 'gro ba dang 'bab pa dang 'dzag par 'gyur ba'i phyir sgra sgrog ces bya ba'o //
translated: The water-pot with a spout is called “with a sound” because water drips from it with a dripping sound or because the sound of water moving, flowing, and dripping is heard inside it.

original: de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bum tshags gce'u can de gang zag gis kyang bcang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bum tshags gce'u can de gang zag gis kyang bcang bar bya ba'o //
translated: “One should carry it” means that the person should carry the water-pot with a spout.

original: de ci las byas pa zhe na /
analyzed: de ci las byas pa zhe na /
translated: What is it made of?

original: de'i phyir sa'am zangs ma las byas pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa'am zangs ma las byas pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “It is made of clay or copper.”

original: sa las byas pa yang rung zangs ma las byas pa yang rung ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sa las byas pa yang rung zangs ma las byas pa yang rung ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that it is made of clay or copper.

original: de'i dbyibs ci 'dra zhe na de'i phyir de ni bum pa'i dbyibs can nang padma'i bu gu lta bu dang ldan pa 'og sbubs can yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i dbyibs ci 'dra zhe na de'i phyir de ni bum pa'i dbyibs can nang padma'i bu gu lta bu dang ldan pa 'og sbubs can yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What is its shape? Therefore, it is said, “It has the shape of a pot, with an opening like the mouth of a lotus, and is hollow below.”

original: bum tshags gce'u can gang la bum pa lta bu'i dbyibs kyi rnam pa yod pa de ni bum pa'i dbyibs can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bum tshags gce'u can gang la bum pa lta bu'i dbyibs kyi rnam pa yod pa de ni bum pa'i dbyibs can zhes bya'o //
translated: A box with a lid is called “having the shape of a pot” because it has the shape of a pot.

original: bum tshags gce'u can gang gi nang na padma'i bu gu lta bu'i bu gu dag yod pa de ni /🔽nang padma'i bu gu lta bu dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bum tshags gce'u can gang gi nang na padma'i bu gu lta bu'i bu gu dag yod pa de ni / nang padma'i bu gu lta bu dang ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: A box with a lid is called “having an interior like a lotus” because it has holes like the holes of a lotus.🔽The holes are like the holes in the interior of a lotus.🔽It is called “having an interior like a lotus” because it has holes like the holes in the interior of a lotus.

original: padma'i snying po'i nang na gnas pa'i bu gu dag lta bu'i bu gu dag 'di'i nang na yang yod pa yin no //🔽'og sbubs can yin no zhes bya ba ni /🔽bu gu de dag gi ngos 'og ma rnams la gce'u lta bu'i sbubs dag yod pa yin te /
analyzed: padma'i snying po'i nang na gnas pa'i bu gu dag lta bu'i bu gu dag 'di'i nang na yang yod pa yin no // 'og sbubs can yin no zhes bya ba ni / bu gu de dag gi ngos 'og ma rnams la gce'u lta bu'i sbubs dag yod pa yin te /
translated: The holes are like the holes in the interior of a lotus.🔽The lower sides of the holes are like the lid of a box.

original: de'i nang gi bu gu rnams kyi 'og sbubs can dag tu bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i nang gi bu gu rnams kyi 'og sbubs can dag tu bya ba'o //
translated: The holes in the interior are called “having an interior like a lotus” because they have holes like the holes in the interior of a lotus.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bum pa'i dbyibs lta bur bya zhing de'i nang du padma'i rnam pa lta bu'i bu gu dag gdod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bum pa'i dbyibs lta bur bya zhing de'i nang du padma'i rnam pa lta bu'i bu gu dag gdod par bya'o //
translated: The text says: “One should make it like the shape of a pot, and in the interior one should make holes like the shape of a lotus.”

original: @331b de dag bsdu ba'i phyir de dag gi steng du bu gu chen po gcig gdod par bya'o //
analyzed: @331b de dag bsdu ba'i phyir de dag gi steng du bu gu chen po gcig gdod par bya'o //
translated: In order to collect them, a large hole should be made on top of them.

original: de dag nyid bsdu ba'i phyir 'og sbubs can du bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid bsdu ba'i phyir 'og sbubs can du bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In order to collect them, it should be made with a hollow underneath.

original: 'dir steng du bu gu chen po gcig gdod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni bum pa'i kha nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir steng du bu gu chen po gcig gdod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ni bum pa'i kha nyid yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the statement “a large hole should be made on top” should be understood to refer to the mouth of the pot.

original: de dag tu ras mas 'dags pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag tu ras mas 'dags pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They should be filtered with cloth.

original: nang gi bu gu de dag tu chu 'dzag pa rnams ras mas btsags par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: nang gi bu gu de dag tu chu 'dzag pa rnams ras mas btsags par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: The water that drips from those inner holes should be filtered with cloth.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: chu tshags pa'i bu gu dag gi steng du bum pa'i gcal thabs su chu tshags su rung ba'i rdzas kyi ras ma ji tsam gyis g-yogs pa de tsam gyis btsags shing srog chags med par bya'o //
analyzed: chu tshags pa'i bu gu dag gi steng du bum pa'i gcal thabs su chu tshags su rung ba'i rdzas kyi ras ma ji tsam gyis g-yogs pa de tsam gyis btsags shing srog chags med par bya'o //
translated: The cloth that is suitable for filtering water should be placed on top of the holes of the water filter and the pot should be covered with it. The water should be filtered and made free of living beings to the extent that the cloth covers it.

original: 'dir gzhung ni de dag gi steng du ras mas g-yogs te chu btsags par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de dag gi steng du ras mas g-yogs te chu btsags par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text states, “They should be covered with cloth and the water should be filtered.”

original: chu tshags nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chu tshags nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The water strainer should be kept nearby means

original: chu la sogs pas kun nas 'dzag par byed pa'i phyir chu tshags zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chu la sogs pas kun nas 'dzag par byed pa'i phyir chu tshags zhes bya ba ste /
translated: water strainer because it is used to filter water, etc.

original: dge slong gnas su chu tshags bzhag ste gnas gzhan du song ba chu tshags de dang ldan pa nyid ma yin pa ni de'i tshe na rang dga' byed pa ma yin pa ma yin te /

translated: A monk who goes to another place, having left a water-purifying filter at a place, is not one who does not have that water-purifying filter at that time. He is not one who acts independently.

original: rang dga' byed pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang dga' byed pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he is one who acts independently.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

translated: If one is not certain that one will have a water strainer if one goes there, then one should not go there without a water strainer.

analyzed: gcig gis dge 'dun man chad du ma de dang ldan pa nyid ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ro //

translated: By going means by a monk who goes in this way.🔽By him means by the very one who previously examined the water at the beginning of the league.

original: des zhes bya ba ni sngar rgyang grags kyi mgor chu brtag pa byas pa de nyid kyis so rgyang grags kyi bar du zhes bya ba ni sngar rgyang grags kyi mgor chu ba rtags pa'i gnas de man chad nas brtsams te rgyang grags gcig gi mthar thug gi
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni sngar rgyang grags kyi mgor chu brtag pa byas pa de nyid kyis so rgyang grags kyi bar du zhes bya ba ni sngar rgyang grags kyi mgor chu ba rtags pa'i gnas de man chad nas brtsams te rgyang grags gcig gi mthar thug gi
translated: Up to a league means beginning from the place where he previously examined the water at the beginning of the league, up to the end of the league.

original: bar du'o // 'jug tu rung ngo zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'gro ba'i dge slong gis ni sngar rgyang grags kyi mgor chu brtag pa byas pa de nyid kyis rgyang grags gcig gi mthar thug gi bar du chu brtag mi dgos par 'dod dgur spyad cing 'jug tu rung ngo
analyzed: bar du'o // 'jug tu rung ngo zhes bya ba ni de ltar 'gro ba'i dge slong gis ni sngar rgyang grags kyi mgor chu brtag pa byas pa de nyid kyis rgyang grags gcig gi mthar thug gi bar du chu brtag mi dgos par 'dod dgur spyad cing 'jug tu rung ngo
translated: It is suitable to enter means that a monk who is going in that way does not need to examine the water up to the end of the next league, as he did at the beginning of the league, but it is suitable to enter and use it as he wishes.

original: // de man chad ni yang dge slong des chu brtag par bya dgos te /
analyzed: // de man chad ni yang dge slong des chu brtag par bya dgos te /
translated: From there on, that monk must examine the water.

original: snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: As before, apply as appropriate.

original: spyir btang ba byas pa de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gal te de chu gzhan dang 'dres par gyur na de yan chad du'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: spyir btang ba byas pa de'i dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir / gal te de chu gzhan dang 'dres par gyur na de yan chad du'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to teach the exceptions to that general permission,🔽if it mixes with another water, then beyond that.

original: gal te chu'i rgyun mgyogs pa de rgyang grags gcig gi mthar thug pa'i nang yan chad du chu gzhan dang 'dres par gyur na gang du 'dres par gyur pa /
analyzed: gal te chu'i rgyun mgyogs pa de rgyang grags gcig gi mthar thug pa'i nang yan chad du chu gzhan dang 'dres par gyur na gang du 'dres par gyur pa /
translated: If that fast-flowing stream mixes with another water within the distance of one league, then where it mixes with another water,

original: de yan chad du dge slong des sngar rgyang grags kyi mgor chu brtag pa byas pa de nyid kyis 'dod dgur spyad cing 'jug tu rung gi /
analyzed: de yan chad du dge slong des sngar rgyang grags kyi mgor chu brtag pa byas pa de nyid kyis 'dod dgur spyad cing 'jug tu rung gi /
translated: Up to this point, the monk may use the water that he has examined at the beginning of the league.

original: 'dres pa man chad la ni des yang brtag cing 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽brtags pa nas 'dom gang khor yug ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dres pa man chad la ni des yang brtag cing 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // brtags pa nas 'dom gang khor yug ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But below the confluence, he must examine the water again before using it.🔽The area one fathom around the place where the water is examined is the same.

original: chu brtag pa'i gnas nas 'dom gang kho ra khor yug tshun chad ni brtag pa nyid yin no //🔽'dir gzhung ni btsun pa chab kyi @333b nyan kor gang lags /
analyzed: chu brtag pa'i gnas nas 'dom gang kho ra khor yug tshun chad ni brtag pa nyid yin no // 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa chab kyi @333b nyan kor gang lags /
translated: The area one fathom around the place where the water is examined is the place where the water is examined.

original: nye ba 'khor 'dom gang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor 'dom gang ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text says, “Venerable, what is a fathom of water?”🔽Upāli, it is one fathom.

original: mig gis dag pa nyid kyi chu ni dag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mig gis dag pa nyid kyi chu ni dag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Water that is clear to the eye is pure.

original: chu gang gis dag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: chu gang gis dag pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is pure water?

original: mig gis dag pa nyid kyi chu ni dag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mig gis dag pa nyid kyi chu ni dag pa nyid yin no //
translated: Water that is clear to the eye is pure.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: chu ni mig gis brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: chu ni mig gis brtag par bya ste /
translated: Water should be examined with the eyes.

original: gal te de na srog chags mi snang na de'i tshe chu dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de na srog chags mi snang na de'i tshe chu dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If no living beings appear in it, then the water is pure.

original: mig gang gis she na de'i phyir /🔽tha mal pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mig gang gis she na de'i phyir / tha mal pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: By what eye? Therefore he says:🔽by the ordinary eye.

original: sha'i mig gis tha snyad gdags su rung bas so //
analyzed: sha'i mig gis tha snyad gdags su rung bas so //
translated: Because the fleshly eye is suitable for conventional usage.

original: 'dir gzhung ni tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas lha'i mig gis chu brtags pa na de'i tshe srid pa bar ma'i srog chags dag gis thams cad khyab par mthong nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas lha'i mig gis chu brtags pa na de'i tshe srid pa bar ma'i srog chags dag gis thams cad khyab par mthong nas /
translated: Here, the text is as follows: The Venerable Aniruddha examined the water with the divine eye and saw that at that time all of it was filled with intermediate existence beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: lha'i mig ni tha snyad gdags su mi rung ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig ni tha snyad gdags su mi rung ste /
translated: The divine eye is not suitable for conventional usage.

original: de bas na lha'i mig gis chu brtag par mi bya bar 'di ltar chu rung ba lnga sngar spyad par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na lha'i mig gis chu brtag par mi bya bar 'di ltar chu rung ba lnga sngar spyad par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, do not examine the water with the divine eye. Rather, examine the five suitable waters as before.

original: mi g-yo ba nyid dang rnyog pa med pa la brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba nyid dang rnyog pa med pa la brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It should be examined for immobility and lack of turbidity.

original: brtag par bya ba'i chu mi g-yo mi 'gul ba nyid dang / rdul dang dal dul gyi rnyog pa med cing shin tu dangs pa la brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: brtag par bya ba'i chu mi g-yo mi 'gul ba nyid dang / rdul dang dal dul gyi rnyog pa med cing shin tu dangs pa la brtag par bya'o //
translated: The water to be examined is neither moving nor shaking, and is free of the turbidity of particles, agitation, and disturbance, and is extremely clear.

original: bum pa gang ba nyid la'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bum pa gang ba nyid la'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the case of a filled vase,

original: chu bum pa gang ba nyid la brtag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: chu bum pa gang ba nyid la brtag par bya ba'o //
translated: the water to be examined is in a filled vase.

original: de la bya ba las 'das par bgrang ba'i yun ring po nyid du mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la bya ba las 'das par bgrang ba'i yun ring po nyid du mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not count for a long time beyond the action,

original: chu brtag pa de la de bya ba las 'das pa yin no zhes bya bar yun ring ba nyid kyi grangs su grags pa'i tha snyad kyi tshig gang yin par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i yun ring po nyid du brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chu brtag pa de la de bya ba las 'das pa yin no zhes bya bar yun ring ba nyid kyi grangs su grags pa'i tha snyad kyi tshig gang yin par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i yun ring po nyid du brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: in that examination of water, one should not count for such a long time as would be the number of the term “beyond the action.”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: yun ring yang rung thung yang rung ste /
analyzed: yun ring yang rung thung yang rung ste /
translated: Whether it is a long or a short time,

original: ji tsam gyis sems dag par gyur pa de tsam du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis sems dag par gyur pa de tsam du brtag par bya'o //
translated: one should examine for just as long as the mind is purified.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni ha cang yun ring du brtag par mi bya bar 'di ltar ji srid kyis ba lang drug dang ldan pa'i shing rta smyig ma'i shar bas bkang ba la yangs kyis 'khor bar 'gyur ba de srid du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni ha cang yun ring du brtag par mi bya bar 'di ltar ji srid kyis ba lang drug dang ldan pa'i shing rta smyig ma'i shar bas bkang ba la yangs kyis 'khor bar 'gyur ba de srid du brtag par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the text says, “One should not investigate in this way for too long a time. One should investigate for as long as it takes a cart drawn by six oxen to go around the perimeter of the field, filled with bamboo poles.

original: yang na ji srid kyis sems dag par gyur pa de srid du brtag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na ji srid kyis sems dag par gyur pa de srid du brtag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Or, one should investigate for as long as it takes the mind to become clear.

original: de la sems dag par gyur pa zhes bya ba de la sems dag par gyur ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la sems dag par gyur pa zhes bya ba de la sems dag par gyur ces bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the phrase “the mind becomes clear” means

original: mig gis dag pa nyid ces bya ba de yin @334a * //
analyzed: mig gis dag pa nyid ces bya ba de yin @334a * //
translated: that the eyes become clear.

original: pas de'i phyir de las ring du mi bya ste /
analyzed: pas de'i phyir de las ring du mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should not investigate beyond that.

original: des na 'dir sems dag pa zhes bya ba de logs shig tu ma bsdus so //🔽rtse mo 'jam pos srog chags dag bstan sla'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des na 'dir sems dag pa zhes bya ba de logs shig tu ma bsdus so // rtse mo 'jam pos srog chags dag bstan sla'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, the phrase “the mind becomes clear” is not included separately here.🔽“One should point out the creatures with a soft tip” means

original: thur ma 'am rtsva la sogs pa'i rtse mo 'jam pos srog chags dag bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: thur ma 'am rtsva la sogs pa'i rtse mo 'jam pos srog chags dag bstan par bya'o //
translated: that one should point out the creatures with a soft tip of a blade of grass or something similar.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gal te la la chu'i srog chags la the tshom za 'am mi mthong na de'i tshe thur ma'am rtsva 'am shing bu 'jam po'i rtse mos bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te la la chu'i srog chags la the tshom za 'am mi mthong na de'i tshe thur ma'am rtsva 'am shing bu 'jam po'i rtse mos bstan par bya'o //
translated: If one is in doubt about whether there are water creatures in the water or not, then one should examine the water with a strainer or with a smooth stick or blade of grass.

original: de dag 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i lam du mi dor ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i lam du mi dor ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not discard them on a path where they will die.

original: chu'i srog chags de dag dor ba'i lam gyi thag ji srid kyis 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i lam gyi thag de srid du dor bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: chu'i srog chags de dag dor ba'i lam gyi thag ji srid kyis 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i lam gyi thag de srid du dor bar mi bya ste /
translated: One should not discard those water creatures on a path for as far as the path for as far as the creatures will die.

original: mi 'phang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi 'phang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: “one should not throw them.”

original: gzhan yang mi dor ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi dor ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not discard them elsewhere.

original: chu'i srog chags dag las gzhan pa shig dang rtsva shig la sogs pa dag kyang 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i lam gyi thag de srid du mi dor ro //
analyzed: chu'i srog chags dag las gzhan pa shig dang rtsva shig la sogs pa dag kyang 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i lam gyi thag de srid du mi dor ro //
translated: One should not discard lice, grass, or other such things on a path for as far as they will die.

original: gal te mar me'i nang du srog chags ltung na de byed pas de g-yogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te mar me'i nang du srog chags ltung na de byed pas de g-yogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If a creature falls into a lamp, the attendant should cover it.

original: gal te mar me'i nang du srog chags dag ltung bar 'gyur na de'i tshe de byed pas zhes bya ba mar me snang bar byed pas mar me la mi sgrib pa'i 'od khang gis mar me de g-yogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te mar me'i nang du srog chags dag ltung bar 'gyur na de'i tshe de byed pas zhes bya ba mar me snang bar byed pas mar me la mi sgrib pa'i 'od khang gis mar me de g-yogs par bya'o //
translated: If living beings fall into the lamp, then the lamp should be covered with a lampshade that does not obstruct the light, so that they are not harmed by the light.

original: mar me snang bar byed pa'i 'od khang de'i ngo bo nyid ji lta bu zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: mar me snang bar byed pa'i 'od khang de'i ngo bo nyid ji lta bu zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What is the nature of the lampshade that does not obstruct the light?

original: smyig tshal gyi gzeb dar dkar ram lhang tsher srab mos g-yogs pa ni de zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: smyig tshal gyi gzeb dar dkar ram lhang tsher srab mos g-yogs pa ni de zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is said: “It is a bamboo screen covered with white cloth or thin silk.

original: smyig ma'i tshal pa'i gzeb dar dkar la sogs pas g-yogs pa'am /🔽lhang tsher rim phar phye ba srab mos g-yogs pa ni de zhes bya ste /
analyzed: smyig ma'i tshal pa'i gzeb dar dkar la sogs pas g-yogs pa'am / lhang tsher rim phar phye ba srab mos g-yogs pa ni de zhes bya ste /
translated: A bamboo screen covered with white cloth, etc.,🔽or a thin silk screen with openings, is called that.

original: 'od khang zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'od khang zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called a lampshade.

original: mig brgya pa yang rung ngo //
analyzed: mig brgya pa yang rung ngo //
translated: It may also have a hundred eyes.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'od khang gi gzeb dar dkar gyis g-yogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'od khang gi gzeb dar dkar gyis g-yogs par bya'o //
translated: Here the text says: The lampshade should be covered with white cloth.

original: de mi rnyed na lhang tsher srab mos g-yogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de mi rnyed na lhang tsher srab mos g-yogs par bya'o //
translated: If that is not available, it should be covered with a thin layer of plaster.

original: de yang ma rnyed nas /
analyzed: de yang ma rnyed nas /
translated: If that is not available,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said:

original: mig brgya pa bya'o zhes gsung pa yin no //
analyzed: mig brgya pa bya'o zhes gsung pa yin no //
translated: “Make a hundred-eyed one.”

original: mig brgya pa ji lta bu zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: mig brgya pa ji lta bu zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What is a hundred-eyed one?

original: dang po nas byas pa'am bum pa la sogs pa'i snod bu gu can no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dang po nas byas pa'am bum pa la sogs pa'i snod bu gu can no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is said to be a pot made from the beginning or a pot with many holes.

original: dang po nas byas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dang po nas byas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Made from the beginning” means

original: de dang po 'byung ba nyid kyi tshe na rdza @334b mkhan gyis byas pa ste /
analyzed: de dang po 'byung ba nyid kyi tshe na rdza @334b mkhan gyis byas pa ste /
translated: made by a potter when it first comes into existence.

original: sa las byas pa'i snod bum pa'i dbyibs 'dra ba /🔽tshags 'dra ba bu gu mang po btod nas so btang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sa las byas pa'i snod bum pa'i dbyibs 'dra ba / tshags 'dra ba bu gu mang po btod nas so btang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: A pot-shaped vessel made from clay🔽with many holes like a sieve, and then fired. This is the meaning of “made from the beginning.”

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i snod bu gu can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i snod bu gu can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “A pot with many holes” means

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i snod la phyis rang bzor snga ma dang 'dra bar bu gu mang po btod pa'o//
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i snod la phyis rang bzor snga ma dang 'dra bar bu gu mang po btod pa'o//
translated: a pot with many holes made later by one’s own hand, like the previous one.

original: de gnyis ka yang 'od khang mig brgya pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyis ka yang 'od khang mig brgya pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Both of these are called a hundred-eyed house.

original: brgya zhes smos pa ni bu gu mang ba nyid du bstan pa'i dpe tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: brgya zhes smos pa ni bu gu mang ba nyid du bstan pa'i dpe tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The mention of a hundred is merely an example to indicate many openings.

original: grangs brgya kho nar nges pa ni ma yin no //🔽skra'i rnyis sbrul gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: grangs brgya kho nar nges pa ni ma yin no // skra'i rnyis sbrul gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not definite that there are exactly a hundred.🔽One should not seize a snake with a hair net.

original: skra las byas pa'i rnyis sbrul bcing bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: skra las byas pa'i rnyis sbrul bcing bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not catch a snake with a net made of hair.

original: 'dir skra zhes smos pa'i sgra ni skra dang rnga ma dang rngog ma la sogs spyi la snyegs te de dag gi rnyi gang gis kyang sbrul gzung bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir skra zhes smos pa'i sgra ni skra dang rnga ma dang rngog ma la sogs spyi la snyegs te de dag gi rnyi gang gis kyang sbrul gzung bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the word hair is extended to include hair, tail hair, body hair, and so on. One should not catch a snake with any of these nets.

original: cho ga 'di ni sbrul snad par 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cho ga 'di ni sbrul snad par 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This procedure is to avoid injuring the snake.

original: sbrul bsal ba ci ltar bya zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: sbrul bsal ba ci ltar bya zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How should one remove the snake?

original: se gol gyi sgra phyung ste /
analyzed: se gol gyi sgra phyung ste /
translated: One should snap one’s fingers

original: bzhin bzangs mig lam na ma 'dug shig ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bzhin bzangs mig lam na ma 'dug shig ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: and say, “Good person, do not stay in the path of my sight.”

original: sngar se gol gyi sgra phyung ste /
analyzed: sngar se gol gyi sgra phyung ste /
translated: One should snap one’s fingers first.

original: de'i 'og tu kye bzhin bzangs mig lam na ma 'dug par gang du mi rnams kyi spyod yul du mi 'gyur ba der 'dug shig ces de skad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu kye bzhin bzangs mig lam na ma 'dug par gang du mi rnams kyi spyod yul du mi 'gyur ba der 'dug shig ces de skad brjod par bya'o //
translated: Then, say to him, “Hey, good man, don’t stay where you can be seen. Stay somewhere that people won’t see you.”

original: de skad brjod kyang gal te mig lam na 'dug na de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de skad brjod kyang gal te mig lam na 'dug na de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If, despite your saying this, he stays where he can be seen, what should you do then?

original: de'i phyir / mi 'dug na dbyug gu sgam khas dal bus rdza ma'am bum par bcug te kha bcad nas bu gu dag btod de bsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / mi 'dug na dbyug gu sgam khas dal bus rdza ma'am bum par bcug te kha bcad nas bu gu dag btod de bsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If he doesn’t leave, slowly put him into a clay pot or a jar with a bamboo pole, cover the opening, make holes in it, and remove him.”

original: mig lam na mi snang ba'i phyogs na 'dug na dbyug gu skam kha ra rkang 'dra ba kha brag gis dal bus rdza ma 'am bum par bcug ste kha bcad nas rdza ma 'am bum pa de la rlung 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir ngos dag tu bu gu
analyzed: mig lam na mi snang ba'i phyogs na 'dug na dbyug gu skam kha ra rkang 'dra ba kha brag gis dal bus rdza ma 'am bum par bcug ste kha bcad nas rdza ma 'am bum pa de la rlung 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir ngos dag tu bu gu
translated: If he stays somewhere that is not visible, slowly put him into a clay pot or a jar with a bamboo pole, cover the opening, and make small holes in the clay pot or the jar

original: phra mo dag btod de gtsug lag khang nas thabs des sbrul de bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: phra mo dag btod de gtsug lag khang nas thabs des sbrul de bsal bar bya'o //
translated: on the sides to let the air out. Then, by this method, remove the snake from the monastery.

original: ma grub na lcag pod dam shur bu 'am shur bu phre'us sam tha gu ras mas dgris pa'i zhags mig gis mgul pa bcings te dor bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma grub na lcag pod dam shur bu 'am shur bu phre'us sam tha gu ras mas dgris pa'i zhags mig gis mgul pa bcings te dor bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he does not leave, he should be expelled by means of a whip, a rope, a rope with a noose, or a rope with a noose and a noose.

original: gal te thabs snga ma des gtsug lag khang nas dbyung bar ma grub na de'i tshe lcag pod dam shur bu'am shur bu phre'us mgul bar bcings te dor ba'am /
analyzed: gal te thabs snga ma des gtsug lag khang nas dbyung bar ma grub na de'i tshe lcag pod dam shur bu'am shur bu phre'us mgul bar bcings te dor ba'am /
translated: If he does not leave the monastery by the previous method, then he should be expelled by means of a whip, a rope, a rope with a noose, or a rope with a noose and a noose.

original: yang na tha gu ras mas dkris pa'i zhags mig gis mgul pa bcings te dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na tha gu ras mas dkris pa'i zhags mig gis mgul pa bcings te dor bar bya'o //
translated: Or he should be expelled by means of a rope with a noose around his neck.

original: de dag ni gzhug pa la yang @335a * //🔽ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag ni gzhug pa la yang @335a * // ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: These methods are also used for bringing in.

original: lcag pod la sogs pas bcing pa'i thabs de dag ni dor ba 'ba' zhig la bya bar ma zad kyi /
analyzed: lcag pod la sogs pas bcing pa'i thabs de dag ni dor ba 'ba' zhig la bya bar ma zad kyi /
translated: These methods of binding with a whip, etc. are not only used for expelling,

original: rdza ma'am bum par gzhug pa'i thabs sngar bstan pa de la yang 'di ltar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rdza ma'am bum par gzhug pa'i thabs sngar bstan pa de la yang 'di ltar bya ba yin no //
translated: but also for bringing in, as previously explained.

original: tshang tshing gi nang du dor bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshang tshing gi nang du dor bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should not be expelled into a thicket.

original: sbrul de nags dang rtsva la sogs pa tshang tshing gi nang du dor bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: sbrul de nags dang rtsva la sogs pa tshang tshing gi nang du dor bar mi bya ste /
translated: The snake should not be thrown into the forest, grass, etc., or into thickets.

original: de ni me gtong ba'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni me gtong ba'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is to avoid the fault of setting fire to them.

original: de lta bas na sa sgre bo la khung la sogs pa yod par dor bar bya'i nags la sogs pa'i thibs po'i nang du dor bar mi bya'o //🔽khung du zhugs kyi bar du bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na sa sgre bo la khung la sogs pa yod par dor bar bya'i nags la sogs pa'i thibs po'i nang du dor bar mi bya'o // khung du zhugs kyi bar du bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, it should be thrown into a hole in the ground, etc., which are not overgrown with grass, etc.🔽One should stay until the snake has entered its hole.

original: khyer ba'i mi des sbrul de tshang du zhugs zhugs kyi bar du bsdad par bya'o //
analyzed: khyer ba'i mi des sbrul de tshang du zhugs zhugs kyi bar du bsdad par bya'o //
translated: The person who is carrying the snake should stay until the snake has entered its hole.

original: de ni 'ol ba la sogs pas khyer ba'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir ro //🔽shig rnams ni ras mar gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni 'ol ba la sogs pas khyer ba'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir ro // shig rnams ni ras mar gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is to avoid the fault of the snake being carried off by mongooses, etc.🔽The lice should be put into a cloth.

original: shig rnams ni ras ma dag gi nang du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: shig rnams ni ras ma dag gi nang du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The lice should be put into a piece of cloth.

original: de ni gseb dag tu'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni gseb dag tu'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then, into the interstices.

original: ras ma de ni ka ba la sogs pa'i gseb dag tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: ras ma de ni ka ba la sogs pa'i gseb dag tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: That piece of cloth should be put into the interstices of a pillar, etc.

original: 'dir gzhung ni ras ma'i nang du dkris te ka ba'i gseb bam rtsig pa'i gseb dag tu gzhug par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ras ma'i nang du dkris te ka ba'i gseb bam rtsig pa'i gseb dag tu gzhug par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text says that you should wrap it in cloth and put it in a pillar or in a wall.

original: rtsva shig rnams ni gsing mar ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtsva shig rnams ni gsing mar ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The lice should be put in a green place.

original: rtsva shig rnams ni rtsva sngon po'i phyogs su gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsva shig rnams ni rtsva sngon po'i phyogs su gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The lice should be put in a place with green grass.

original: yang na phyogs bsil bar ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na phyogs bsil bar ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or in a cool place.

original: de dag gi gnas gang du 'os pa der bzhag go //
analyzed: de dag gi gnas gang du 'os pa der bzhag go //
translated: You should put them in a place that is suitable for them.

original: snga ma gzhug pa'i phyir bsal snod bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snga ma gzhug pa'i phyir bsal snod bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: You should keep a container for them so that you can put them back in.

original: snga ma zhes bya ba ni /🔽ltung byed 'di la chu'i srog chags rnams kyi skabs sngar mdzad pas snga ma ni chu'i srog chags rnams te /
analyzed: snga ma zhes bya ba ni / ltung byed 'di la chu'i srog chags rnams kyi skabs sngar mdzad pas snga ma ni chu'i srog chags rnams te /
translated: The previous ones.🔽In this downfall, the previous ones are the water creatures, because the topic of this downfall is water creatures.

original: de dag khron pa la sogs pa thag ring por phyir gzhug pa'i phyir gang zag gis kyang bsal snod bcad bar bya'o zhes 'dir bsal snod ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag khron pa la sogs pa thag ring por phyir gzhug pa'i phyir gang zag gis kyang bsal snod bcad bar bya'o zhes 'dir bsal snod ces bya ba ni /
translated: You should keep a container for them so that you can put them back in.

original: bum pa gang bzhin du gzhug cing stong par dbyung du rung ba gang yin pa de yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: bum pa gang bzhin du gzhug cing stong par dbyung du rung ba gang yin pa de yin par dgongs so //
translated: It is understood that it is the one that can be filled with water and emptied by turning it upside down.

original: de ltar na mgrin pa dang zhabs gnyi gar dpyad thag gnyis kyis btags shing gzhug par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na mgrin pa dang zhabs gnyi gar dpyad thag gnyis kyis btags shing gzhug par bya ba yin te /
translated: In this way, the two ropes are tied to both the neck and the base.

original: chu'i nang du phyin pa na mgrin par btags pa'i dpyang thag glod par bya zhing zhabs nas btags pa'i dpyang thag drang bar bya ste /
analyzed: chu'i nang du phyin pa na mgrin par btags pa'i dpyang thag glod par bya zhing zhabs nas btags pa'i dpyang thag drang bar bya ste /
translated: When the water is reached, the rope tied to the neck is loosened and the rope tied to the base is pulled.

original: des na de khas bub tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de khas bub tu 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, it will turn upside down.

original: thabs de dag thams cad ni @335b bsal snod ces bya ba'i tshig nyid las 'thob bo //🔽yang na chu tshags de nyid kyis gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thabs de dag thams cad ni @335b bsal snod ces bya ba'i tshig nyid las 'thob bo // yang na chu tshags de nyid kyis gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All these methods are obtained from the words called “the vessel.”🔽Or, it is said that it should be inserted with that very water strainer.

original: yang na chu chags gang gis srog chags de dag btsags par gyur pa'i chu tshags de nyid kyis srog chags de dag khron pa la sogs pa'i nang du phyir gzhug par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na chu chags gang gis srog chags de dag btsags par gyur pa'i chu tshags de nyid kyis srog chags de dag khron pa la sogs pa'i nang du phyir gzhug par bya ste /
translated: Or, with the very water strainer through which those living beings were strained, those living beings should be returned to the well, etc.

original: de la yang kha dang zhabs gnyi gar dpyang thag gnyis kyis gdags pa'i tshul ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de la yang kha dang zhabs gnyi gar dpyang thag gnyis kyis gdags pa'i tshul ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, the method of suspending it by two ropes from both the mouth and the foot is the same as before.

original: chu tshags la srog chags chags pa bsal ba'i thabs ni bshal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chu tshags la srog chags chags pa bsal ba'i thabs ni bshal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The method of removing the living beings that adhere to the water strainer is washing.

original: chu tshags la srog chags dag chags pa bsal zhing med par bya ba'i thabs ni chus bshal ba yin no //
analyzed: chu tshags la srog chags dag chags pa bsal zhing med par bya ba'i thabs ni chus bshal ba yin no //
translated: The method of removing and eliminating the living beings that adhere to the water strainer is washing with water.

original: dri ma ni bkru ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dri ma ni bkru ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The method of removing the stains is washing.

original: chu tshags la chags pa'i dri ma bsal ba'i thabs ni chus bkru ba'o //
analyzed: chu tshags la chags pa'i dri ma bsal ba'i thabs ni chus bkru ba'o //
translated: The method of removing the stains that adhere to the water strainer is washing with water.

original: rul pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i ni skam pa'o zhes bya ba yang thabs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rul pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i ni skam pa'o zhes bya ba yang thabs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The method of drying is for the purpose of not becoming rotten.

original: rul pa'i dngos po ni rul pa nyid de chu tshags rul ba nyid du mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i thabs ni nyi ma la sogs pas skam pa'o //
analyzed: rul pa'i dngos po ni rul pa nyid de chu tshags rul ba nyid du mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i thabs ni nyi ma la sogs pas skam pa'o //
translated: The method of drying is for the purpose of not becoming rotten, that is, for the purpose of not becoming rotten water strainers.

original: de gnyi ga la yang dam du btsir na phan pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de gnyi ga la yang dam du btsir na phan pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In both cases, it is beneficial to press down firmly.

original: chu tshags kyi cho ga dri ma bsal ba dang rul pa nyid du mi 'gyur bar bya ba sngar bstan pa de gnyi ga la yang dam du btsir te chu gzags na phan pa nyid do //
analyzed: chu tshags kyi cho ga dri ma bsal ba dang rul pa nyid du mi 'gyur bar bya ba sngar bstan pa de gnyi ga la yang dam du btsir te chu gzags na phan pa nyid do //
translated: The rite of the water strainer is taught to remove stains and to prevent it from becoming rotten. It is beneficial to squeeze the water strainer tightly in both of these cases.

original: dge 'dun dang gang zag dang chu tshags dang chu tshad ma rnyed pa'i shes pas 'jug pa la kha na ma tho ba med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge 'dun dang gang zag dang chu tshags dang chu tshad ma rnyed pa'i shes pas 'jug pa la kha na ma tho ba med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is no offense if one engages with knowledge that the Saṅgha, the individual, the water strainer, or the water measure is not available.

original: tshad ma rnyed pa'i shes pas 'jug pa la kha na ma tho ba med do zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
analyzed: tshad ma rnyed pa'i shes pas 'jug pa la kha na ma tho ba med do zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
translated: The term “if one engages with knowledge that the measure is not available”

original: dge 'dun la sogs pa bzhi dang so sor sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun la sogs pa bzhi dang so sor sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: is applied to each of the four, the Saṅgha and so on.

original: dge 'dun tshad ma rnyed pa'i shes pas 'jug pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / gang zag tshad ma rnyed pa'i shes pas 'jug pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / chu tshags tshad ma rnyed pa'i shes pas 'jug pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa dang /
analyzed: dge 'dun tshad ma rnyed pa'i shes pas 'jug pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / gang zag tshad ma rnyed pa'i shes pas 'jug pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / chu tshags tshad ma rnyed pa'i shes pas 'jug pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa dang /
translated: There is no offense if one engages with knowledge that the Saṅgha is not available, there is no offense if one engages with knowledge that the individual is not available, there is no offense if one engages with knowledge that the water strainer is not available, and there is no offense if one engages with knowledge that the water measure is not available.

original: chu tshad ma rnyed pa'i shes pas 'jug pa la kha na ma tho ba med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chu tshad ma rnyed pa'i shes pas 'jug pa la kha na ma tho ba med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: There is no offense if the person is one who does not know the measure of water.

original: de la dge 'dun tshad ma zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun 'di la srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus tha snyad byed pa med do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dge 'dun tshad ma zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun 'di la srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus tha snyad byed pa med do zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the Saṅgha is the authority if the Saṅgha has made a proclamation that in this Saṅgha there is no use of water that contains living beings.

original: gang zag tshad ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang zag tshad ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The individual is the authority if

original: gang zag 'di srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu mi spyod do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zag 'di srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu mi spyod do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the individual has made a proclamation that he or she does not use water that contains living beings.

original: chu tshags tshad ma zhes bya ba ni /🔽chu tshags 'dis btsags pa'i chu dus thams @336a * //
analyzed: chu tshags tshad ma zhes bya ba ni / chu tshags 'dis btsags pa'i chu dus thams @336a * //
translated: The strainer is the authority if

original: cad du dag pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: cad du dag pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: the water that has been strained with that strainer is pure at all times.

original: chu tshad ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chu tshad ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The water is the authority if

original: khron pa'i chu 'di la nam yang chu srog chags dang bcas par ma gyur to zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khron pa'i chu 'di la nam yang chu srog chags dang bcas par ma gyur to zhes bya ba'o //
translated: one has never seen living beings in the water of that well.

original: khyim pa yang gal te lan 'ga' yang srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus tha snyad mi byed pa yin na de yang 'dir gang zag tshad ma zhes bya ba nyid kyis sdus pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: khyim pa yang gal te lan 'ga' yang srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus tha snyad mi byed pa yin na de yang 'dir gang zag tshad ma zhes bya ba nyid kyis sdus pa nyid yin no //
translated: If a layperson never uses water containing living beings, he too is included here as a valid person.🔽Here the text says:

original: 'dir gzhung ni chu rung ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni chu rung ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: “Pure water is of five kinds:

original: dge 'dun gyis rung ba dang / gang zag gis rung ba dang / chu tshags kyis rung ba dang / khron pas rung ba dang / gang nyin zhag cig tu rung ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis rung ba dang / gang zag gis rung ba dang / chu tshags kyis rung ba dang / khron pas rung ba dang / gang nyin zhag cig tu rung ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: pure for the saṅgha, pure for the individual, pure for a water strainer, pure for a well, and pure for a day and night.”

original: de la rung ba dang po bzhi ni mdo 'dis bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: de la rung ba dang po bzhi ni mdo 'dis bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The first four kinds of pure water are included in this sūtra.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are in the same order.

original: lnga pa nyin zhag gcig rung ba'i bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lnga pa nyin zhag gcig rung ba'i bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show the inclusion of the fifth kind of pure water, pure for a day and night,

original: bcus pa dang khron pa dag ni nyi ma 'char ka tshun chad brtags pa nyid kyi rjes su 'jug go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bcus pa dang khron pa dag ni nyi ma 'char ka tshun chad brtags pa nyid kyi rjes su 'jug go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it says: “Wells and springs are considered pure as long as the sun shines.”

original: chu bcus pa dang khron pa ni nyi ma 'char ka tshun chad brtags pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: chu bcus pa dang khron pa ni nyi ma 'char ka tshun chad brtags pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The water-pot and the well are to be used after examining them until sunrise.

original: 'dir khron pa zhes bya ba ni chu dong yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir khron pa zhes bya ba ni chu dong yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the well should be understood as a water-pit.

original: rkang khrus snod stong par mthong na dgang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rkang khrus snod stong par mthong na dgang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one sees the foot-washing water-pot empty, one should fill it.

original: rkang khrus snod ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rkang khrus snod ces bya ba ni /
translated: The foot-washing water-pot is

original: dge 'dun la dgos pa rkang pa la sogs pa bkru ba'i ril ba la bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun la dgos pa rkang pa la sogs pa bkru ba'i ril ba la bya ste /
translated: a vessel for the Saṅgha’s needs, for washing the feet and so on.

original: rkang khrus snod de chus stong pa nyid du mthong na dgang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rkang khrus snod de chus stong pa nyid du mthong na dgang bar bya'o //
translated: If one sees that foot-washing water-pot empty of water, one should fill it.

original: chu dang gzhan gyi snod kyang nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chu dang gzhan gyi snod kyang nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should also set out water and other vessels.

original: chu'i snod dang mar dang 'bru mar la sogs pa gzhan gyi snod kyang dge 'dun gyis bcang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: chu'i snod dang mar dang 'bru mar la sogs pa gzhan gyi snod kyang dge 'dun gyis bcang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Water vessels and other vessels for ghee, oil, and so on should be kept by the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun gyi der gtogs pa ni snod spyad 'drub pa'i las yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi der gtogs pa ni snod spyad 'drub pa'i las yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Saṅgha’s work is to make vessels for its members.

original: dge 'dun gyi chu'i snod dang gzhan gyi snod de'i khongs su gtogs pa de dang 'brel ba'i snod spyad brub pa ni gang zag snod spyad 'drub par bskos pa'i las yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi chu'i snod dang gzhan gyi snod de'i khongs su gtogs pa de dang 'brel ba'i snod spyad brub pa ni gang zag snod spyad 'drub par bskos pa'i las yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The monk who is the keeper of the water vessel and the monk who is the keeper of the other vessels, and the monk who is the keeper of the vessels that are related to those two, and the monk who is the keeper of the vessels that are related to those three, should be understood as the monk who is appointed to make the vessels.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gnas mal gyi gzhi las yon bdag dag gtsug lag khang du lhags te de dag rdza mkhan gyis byas pa'i snod dag rnyed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis skur cig ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gnas mal gyi gzhi las yon bdag dag gtsug lag khang du lhags te de dag rdza mkhan gyis byas pa'i snod dag rnyed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis skur cig ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Here, the text of the Vinaya states: “The benefactors came to the monastery and found the vessels made by the potter. The Blessed One said, ‘Take them.’

original: de dag sus kyang ma bsdus pas de dag chud zos dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de dag sus kyang ma bsdus pas de dag chud zos dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Since no one collected them, they were wasted. The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong snod spyad 'drub par bsko bar bya zhing des kyang 'ongs @336b pa dag la sbyin par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong snod spyad 'drub par bsko bar bya zhing des kyang 'ongs @336b pa dag la sbyin par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‘Appoint a monk to make the vessels. He should also give them to those who come.’

original: 'dir sbyin pa dang blang ba dag kyang ma 'dus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir sbyin pa dang blang ba dag kyang ma 'dus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the giving and receiving are not included.

original: snod spyad 'drub pa'i las bstan pa 'dir snod spyad sbyin ba dang blang ba dag kyang ma 'dus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snod spyad 'drub pa'i las bstan pa 'dir snod spyad sbyin ba dang blang ba dag kyang ma 'dus pa ma yin te /
translated: The activity of making vessels is taught here. Giving and receiving vessels is not excluded from that.

original: 'dus pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa kho na yin no //
translated: It is included.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: sbyin ba dang blang ba yang snod spyad 'drub pas bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyin ba dang blang ba yang snod spyad 'drub pas bya ba yin no //
translated: Giving and receiving are also done by making vessels.

original: khyim pa rnying pa brnyan ba nyid la de yod pa nyid na sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyim pa rnying pa brnyan ba nyid la de yod pa nyid na sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If an old vessel of a householder is available, it should be given.

original: khyim pa dag dge 'dun la snod spyad rnying pa brnyan na dge slong snod spyad 'drub pas snod spyad rnying pa de yod pa nyid yin na g-yar por sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa dag dge 'dun la snod spyad rnying pa brnyan na dge slong snod spyad 'drub pas snod spyad rnying pa de yod pa nyid yin na g-yar por sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If householders have an old vessel for the Saṅgha, if a monk who makes vessels has an old vessel available, he should borrow it.

original: des gtsug lag khang du yon bdag rnams la sbyin bar bya ba nyid kyang ma bstan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des gtsug lag khang du yon bdag rnams la sbyin bar bya ba nyid kyang ma bstan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not that giving to benefactors in the monastery is not taught.

original: mdo snga mar khyim pa rnying pa brnyan pa nyid la de yod pa nyid na sbyin par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i tshig des gtsug lag khang du yon bdag rnams 'ongs te /
analyzed: mdo snga mar khyim pa rnying pa brnyan pa nyid la de yod pa nyid na sbyin par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i tshig des gtsug lag khang du yon bdag rnams 'ongs te /
translated: The former sutra teaches that if the old vessels of the household are worn out, they should be given to the Sangha.

original: snod spyad rnying pa brnyan pa dag la g-yar por sbyin bar bya ba nyid kyang ma bstan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snod spyad rnying pa brnyan pa dag la g-yar por sbyin bar bya ba nyid kyang ma bstan pa ma yin te /
translated: The words of that sutra do not teach that when patrons come to the monastery, they should lend worn out vessels to the monks.🔽This is included in the passage from the scriptures above that states:

original: des ni sngar gzhung las yon bdag dag gtsug lag khang du lhags te de dag rdza mkhan gyis byas pa'i snod dag brnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis skur cig ces bka' stsal to zhes gsungs pa de nyid bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni sngar gzhung las yon bdag dag gtsug lag khang du lhags te de dag rdza mkhan gyis byas pa'i snod dag brnyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis skur cig ces bka' stsal to zhes gsungs pa de nyid bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Patrons came to the monastery and the Blessed One said: “Give them the vessels made by the potter.”

original: dge slong la ni sar pa phyir blang ba med pa nyid du'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong la ni sar pa phyir blang ba med pa nyid du'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Monks do not take back new vessels.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun la snod spyad dag brnyan tam slong na dge slong snod spyad 'drub pas snod spyad sar pa dag yod na snod spyang sar pa phyir blang ba med pa nyid du gtan sbyin bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun la snod spyad dag brnyan tam slong na dge slong snod spyad 'drub pas snod spyad sar pa dag yod na snod spyang sar pa phyir blang ba med pa nyid du gtan sbyin bar bya'o //
translated: If a monk asks for a vessel or a piece of equipment, if the monks have new vessels or equipment, they should give the new ones to the monk who is making the vessel or equipment.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong rnams la ni sar pa dag sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong rnams la ni sar pa dag sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The text says, “They should give the new ones to the monks.”

original: khyim pa rnams la ni rnying pa dag brnyan par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: khyim pa rnams la ni rnying pa dag brnyan par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “They should give the old ones to the householders.”

original: snod spyad kyi ched du mdzod khang bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snod spyad kyi ched du mdzod khang bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “They should set aside a storehouse for the sake of the vessels and equipment.”

original: snod spyad gzhag pa'i ched du mdzod khang bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: snod spyad gzhag pa'i ched du mdzod khang bsko bar bya'o //
translated: They should set aside a storehouse for the sake of the vessels and equipment.

original: sa dang zangs ma'i snod spyad dag so sor gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa dang zangs ma'i snod spyad dag so sor gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “They should set aside earthen and copper vessels separately.”

original: sa las byas pa'i snod spyad dang zangs ma las byas pa dag gal te mdzod khang gzhan med na mdzod khang gcig gi nang na yang so sor gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sa las byas pa'i snod spyad dang zangs ma las byas pa dag gal te mdzod khang gzhan med na mdzod khang gcig gi nang na yang so sor gzhag par bya'o //
translated: If they do not have another storehouse, they should set aside earthen vessels and copper vessels separately in one storehouse.

original: yang na gang du zangs ma las byas pa'i snod spyad gzhag pa'i mdzod gzhan cig sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gang du zangs ma las byas pa'i snod spyad gzhag pa'i mdzod gzhan cig sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Or else, another treasury should be given, where copper vessels are placed.

original: de ni ma nges te mdzod khang med dam @337a * //
analyzed: de ni ma nges te mdzod khang med dam @337a * //
translated: This is not definite: if there is no treasury,

original: snod spyad nyung na mi sbyin no //
analyzed: snod spyad nyung na mi sbyin no //
translated: or if there are few vessels, it is not given.

original: chu nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chu nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Water should be placed nearby.

original: dge 'dun gyi don du chu nye bar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi don du chu nye bar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Water should be placed nearby for the sake of the Saṅgha.

original: gnas gang du gzhag par bya zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas gang du gzhag par bya zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Where should it be placed? Therefore it is said:

original: gar bab bab tu mi gzhag go zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gar bab bab tu mi gzhag go zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: It should not be placed haphazardly.

original: 'o na gar gzhag ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na gar gzhag ce na de'i phyir /
translated: Where then should it be placed? Therefore it is said:

original: de'i ched du chu khang bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i ched du chu khang bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: A water house should be made for that purpose.

original: chu gzhag pa de'i ched du chu khang bya'o //
analyzed: chu gzhag pa de'i ched du chu khang bya'o //
translated: A water house should be made for the purpose of placing the water there.

original: phyogs gang du bya zhe na de'i phyir /🔽gtsug lag khang gi nang gi lho nub kyi mtshams su'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phyogs gang du bya zhe na de'i phyir / gtsug lag khang gi nang gi lho nub kyi mtshams su'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In which direction should it be made? Therefore it is said:🔽In the southwest corner of the monastery.

original: gtsug lag khang gi nang gi lho dang nub kyi mtshams su bya ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi nang gi lho dang nub kyi mtshams su bya ste /
translated: It should be made in the southwest corner of the monastery.

original: der rtag tu grib ma 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der rtag tu grib ma 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the shadow of the temple always falls on it.

original: gtsug lag khang gi sgo shar phyogs su lta ba la ltos te de skad gsungs so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi sgo shar phyogs su lta ba la ltos te de skad gsungs so //
translated: This is said with reference to the temple gate facing east.

original: gtsug lag khang gi sgo phyogs gzhan du lta ba la ni chab khung gi grva ma gtogs par gtsug lag khang la ltos te lho dang nub kyi mtshams kho nar chu khang bya'o //🔽skar khung gdod pa dang so phag gi gcal dgram pa dang chu khung gdod pa dang sgo gdod pa dang / sgo glegs dang yang mig gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi sgo phyogs gzhan du lta ba la ni chab khung gi grva ma gtogs par gtsug lag khang la ltos te lho dang nub kyi mtshams kho nar chu khang bya'o // skar khung gdod pa dang so phag gi gcal dgram pa dang chu khung gdod pa dang sgo gdod pa dang / sgo glegs dang yang mig gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But if the temple gate faces another direction, the privy should be built in the south or west of the temple, except in the corner where the water channel is located.🔽Windows, brick floors, water drains, and doors should be installed.

original: chu khang de la skar khung gdod par bya ba dang / sa gzhir so phag gi gcal dgram par bya ba dang / gang nas chu phyir 'bab par 'gyur ba logs su chu khung gdod par bya ba dang / sgo gdod par bya ba dang /
analyzed: chu khang de la skar khung gdod par bya ba dang / sa gzhir so phag gi gcal dgram par bya ba dang / gang nas chu phyir 'bab par 'gyur ba logs su chu khung gdod par bya ba dang / sgo gdod par bya ba dang /
translated: Windows should be installed in the privy, the floor should be covered with bricks, a water drain should be installed to carry away the wastewater, and a door should be installed.

original: sgo der sgo glegs gzhug par bya ba dang / sgo glegs de la lag gzungs kyi yang mig gzhug par bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgo der sgo glegs gzhug par bya ba dang / sgo glegs de la lag gzungs kyi yang mig gzhug par bya ba'o //
translated: A door should be installed in that door, and a keyhole should be installed in that door.

original: chu tshags gzhag pa'i phyir gdang bu bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: chu tshags gzhag pa'i phyir gdang bu bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: A shelf should be installed for the purpose of placing the water filter.

original: chu khang de'i nang du gdang bu gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: chu khang de'i nang du gdang bu gdags par bya'o //
translated: A shelf should be installed inside that water house.

original: 'dir gzhung ni der chu tshags rung ba dag gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni der chu tshags rung ba dag gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text here says that a suitable water filter should be placed there.

original: shing gi khri'u dag la gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shing gi khri'u dag la gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It should be placed on wooden benches.

original: chu snod shing gi khri'u dag gi steng du gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽yang na so phag gi stegs bu'i steng du'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chu snod shing gi khri'u dag gi steng du gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // yang na so phag gi stegs bu'i steng du'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning is that the water container should be placed on top of wooden benches.🔽Or on a brick platform.

original: yang na chu snod so phag gi stegs bu byas pa'i steng du gzhag go //
analyzed: yang na chu snod so phag gi stegs bu byas pa'i steng du gzhag go //
translated: The meaning is that the water container should be placed on top of a brick platform.

original: de nyi tshe'i steng du gzhag tu yang me rung ste /
analyzed: de nyi tshe'i steng du gzhag tu yang me rung ste /
translated: It is also suitable to place it on a temporary platform.

original: de'i phyir gzhi de la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhi de la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, on that base, it is said.

original: so phag gi stegs bu'i steng du shing leb bam lcug kor la sogs pa dag gi steng du chu snod gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: so phag gi stegs bu'i steng du shing leb bam lcug kor la sogs pa dag gi steng du chu snod gzhag par bya'o //
translated: On the brick platform, one should place a water vessel on a wooden board or a bundle of straw.

original: chu snod ni khrus chu'i ched kyi bar yan chad kyang gtsang sbra bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chu snod ni khrus chu'i ched kyi bar yan chad kyang gtsang sbra bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should also clean the water vessel for washing up to the edge.

original: @337b chu snod ni dri ma med par gtsang sbra bya ste /
analyzed: @337b chu snod ni dri ma med par gtsang sbra bya ste /
translated: The water vessel should be cleaned without impurities.

original: tha na phyi rol che chung du 'gro ba'i khrus chu'i ched kyi snod yan chad kyang dri ma med par gtsang spra bya'o //
analyzed: tha na phyi rol che chung du 'gro ba'i khrus chu'i ched kyi snod yan chad kyang dri ma med par gtsang spra bya'o //
translated: Even the vessel for washing up, whether large or small, should be cleaned without impurities.

original: de ni bdag nyid kyi 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de ni bdag nyid kyi 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: This is not only for oneself,

original: dge 'dun gyi dang gzhan gyi yang dri ma med par gtsang spra bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dang gzhan gyi yang dri ma med par gtsang spra bya'o //
translated: but also for the Saṅgha and others, it should be cleaned without impurities.

original: dri ma med par bya ba bstan nas da ni gtsang bar bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dri ma med par bya ba bstan nas da ni gtsang bar bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having explained the cleaning without impurities, now, in order to explain the cleaning of purity,

original: gtsang bar ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gtsang bar ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said pure.

original: chu snod du rung ba dang khrus chu'i ched kyi snod yan chad kyang gtsang bar bya'o //
analyzed: chu snod du rung ba dang khrus chu'i ched kyi snod yan chad kyang gtsang bar bya'o //
translated: The water vessel and the vessel for washing up should be cleaned with purity.

original: de ltar yang gnas thams cad du gzhag pa bkag pa'i phyir dang sas byi dor bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang gnas thams cad du gzhag pa bkag pa'i phyir dang sas byi dor bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is said that the ground should be swept, and it is prohibited to place it anywhere.

original: btung bar bya ba'i chu yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: btung bar bya ba'i chu yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, the water for drinking.

original: btung bar bya ba'i chu yang gtsang sbra dang gtsang bar bya'o //
analyzed: btung bar bya ba'i chu yang gtsang sbra dang gtsang bar bya'o //
translated: The water for drinking should be pure and clean.

original: khrus chu yang de dang 'dra bar bya'o //
analyzed: khrus chu yang de dang 'dra bar bya'o //
translated: The water for washing should be the same.

original: de lag pa dang gos rung ba ma yin pa dag gis brim par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lag pa dang gos rung ba ma yin pa dag gis brim par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not serve it with unclean hands or clothes.

original: btung bar bya ba'i chu de lag pa dang gos rung ba ma yin pa reg pa dang 'bags pa dag gis brim par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: btung bar bya ba'i chu de lag pa dang gos rung ba ma yin pa reg pa dang 'bags pa dag gis brim par mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not serve the water for drinking with unclean hands or clothes that are stained.🔽Thus, the text here says:

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni chu ra'i tshul gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni chu ra'i tshul gang zhe na /
translated: What is the method of the water-distributor?

original: chu ra ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la dge 'dun gyi dang gang zag gi chu snod dang chu'i kha gab rjes su gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: chu ra ni bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la dge 'dun gyi dang gang zag gi chu snod dang chu'i kha gab rjes su gnang ba yin te /
translated: The Blessed One permitted the monks to use a water-distributor for the Saṅgha and for individuals, as well as a water-pot and a water-cover.

original: de dag dge slong gis shin tu gtsang sbra dang gtsang bar spyad par byas shing bcang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag dge slong gis shin tu gtsang sbra dang gtsang bar spyad par byas shing bcang bar bya ste /
translated: Those should be used and held by the monk as very pure and clean.

original: lag pa rung ba dag dang gos rung ba dag gis gzung bar bya brim par bya zhing bram ze dang khyim bdag 'ongs so cog la yang sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa rung ba dag dang gos rung ba dag gis gzung bar bya brim par bya zhing bram ze dang khyim bdag 'ongs so cog la yang sbyin par bya'o //
translated: They should be held and distributed with suitable hands and suitable robes, and should be given to all brahmins and householders who come.

original: dge slong gis chu shin tu legs par brtag par byas te /
analyzed: dge slong gis chu shin tu legs par brtag par byas te /
translated: The monk should examine the water very well.

original: rnam par dangs pa rnyog pa med pa ma 'dres pa dag pa gtsang ba btung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dangs pa rnyog pa med pa ma 'dres pa dag pa gtsang ba btung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He should drink water that is very clear, free of turbidity, unmixed, pure, and clean.

original: chu snod rnams kyi nang dus dus su spyad bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chu snod rnams kyi nang dus dus su spyad bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From time to time, the inside of the water vessels should be used.

original: chu snod rnams kyi nang dus dus su bkru bshal bya zhing sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: chu snod rnams kyi nang dus dus su bkru bshal bya zhing sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: From time to time, the inside of the water vessels should be washed and cleaned.

original: phyi rol sbyang ba ni sdar gtsang sgra bya'o zhes bstan pa nyid kyis khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol sbyang ba ni sdar gtsang sgra bya'o zhes bstan pa nyid kyis khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The external cleaning should be understood by the teaching that it is the cleanliness.

original: zab mo rnams kyis ni pu shel tsi'i khru da shing ngam 'dab ma'i chang bu'am /🔽ras ma shing bu'i rtse mo la btags pas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zab mo rnams kyis ni pu shel tsi'i khru da shing ngam 'dab ma'i chang bu'am / ras ma shing bu'i rtse mo la btags pas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those with deep vessels should use a bamboo tube or a leaf tube.

original: chu snod zab mo rnams kyi nang lag pas zhabs mi sleb pa dag ni pu shel rtsi'i khru da bya zhing shing bu'i rtse mo la btags pas sam /
analyzed: chu snod zab mo rnams kyi nang lag pas zhabs mi sleb pa dag ni pu shel rtsi'i khru da bya zhing shing bu'i rtse mo la btags pas sam /
translated: Those with deep vessels are vessels in which the bottom cannot be reached with the hand.

original: 'dab ma'i chang bu zhes @338a * //
