analyzed: ngo zhes bya ba yang nyes byas kyi byed pa po nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The agent himself is the one who directs his mind to another place.

original: mngon sum du brnag pas 'dug pa dang dben bar brnag pas 'greng ba'i dge slong gi lta ba dang nyan pa sprod par byed pa gnyis kyis gnas las gzhan pa'i gnas la sems gtod pa yang nyes byas kyi byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum du brnag pas 'dug pa dang dben bar brnag pas 'greng ba'i dge slong gi lta ba dang nyan pa sprod par byed pa gnyis kyis gnas las gzhan pa'i gnas la sems gtod pa yang nyes byas kyi byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The two who are giving the view and listening of a fully ordained monk who is sitting with the intention of being present and standing with the intention of being secluded are the agents of the offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'di man chad ni ltung byed gnyi ga'i lhag par gyur pa'i gzhung brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni ltung byed gnyi ga'i lhag par gyur pa'i gzhung brjod par bya ste /
translated: From here on, the text of the two downfalls that are the remainder should be stated.

original: 'o na bslab pa'i gzhi 'di gnyis la ji tsam gyis na gnas gcig pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bslab pa'i gzhi 'di gnyis la ji tsam gyis na gnas gcig pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How much is the same place for these two bases of training?

original: de'i phyir / 'di la mthong ba'i spyod yul gyi mtha' tshun chad ni gnas kyi mtha' yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di la mthong ba'i spyod yul gyi mtha' tshun chad ni gnas kyi mtha' yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said: The limit of the visible field is the limit of the place.🔽In these two bases of training, the limit of the visible field is the limit of the place.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis po 'di la mthong ba'i spyod yul gyi mtha' tshun chad ces bya ba mig gi spyod yul gyi mtha' tshun chad ni mtha' yin te /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis po 'di la mthong ba'i spyod yul gyi mtha' tshun chad ces bya ba mig gi spyod yul gyi mtha' tshun chad ni mtha' yin te /
translated: The limit of the visible field is the limit of the eye's field of activity.

original: de tshun chad gnas gcig tu gtogs so //
analyzed: de tshun chad gnas gcig tu gtogs so //
translated: Up to that limit, it belongs to the same place.

original: mdzod ni khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdzod ni khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The treasury is included.

original: mdzod de ni khyams kyi bdag nyid kyi khang khyim dang lhan cig pa'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: mdzod de ni khyams kyi bdag nyid kyi khang khyim dang lhan cig pa'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin te /
translated: That treasury is included together with the house that is the nature of the courtyard.

original: gnas gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means it is the same place.

original: khyim gzhan ni tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyim gzhan ni tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Other houses are different.

original: nyal po byed pa'i khyim de las gzhan pa'i khyim ni khyim gzhan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyal po byed pa'i khyim de las gzhan pa'i khyim ni khyim gzhan zhes bya ste /
translated: Another house is called “another house” in contrast to the house where sexual intercourse is taking place.

original: khyim gzhan de'i sgo'i byang stod khyams la sogs pas chod pa na 'dug pa'i dge slong gis nyal po byed pa'i khyim na 'khrig par byed pa gnyis zhugs pa'am phyogs pa mthong ba ni gal te bza' tha dad pa nyid yin na ni gnas kyang tha dad pa🔽nyid yin no //
analyzed: khyim gzhan de'i sgo'i byang stod khyams la sogs pas chod pa na 'dug pa'i dge slong gis nyal po byed pa'i khyim na 'khrig par byed pa gnyis zhugs pa'am phyogs pa mthong ba ni gal te bza' tha dad pa nyid yin na ni gnas kyang tha dad pa nyid yin no //
translated: If the monk is standing in the upper courtyard of the house, etc., of that other house, which is separated from the house where sexual intercourse is taking place, and sees the two people engaged in sexual intercourse, then if they are a married couple, the house is different,🔽but if they are not a married couple, the house is the same.

original: gal te bza' gcig pa nyid yin na ni gnas kyang gcig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te bza' gcig pa nyid yin na ni gnas kyang gcig pa nyid yin no //
translated: If they are a married couple, the house is the same.

original: nyal po byed par shom pa'i khyim na 'greng ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: nyal po byed par shom pa'i khyim na 'greng ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The offense of standing in a house where sexual intercourse is about to take place has been explained.

original: // / gcer bu la sbyin pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: // / gcer bu la sbyin pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: The offense of giving to a naked ascetic is stated:

original: pho yang rung mo yang rung ba la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: pho yang rung mo yang rung ba la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “to a man or a woman.”

original: 'og nas rtags 'di dang rab tu byung ba 'di med pa'i gcer bu'o zhes 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'og nas rtags 'di dang rab tu byung ba 'di med pa'i gcer bu'o zhes 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This should be applied with the following passage: “A naked ascetic is one who lacks these signs and the status of a renunciate.”

original: spyir btang ba byas nas dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyir btang ba byas nas dmigs kyis bsal ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The exception is stated:

original: nye du dang rab tu byung ba la ltos pa dang nad pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nye du dang rab tu byung ba la ltos pa dang nad pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: except for a relative, one who is ordained, and one who is sick.

original: rtags 'di dang rab tu byung ba 'di med pa'i gcer @340b bu nye du'am rab tu 'byung ba la ltos pa'am nad pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rtags 'di dang rab tu byung ba 'di med pa'i gcer @340b bu nye du'am rab tu 'byung ba la ltos pa'am nad pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for a naked ascetic who is a relative, one who is ordained, or one who is sick, who does not have these signs and is not ordained.🔽Here, the text of the question is:

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun ba dge slong gis gcer bu la rang gi sug pa nas bza' ba dang bca' ba stsal ba la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba 'ga' mchis sam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun ba dge slong gis gcer bu la rang gi sug pa nas bza' ba dang bca' ba stsal ba la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba 'ga' mchis sam /
translated: “Venerable! Is there any occasion when a fully ordained monk does not commit an infraction by giving food and drink with his own hand to a naked ascetic?”

original: yod de nye du la sbyin pa dang rab tu 'byung ba la ltos pa dang nad pa la sbyin ba la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod de nye du la sbyin pa dang rab tu 'byung ba la ltos pa dang nad pa la sbyin ba la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Yes, there is no infraction if one gives to a relative, to one who is ordained, or to one who is sick.”🔽What is that like?

original: de ji lta bur gyur pa zhig yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ji lta bur gyur pa zhig yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: The exception is stated:

original: rtags 'di dang rab tu byung ba 'di med pa'i gcer bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rtags 'di dang rab tu byung ba 'di med pa'i gcer bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: a naked ascetic who does not have these signs and is not ordained.

original: gang la rtags 'di med pa de ni rtags 'di med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la rtags 'di med pa de ni rtags 'di med pa'o //
translated: One who does not have this sign is not a monk who has this sign.

original: de bzhin du gang la rab tu 'byung ba 'di med pa de ni rab tu byung ba 'di med pa ste mu stegs can gyi rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang la rab tu 'byung ba 'di med pa de ni rab tu byung ba 'di med pa ste mu stegs can gyi rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: Similarly, one who does not have this going forth is not a monk who has this going forth, but is a heretic monk.

original: mu stegs can gyi rab tu byung ba de la byin na'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi rab tu byung ba de la byin na'o //
translated: One should give to that heretic monk.🔽Where should one give to him?

original: de la gang du byin na zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de la gang du byin na zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: lus sam lus dang 'brel bar ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lus sam lus dang 'brel bar ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: either to the body or to what is connected with the body.

original: gcer bu de'i lus lag pa la sogs par ram lus dang 'brel par lhung bzed la sogs par ro //
analyzed: gcer bu de'i lus lag pa la sogs par ram lus dang 'brel par lhung bzed la sogs par ro //
translated: Either to the body of that naked ascetic, such as the hands, or to what is connected with the body, such as the alms bowl.

original: dngos po ji zhig byin na zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po ji zhig byin na zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What kind of thing should one give? Therefore it is said:

original: bca' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba dag go zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: bca' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba dag go zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: either what is to be chewed or what is to be swallowed.

original: ci rnam pa gang yang rung ba zhig gam zhe na /
analyzed: ci rnam pa gang yang rung ba zhig gam zhe na /
translated: Is it any kind of thing?

original: de'i phyir / rung ba dag go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rung ba dag go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽what is suitable.

original: su la rung ba zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: su la rung ba zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: To whom is it suitable? Therefore it is said:

original: rang dang de la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rang dang de la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: to oneself and to him.

original: rang zhes bya ba ni ltung ba 'byin par byed par rang la'o //
analyzed: rang zhes bya ba ni ltung ba 'byin par byed par rang la'o //
translated: “One’s own” refers to the one who commits the downfall.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “To him” refers

original: sbyin par bya ba gcer bu de la'o//
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba gcer bu de la'o//
translated: to the naked ascetic.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text says:

original: zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis gcer bu pa'am gcer bu ma la bca' bar bgyi ba dang / bza' bar bgyi ba rung ba ma lags pa stsol na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis gcer bu pa'am gcer bu ma la bca' bar bgyi ba dang / bza' bar bgyi ba rung ba ma lags pa stsol na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: “Lord, if a monk gives to a naked ascetic or a naked female ascetic food or drink that is not suitable, what is the offense?”

original: nyes byas so //
analyzed: nyes byas so //
translated: “It is a minor offense.”

original: gal te de la rung ba ma lags pa de 'dra ba'i bca' bar bgyi ba dang / bza' bar bgyi ba stsol na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de la rung ba ma lags pa de 'dra ba'i bca' bar bgyi ba dang / bza' bar bgyi ba stsol na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: “If he gives to him food or drink that is not suitable, what is the offense?”

original: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “It is a minor offense.”

original: ci don gang yang rung ba'i phyir byin na'am zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci don gang yang rung ba'i phyir byin na'am zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: “Is it a downfall for any reason?”

original: sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang dbral ba nyid kyi phyir ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang dbral ba nyid kyi phyir ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “Except for the purpose of removing a view that is a form of evil.”

original: don de'i phyir sbyin pan ma gtogs so //
analyzed: don de'i phyir sbyin pan ma gtogs so //
translated: “Except for that purpose, it is a downfall.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang dbral bar 'dod pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang dbral bar 'dod pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text says that there is no offense for one who wishes to be free from the view of the sinful.

original: ji zhig rjes su @341a * //🔽sgrub na gcer bu la sbyin pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji zhig rjes su @341a * // sgrub na gcer bu la sbyin pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What is the offense if one does not follow?

original: rang gis sbyin na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rang gis sbyin na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The text says, “if one gives oneself.”

original: gal te rang gis sbyin par byed na'o //
analyzed: gal te rang gis sbyin par byed na'o //
translated: If one gives oneself, there is the offense.

original: mi rung ba nyid dag ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rung ba nyid dag ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is unsuitable, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rang dang de la mi rung ba'i bca' ba dang bza' ba dag rang gis sbyin par byed na ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: rang dang de la mi rung ba'i bca' ba dang bza' ba dag rang gis sbyin par byed na ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one gives oneself unsuitable food and drink, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyin du 'jug na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyin du 'jug na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one makes another give, there is also an offense.

original: bca' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba'am gos la sogs pa sbyin par bya ba dag rang gis de la gzhan sbyin du 'jug na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: bca' bar bya ba dang bza' bar bya ba'am gos la sogs pa sbyin par bya ba dag rang gis de la gzhan sbyin du 'jug na yang nyes byas so //
translated: If one makes another give food and drink or clothing, etc., there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'o na sbyin du 'jug pa de la ltung ba med do zhes ma gsungs sam zhe na bden mod kyi /
analyzed: 'o na sbyin du 'jug pa de la ltung ba med do zhes ma gsungs sam zhe na bden mod kyi /
translated: But isn't it said that there is no offense for one who makes another give?

original: de ni dum bur byas nas sbyin par byed dam /🔽gzhan sbyin du 'jud pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni dum bur byas nas sbyin par byed dam / gzhan sbyin du 'jud pa yin gyi /
translated: That is true, but it is said that there is no offense if one makes another give after cutting off a piece of one's own body.

original: 'dir ni rang gis zhal ta byas te sbyin du 'jud na nyes byas su gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni rang gis zhal ta byas te sbyin du 'jud na nyes byas su gsungs pa yin te /
translated: But here, it is said that there is an offense if one makes another give after acting as an intermediary.

original: de bas na bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the distinction,

original: rang gis zhal ta byas pa na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rang gis zhal ta byas pa na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, “if one acts as an intermediary oneself.”

original: rang gis de'i lus sam de dang 'brel bar sbyin du bcug na nyes byas so //
analyzed: rang gis de'i lus sam de dang 'brel bar sbyin du bcug na nyes byas so //
translated: If one makes another give after acting as an intermediary for that person’s body or something connected to it, there is an offense.

original: bgo bsha' byed na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bgo bsha' byed na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one distributes it, there is also an offense.

original: lus sam de dang 'brel ba las gzhan pa'i phyogs su bca' ba dang bza' ba dag bgo bsha' bya ba'i tshul gyis 'jog na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: lus sam de dang 'brel ba las gzhan pa'i phyogs su bca' ba dang bza' ba dag bgo bsha' bya ba'i tshul gyis 'jog na yang nyes byas so //
translated: If one places food and drink in a place other than the body or something connected to it, by the method of distributing it, there is an offense.

original: zhan pa'i blos gdol pa bzhin du gzhan du 'jog na ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: zhan pa'i blos gdol pa bzhin du gzhan du 'jog na ni ltung ba med do //
translated: If one places it elsewhere like a low-caste person with a weak mind, there is no offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las gzhung gcig tu bgo bsha' byas te za na nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las gzhung gcig tu bgo bsha' byas te za na nyes byas so //
translated: Here, the text says that if one divides up the text and eats it together with him, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de nyid dang lhan cig bgo bsha' byed na nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: de nyid dang lhan cig bgo bsha' byed na nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: If one divides it up and eats it together with him, it is a minor offense.

original: gal te na bar gyur na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te na bar gyur na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one is sick, there is no offense.

original: gcer bu la sbyin pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: gcer bu la sbyin pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The offense of giving to a naked ascetic has been explained.🔽The offense of watching an army.

original: // / dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas ci zhig byas na dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: // / dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas ci zhig byas na dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If one asks, “What is the offense of watching an army?”

original: g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag la blta ba'i don nyid kyis so zhes bya ba smras te /🔽g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag la blta ba'i don nyid kyis so zhes bya ba smras te / g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag ces bya ba ni /
translated: then the text says, “By the very purpose of watching an army that is eager for battle.”🔽“An army that is eager for battle”

original: g-yul sprad pa'i phyir chas pa'i dmag la'o //
analyzed: g-yul sprad pa'i phyir chas pa'i dmag la'o //
translated: means an army that has set out to engage in battle.

original: blta ba'i don nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blta ba'i don nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “By the very purpose of watching”

original: blta ba'i dgos pa nyid kyis zhugs pa'i dge slong la kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blta ba'i dgos pa nyid kyis zhugs pa'i dge slong la kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: means that this offense occurs for a monk who has gone there for the very purpose of watching.

original: dge slong bsod snyoms la sogs pa'i don @341b du byung bas dmag la lta ba byed na yang ltung byed do //
analyzed: dge slong bsod snyoms la sogs pa'i don @341b du byung bas dmag la lta ba byed na yang ltung byed do //
translated: If a monk goes to watch an army for any purpose, such as to beg for alms, he commits a minor offense.🔽Is it from any army?

original: ci dmag la blta'o cog las she na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci dmag la blta'o cog las she na de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: rgyal po dang / bcun mo dang / gzhon nu dang / zhang blon dang / khrom gyi ru sna dang / grong rdal gyi mi dang / ljongs kyi mis bkug pa dang / bar chad byung ba'i dbang nyid ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rgyal po dang / bcun mo dang / gzhon nu dang / zhang blon dang / khrom gyi ru sna dang / grong rdal gyi mi dang / ljongs kyi mis bkug pa dang / bar chad byung ba'i dbang nyid ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Except when summoned by the king, queen, prince, minister, army general, city people, or country people, or when there is an obstacle.

original: rgyal po dang / btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang / zhang blon dang / khrom gyi ru sna dang / grong rdal gyi mi dang / ljongs kyi mi dag gi bkug tshig gis bkug pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rgyal po dang / btsun mo dang / gzhon nu dang / zhang blon dang / khrom gyi ru sna dang / grong rdal gyi mi dang / ljongs kyi mi dag gi bkug tshig gis bkug pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: Except when summoned by the king, queen, prince, minister, army general, city people, or country people.

original: tshul khrims sam srog gi bar chad la sogs pa gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig nye bar gyur pa'i dbang gis der mi 'gror mi rung zhing dmag mthong ba yang ma gtogs so //
analyzed: tshul khrims sam srog gi bar chad la sogs pa gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig nye bar gyur pa'i dbang gis der mi 'gror mi rung zhing dmag mthong ba yang ma gtogs so //
translated: If it is necessary to go there due to any obstacle, such as a threat to morality or life, and one sees the army, it is not a transgression.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: gal te rgyal po la sogs pas khyod 'dir shog shig ces spring ba'am yang na tshul khrims dang srog la sogs pa'i bar chad nye bar gyur pa'i dbang gis dge slong dmag la lta bar byed na de'i tshe ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gal te rgyal po la sogs pas khyod 'dir shog shig ces spring ba'am yang na tshul khrims dang srog la sogs pa'i bar chad nye bar gyur pa'i dbang gis dge slong dmag la lta bar byed na de'i tshe ltung ba med do //
translated: If a king or other person invites a monk, saying, “Come here,” or if a monk goes to see an army because of the danger of an obstacle to morality or life, then there is no offense.

original: dge slong ci zhig rjes su bsgrub pa la ltung byed 'dir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong ci zhig rjes su bsgrub pa la ltung byed 'dir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the offense for a monk who sees an army?

original: de'i phyir / 'phags pa'i nyen kor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'phags pa'i nyen kor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said: “If he sees beyond the boundary of the ārya’s vicinity.”

original: gnas gang nas 'phags pa'i gnas de'i nyen kor gang yin pa de'i mtha' de las 'das te /
analyzed: gnas gang nas 'phags pa'i gnas de'i nyen kor gang yin pa de'i mtha' de las 'das te /
translated: The boundary of the ārya’s vicinity is the boundary of the ārya’s dwelling.

original: mthong na mthong ba'i dge slong de la kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong na mthong ba'i dge slong de la kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: If he sees beyond that, then that monk who sees incurs this offense.

original: chos gos kyi nyen kor sngar bstan pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dir yang nyen kor yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos kyi nyen kor sngar bstan pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dir yang nyen kor yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The boundary of the ārya’s vicinity should be understood as the boundary of the ārya’s vicinity that was previously taught.

original: dge slong glang po che'i tshogs lta ba'i phyir 'gro na ji srid du mig gis ma mthong gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong glang po che'i tshogs lta ba'i phyir 'gro na ji srid du mig gis ma mthong gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk goes to see a herd of elephants, he commits an offense of wrong conduct for as long as he can see them with his eyes.

original: mig gis mthong bar gyur na ni ltung byed do //
analyzed: mig gis mthong bar gyur na ni ltung byed do //
translated: If he sees them with his eyes, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: 'dir ni mthong ba tsam la dngos gzhir gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir ni mthong ba tsam la dngos gzhir gsungs so //
translated: Here, the mere seeing is said to be the basis.

original: nyen kor gyi mtha' las ma 'das par dge slong gis bzhin bsgyur ba tsam gyis mthong ba la ni nyes byas su gsungs so //
analyzed: nyen kor gyi mtha' las ma 'das par dge slong gis bzhin bsgyur ba tsam gyis mthong ba la ni nyes byas su gsungs so //
translated: If a monk does not go beyond the border of the vicinity and sees them just by turning his face, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /🔽// / bam po sum cu gcig pa /
analyzed: dmag la lta ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to / // / bam po sum cu gcig pa /
translated: The offense entailing confession called “watching an army” has been explained.🔽What is it to be in the army? What is it to stay there? What is it to stay there for more than two or three nights?

original: ji zhig rjes su sgrub na dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji zhig rjes su sgrub na dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: The offense entailing confession called “staying in the army” is as follows:

original: de dag med par der nyin mtshan gnyis las lhag par 'dug na'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽rgyal @342a * //
analyzed: de dag med par der nyin mtshan gnyis las lhag par 'dug na'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽rgyal @342a * //
translated: if a monk stays in the army for more than two or three nights, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: po la sogs pas bkug pa dang 'jigs pa'i dbang de dag med par g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag der nyin mtshan gnyis las lhag par 'dug na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: po la sogs pas bkug pa dang 'jigs pa'i dbang de dag med par g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag der nyin mtshan gnyis las lhag par 'dug na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: If one stays in battle for more than two days and nights without being summoned by the king or being seized by fear, then one commits this offense.🔽Since the Vinaya mentions the instant of the end of day and night, therefore it is called the instant of the end of two days and nights.

original: 'dul ba las nyin mtshan gyi mtha'i skad cig la tha snyad du bya bar snang bas de'i phyir nyin mtshan gnyis kyi mtha'i skad cig ces bya ba nyin mtshan gsum pa'i skya rengs dang po shar na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dul ba las nyin mtshan gyi mtha'i skad cig la tha snyad du bya bar snang bas de'i phyir nyin mtshan gnyis kyi mtha'i skad cig ces bya ba nyin mtshan gsum pa'i skya rengs dang po shar na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur la /
translated: If one stays in battle for the first instant of the dawn of the third day, one commits the actual offense.

original: de'i mdun rol du ni sbyor ba'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //🔽de phyin chad ni nyi ma re re zhing dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba re rer 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i mdun rol du ni sbyor ba'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro // de phyin chad ni nyi ma re re zhing dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba re rer 'gyur la /
translated: If one stays in battle for the instant prior to that, one commits the preparatory offense.

original: mdun rol du ni sbyor ba'i kha na ma tho ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdun rol du ni sbyor ba'i kha na ma tho ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: From then on, one commits the actual offense each day and the preparatory offense each day prior to that.

original: dgos pa med na snga ma la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgos pa med na snga ma la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there is no need, then one commits the offense from the beginning.

original: rigs pa'i tshul gyis dgos pa med na nyin zhag gsum par 'dug pa'i snga ma nyin zhag gnyis su gnas pa'i mtha'i skad cig la yang nyi ma re re zhing dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba re rer 'gyur la mdun rol du ni sbyor ba'i kha na
analyzed: rigs pa'i tshul gyis dgos pa med na nyin zhag gsum par 'dug pa'i snga ma nyin zhag gnyis su gnas pa'i mtha'i skad cig la yang nyi ma re re zhing dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba re rer 'gyur la mdun rol du ni sbyor ba'i kha na
translated: If there is no purpose for the method of reasoning, then even in the final moment of the two days of the third day, there would be a root downfall every day, and in the future there would be a fault of preparation.🔽

original: ma tho ba re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma tho ba re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no purpose, then even in the first two days of the three day period, there would be a root downfall every day, and in the days before that, there would be a preparatory fault every day.

original: dgos pa med par 'dug pa la ni nyes byas kho nar 'gyur ba ni mthong ba la bkag pa las mngon no //
analyzed: dgos pa med par 'dug pa la ni nyes byas kho nar 'gyur ba ni mthong ba la bkag pa las mngon no //
translated: It is clear that staying without purpose is a fault, since it is prohibited in the scriptures.

original: de bas na dge ba'i rang bzhin du grags pa'i dgos pa med par dmag gi nang du 'gro ba nyams su myong bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dge ba'i rang bzhin du grags pa'i dgos pa med par dmag gi nang du 'gro ba nyams su myong bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, without a purpose that is known to be virtuous, do not go to the army.

original: dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba bshad zin to /🔽// / dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: dmag gi nang na gnas pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba bshad zin to / // / dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: The downfall is explained as “to stay in the army.”

original: dpung gi yan lag rnams ni byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dpung gi yan lag rnams ni byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Having explained the downfall of staying in the army, to explain the downfall of experiencing the army’s activities, it says, “The army’s activities are the very activities of the army.”

original: g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag gi dpung gi yan lag glang po che dang rta dang shing rta dang rkang thang dag ni byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: g-yul la mngon par dga' ba'i dmag gi dpung gi yan lag glang po che dang rta dang shing rta dang rkang thang dag ni byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The four limbs of the army, elephants, horses, chariots, and foot soldiers, are the agents of battle.

original: ci dge slong thams cad la de dag byed pa po nyid yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci dge slong thams cad la de dag byed pa po nyid yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are they agents for all monks?

original: de'i phyir / bar chad kyi dbang gis 'gro ba ma yin pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bar chad kyi dbang gis 'gro ba ma yin pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore he says, “when not going due to an obstruction.”

original: bar chad kyi dbang gis 'gro ba ma yin pa la kha na ma thob 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar chad kyi dbang gis 'gro ba ma yin pa la kha na ma thob 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: This offense occurs when not going due to an obstruction.

original: bar chad yod na ni ltung ba med de bar chad brgyad po dag las bar chad gang yang rung ba nye bar gnas par gyur na nyes pa med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad yod na ni ltung ba med de bar chad brgyad po dag las bar chad gang yang rung ba nye bar gnas par gyur na nyes pa med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is an obstruction, there is no downfall.

original: de yang dpe tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: de yang dpe tsam du zad kyi /
translated: That is merely an example.

original: gnod pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i don du 'gro ba thams cad la yang nyes pa med @342b do //
analyzed: gnod pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i don du 'gro ba thams cad la yang nyes pa med @342b do //
translated: There is no offense for going for the sake of pacifying harm to all beings.

original: bsdus pa dang so so dag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsdus pa dang so so dag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The summary and individual explanations.

original: dpung gi yan lag bsdus pa'am so so ba dag byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dpung gi yan lag bsdus pa'am so so ba dag byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The one who acts is the army when it is combined or when it is distributed.

original: bsdus pa zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: bsdus pa zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The word “combined”

original: rgyal mtshan gyi mchog gam dpung gi mchog ces bya ba bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan gyi mchog gam dpung gi mchog ces bya ba bsdus pa yin te /
translated: means the best of armies or the best of forces.

original: 'dir dpung gi mchog ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir dpung gi mchog ces bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the best of forces

original: dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as the fourfold army.

original: so so zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: so so zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The word “distributed”

original: g-yul bkod cing bshams pa'i dmag la lta na zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: g-yul bkod cing bshams pa'i dmag la lta na zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa yin te /
translated: means when the army is arrayed in battle formation.

original: bshams pa dang bkod pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam grangs kyi tshig yin pas don gcig par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bshams pa dang bkod pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam grangs kyi tshig yin pas don gcig par rig par bya ste /
translated: The words “arrayed” and “formed” are synonymous terms.

original: 'di ltar g-yul bkod pa nyams su myong bar byas na zhes bstan pa de'i rnam par bshad pa bshams pa la lta ba nyams su myong bar byas na zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar g-yul bkod pa nyams su myong bar byas na zhes bstan pa de'i rnam par bshad pa bshams pa la lta ba nyams su myong bar byas na zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, when it is said, “When the army is arrayed in battle formation,” the meaning is that “when the army is formed and arrayed.”

original: g-yul bkod pa zhes bya ba ni bkod pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: g-yul bkod pa zhes bya ba ni bkod pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The array of troops is of four types:

original: 'bru'i kha lta bu dang shing rta'i dbyibs lta bu dang zla gam gyi rnam pa lta bu dang / nam mkha' lding gi 'dab ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'bru'i kha lta bu dang shing rta'i dbyibs lta bu dang zla gam gyi rnam pa lta bu dang / nam mkha' lding gi 'dab ma lta bu'o //
translated: like the mouth of a sack, like the shape of a chariot, like the shape of a half-moon, and like the wings of a garuḍa.

original: bshams pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bshams pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The formation of troops is also of four types:

original: 'bru'i kha lta bu dang / shing rta'i dbyibs lta bu dang / zla gam gyi rnam pa lta bu dang / nam mkha' lding gi 'dab ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'bru'i kha lta bu dang / shing rta'i dbyibs lta bu dang / zla gam gyi rnam pa lta bu dang / nam mkha' lding gi 'dab ma lta bu'o //
translated: like the mouth of a sack, like the shape of a chariot, like the shape of a half-moon, and like the wings of a garuḍa.

original: de la 'bru'i kha lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'bru'i kha lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Among them, “like the mouth of a sack” means

original: mdun du yang ru dngar rgyab tu yang ru dngar la dbus na rgyal po 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: mdun du yang ru dngar rgyab tu yang ru dngar la dbus na rgyal po 'dug pa'o //
translated: that in front there is a large army, in the rear there is also a large army, and in the middle the king is stationed.

original: shing rta'i dbyibs lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shing rta'i dbyibs lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Like the shape of a chariot” means

original: mdun du yang ru dngar ba dang / glor yang ru dngar la rgyab na rgyal po 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: mdun du yang ru dngar ba dang / glor yang ru dngar la rgyab na rgyal po 'dug pa'o //
translated: that in front there is a large army, in the flanks there is also a large army, and in the rear the king is stationed.🔽“Like the shape of a half-moon” means

original: zla gam gyi rnam pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zla gam gyi rnam pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: that

original: mdun du yang du dngar rgyab tu yang ru dngar la dbus na rgyal po 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: mdun du yang du dngar rgyab tu yang ru dngar la dbus na rgyal po 'dug pa'o //
translated: In front and behind, the army is arrayed in rows, with the king in the middle.

original: nam mkha' lding gi 'dab ma lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding gi 'dab ma lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like the wings of a garuḍa

original: glor ru dngar la mdun na rgyal po 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: glor ru dngar la mdun na rgyal po 'dug pa'o //
translated: The army is arrayed in rows in the flanks, with the king in front.

original: dpung gi yan lag ji lta bu dag kha na ma tho ba'i rnam pa ji lta bu'i byed pa po yin zhe na /
analyzed: dpung gi yan lag ji lta bu dag kha na ma tho ba'i rnam pa ji lta bu'i byed pa po yin zhe na /
translated: What are the army's divisions? What is the form of the action of the one who sets it in motion?

original: de'i phyir / sta gon byas pa rnams kyi dngos la dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / sta gon byas pa rnams kyi dngos la dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore he says: The actual basis is for those who are ready.

original: sta gon byas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sta gon byas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those who are ready

original: glang po che la sogs pa go bskon pa dang / shing rta bshams pa dang rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba dang gzhu bdungs pa dang mda' mde'u can bstar ba dang ral gri phyung ba nyid la sogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //🔽de rnams kyi @343a * //
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa go bskon pa dang / shing rta bshams pa dang rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba dang gzhu bdungs pa dang mda' mde'u can bstar ba dang ral gri phyung ba nyid la sogs pa yin par rig par bya'o // de rnams kyi @343a * //
translated: are those who are equipped with elephants, etc., who have arranged their chariots, raised their banners, drawn their bows, set out their arrows and drawn their swords, and so on.🔽The actual basis

original: dngos la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is for those who are ready.

original: de rnams la reg pa dang bshams pa dkrugs pa la sogs pa dngos gzhi'i rgyur gyur pa'i dngos po la'o //
analyzed: de rnams la reg pa dang bshams pa dkrugs pa la sogs pa dngos gzhi'i rgyur gyur pa'i dngos po la'o //
translated: It is in relation to the actual basis, the thing that is the cause of touching, arranging, disturbing, etc.

original: dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term “actual basis” means

original: dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: the actual basis of the offense.

original: sbyor ba de la ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba de la ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the preparation, it is a misdeed.

original: sbyor ba la nyes byas kyi byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba la nyes byas kyi byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: In the preparation, it is a misdeed.

original: glang po che la sogs pa sta gon ma byas pa de la ni dngos dang sbyor ba gnyi ga la yang nyes byas kho na'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa sta gon ma byas pa de la ni dngos dang sbyor ba gnyi ga la yang nyes byas kho na'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: In relation to an elephant, etc. that is not prepared, it is a misdeed in both the preparation and the actual basis.

original: sta gon byas pa rnams kyi dngos la dngos gzhi'o zhes bstan pa'i dngos la zhes bya ba de ji zhig yin par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: sta gon byas pa rnams kyi dngos la dngos gzhi'o zhes bstan pa'i dngos la zhes bya ba de ji zhig yin par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: In the explanation, “In the actual basis of those that are prepared, it is the actual basis,” what is the actual basis?

original: de'i phyir reg pa dang / bshams pa dkrugs pa dang / lta ba'i phyir 'phags shing nyen kor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong ba de lta bu ni dngos dag yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir reg pa dang / bshams pa dkrugs pa dang / lta ba'i phyir 'phags shing nyen kor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong ba de lta bu ni dngos dag yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the actual basis is when one touches, disturbs the array, or sees beyond the boundary of the camp.

original: glang po che la sogs pa sta gon byas pa rnams zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa sta gon byas pa rnams zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “those who are prepared, such as elephants” should be applied to all three.

original: reg pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: reg pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Touching means

original: glang po che la sogs pa sta gon byas pa rnams la reg pa ste dpung gi yan lag la reg pa ni rin po cher smos pa la reg pa'i ltung byed las yul gzhan yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa sta gon byas pa rnams la reg pa ste dpung gi yan lag la reg pa ni rin po cher smos pa la reg pa'i ltung byed las yul gzhan yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: to touch those who are prepared, such as elephants. Touching the limbs of the army is to be understood as a different object from the offense of touching precious substances.

original: bshams pa dkrugs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bshams pa dkrugs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Disturbing the array means

original: glang po che la sogs pa gnas nas bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa gnas nas bskyod pa'o //
translated: to move the elephants and so on from their place.🔽Seeing beyond the boundary of the camp means

original: blta ba'i phyir 'phags shing nyen kor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blta ba'i phyir 'phags shing nyen kor gyi mtha' las 'das te mthong ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: to see beyond the boundary of the camp.

original: dge slong gis dpung gi yan lag blta ba'i phyir gnas nas 'phags shing nyen kor gyi dpung gi mtha' las 'das te dpung gi tshogs yan lag dag mthong ba gang yin pa'o //🔽lta bu ni dngos dag yin no zhes bya ba ni reg pa dang bshams pa dkrugs pa dang blta ba'i phyir 'phags shing nyen kor gyi mtha' las 'das te /
analyzed: dge slong gis dpung gi yan lag blta ba'i phyir gnas nas 'phags shing nyen kor gyi dpung gi mtha' las 'das te dpung gi tshogs yan lag dag mthong ba gang yin pa'o // lta bu ni dngos dag yin no zhes bya ba ni reg pa dang bshams pa dkrugs pa dang blta ba'i phyir 'phags shing nyen kor gyi mtha' las 'das te /
translated: A monk who goes beyond the boundary of the army in order to see the army, and sees the various divisions of the army, is the example.🔽The actual basis is like that.🔽The actual basis is like that, which is the three types of seeing the army: seeing the army in order to touch it, in order to disturb its formation, and in order to see it.

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum po de lta bu nyid ni dngos gzhi'i kha na mtho ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i dngos dag yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum po de lta bu nyid ni dngos gzhi'i kha na mtho ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i dngos dag yin no //
translated: The actual basis is the cause of the root downfall.

original: 'dir gzhung ni kha cig las dge slong gis glang po che go bskon pa'i bshams pa dkrugs na zhes gsungs pa dang kha cig glang po che'i tshogs lta ba'i phyir 'gro ba dang / dge slong gis glang po che go bskon pa la reg na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni kha cig las dge slong gis glang po che go bskon pa'i bshams pa dkrugs na zhes gsungs pa dang kha cig glang po che'i tshogs lta ba'i phyir 'gro ba dang / dge slong gis glang po che go bskon pa la reg na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In this regard, some texts say, “If a monk disturbs the formation of an elephant army,” and some say, “If a monk goes to see an elephant army,” and some say, “If a monk touches an elephant army.”

original: ma chas pa nyid la ni na smad pa nyid do zhes bya ba la ma chas pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma chas pa nyid la ni na smad pa nyid do zhes bya ba la ma chas pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: If one has not set out, then it is a mere offense.

original: g-yul la mngon par dga' ba nyid @343b ma yin pa dang sta gon ma byas pa nyid kyi dpung gi yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: g-yul la mngon par dga' ba nyid @343b ma yin pa dang sta gon ma byas pa nyid kyi dpung gi yan lag rnams so //
translated: Not setting out means not delighting in battle, and the army's limbs are not prepared.

original: na smad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: na smad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Mere offense means

original: dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba las na smad pa nyid de nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽dmag la lta ba dang dmag gi nang na gnas pa dang dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi gsum po dag la dmag g-yul gyi phyir ma chas pa nyid la ni dngos gzhi'i gnas su ni nyes byas la nyes byas kyi
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba las na smad pa nyid de nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // dmag la lta ba dang dmag gi nang na gnas pa dang dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi gsum po dag la dmag g-yul gyi phyir ma chas pa nyid la ni dngos gzhi'i gnas su ni nyes byas la nyes byas kyi
translated: that it is a mere offense, a wrong doing, in comparison to the actual offense.

original: gnas su ni nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas su ni nyes byas phra mor 'gyur ro //
translated: In the three bases of training called observing the army, remaining in the army and experiencing the army's limbs, if one has not set out for battle, then it is a wrong doing in the place of the actual basis and a subtle wrong doing in the place of a wrong doing.

original: glang po che dang rta dang bya gag dang bya la ba ka dang bya brta ka dang / skyes pa dang bud med 'thab pa la sogs pa bya ba dang byed du gzhug pa dang blta bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: glang po che dang rta dang bya gag dang bya la ba ka dang bya brta ka dang / skyes pa dang bud med 'thab pa la sogs pa bya ba dang byed du gzhug pa dang blta bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not engage in or cause others to engage in or watch such activities as elephant fights, horse fights, cock fights, quail fights, or male or female fights.

original: glang po che 'thab pa mi bya byed du mi gzhug blta bar yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: glang po che 'thab pa mi bya byed du mi gzhug blta bar yang mi bya'o //
translated: One should not engage in elephant fights, cause others to engage in them, or watch them.

original: de bzhin du rta dang bya gag dang / bya la ba ka dang / bya brta ka dang skyes pa dang bud med 'thab pa la sogs pa yang mi bya /
analyzed: de bzhin du rta dang bya gag dang / bya la ba ka dang / bya brta ka dang skyes pa dang bud med 'thab pa la sogs pa yang mi bya /
translated: Similarly, one should not engage in horse fights, cock fights, quail fights, or male or female fights, etc.

original: byed du mi gzhug blta bar yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: byed du mi gzhug blta bar yang mi bya'o //
translated: One should not cause others to engage in them or watch them.

original: 'dir dpung gi yan lag tu gyur pa'i glang po che la sogs pa ni mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir dpung gi yan lag tu gyur pa'i glang po che la sogs pa ni mi gzung ngo //
translated: Here, one should not take up elephants, etc., which are limbs of an army.

original: dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: dpung gi yan lag nyams su myong ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The downfall of experiencing an army limb has been explained.

original: // / ji zhig byas na rdeg pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: // / ji zhig byas na rdeg pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What is done that is a downfall of beating?

original: rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid kyis dge slong pha rol la lus sam des 'phangs pa'am de dang 'brel pa dag gang yang rung ba tha na rkang pa'i mthe bong ngam yungs kar ram rtsva dag gis brdegs na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid kyis dge slong pha rol la lus sam des 'phangs pa'am de dang 'brel pa dag gang yang rung ba tha na rkang pa'i mthe bong ngam yungs kar ram rtsva dag gis brdegs na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If the mind is disturbed, then even if a monk strikes another monk with anything, even if it is just a toe, a mustard seed, or a blade of grass, or if he throws it or is related to it, then he commits an offense.🔽

original: sems gang la rnyog pa yod pa de ni rnyog pa can gyi sems so //
analyzed: sems gang la rnyog pa yod pa de ni rnyog pa can gyi sems so //
translated: The mind that is disturbed is the mind that has a disturbance.🔽The thing that is disturbed is that very thing.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de des brdegs na'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro//🔽su la brdegs na zhe na de'i phyir dge slong zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de des brdegs na'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro// su la brdegs na zhe na de'i phyir dge slong zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: By that, one is struck.🔽To whom is one struck?🔽Therefore, it is said, “to a monk.”

original: ji dge slong bdag nyid la brdegs na 'am zhe na de'i phyir pha rol la zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji dge slong bdag nyid la brdegs na 'am zhe na de'i phyir pha rol la zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If one is struck by oneself, then what?🔽Therefore, it is said, “to another.”

original: bdag nyid ma yin pa gzhan la'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ma yin pa gzhan la'o //
translated: Not to oneself, but to another.

original: ji zhig gis brdegs na zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji zhig gis brdegs na zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: By what is one struck?

original: lus sam des 'phangs pa'am de dang 'brel ba dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: lus sam des 'phangs pa'am de dang 'brel ba dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “by the body, or by what is projected by that, or by what is connected with that.”

original: lus kyis zhes bya ba ni lag pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: lus kyis zhes bya ba ni lag pa la sogs pas so //
translated: “With the body” means with the hand, etc.

original: lus kyis 'phangs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus kyis 'phangs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Thrown by the body” means

original: rdo la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rdo la sogs pas so //
translated: with a stone, etc.

original: lus dang 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus dang 'brel ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Connected with the body” means

original: dbyug pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: dbyug pa la sogs pas so //
translated: with a stick, etc.

original: gdon mi za bar snang bar 'gyur bas brdeg pa las kha na ma tho ba @344a * //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar snang bar 'gyur bas brdeg pa las kha na ma tho ba @344a * //
translated: “Without doubt” means that the sin of beating is incurred.

original: 'dir 'gyur bar ma zad de 'di ltar gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba la sogs smras so //🔽tha na rkang pa'i ma the bo'am /
analyzed: 'dir 'gyur bar ma zad de 'di ltar gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba la sogs smras so // tha na rkang pa'i ma the bo'am /
translated: Not only that, but also “if one beats even with something else,” etc.

original: yungs kar ram rtsva dag gis brdegs na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yungs kar ram rtsva dag gis brdegs na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Even with the foot, or with mustard seed or grass.”

original: brdegs par bya ba'i spyad kyi mtha' bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: brdegs par bya ba'i spyad kyi mtha' bstan pa yin te /
translated: This shows the minimum of what is to be beaten.

original: de bas kyang ches chung ba'i dngos pos brdegs na yang ltung ba na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de bas kyang ches chung ba'i dngos pos brdegs na yang ltung ba na smad pa med do //
translated: If one beats with something even smaller than that, there is no sin of beating.

original: gzhan dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni //
translated: “Even with another” means

original: bslab pa'i gzhi 'og ma gzas pa dang / gnas ngan len brdegs pa'i 'og tu gang gi tshe skrangs par slong pha rol la zhes bya ba 'di nyid sbyor bar bya'o //🔽ci brdegs pa'i 'og tu gang gi tshe skrangs par gyur pa de'i tshe na dngos gzhir ram /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi 'og ma gzas pa dang / gnas ngan len brdegs pa'i 'og tu gang gi tshe skrangs par slong pha rol la zhes bya ba 'di nyid sbyor bar bya'o // ci brdegs pa'i 'og tu gang gi tshe skrangs par gyur pa de'i tshe na dngos gzhir ram /
translated: and the basis of training is violated, then this very statement “when the swelling arises” should be applied after the beating and the taking of a bad rebirth.🔽When the swelling arises after the beating, is it the actual basis at that time,

original: 'on te rdeg pa'i tshe 'di nyid na zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te rdeg pa'i tshe 'di nyid na zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: or is it at the time of the beating?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: reg na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: reg na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is when there is contact.

original: lus la sogs pa la reg na reg ma thag pa'i skad cig de nyid la dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa la reg na reg ma thag pa'i skad cig de nyid la dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is contact with the body and so on, it is the actual basis in that very moment of contact.

original: ci brdeg spyad mang po nyid yin na yang ltung byed gcig tu 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci brdeg spyad mang po nyid yin na yang ltung byed gcig tu 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If there are many beatings, is there one offense of wrong conduct?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / brdeg spyad re re la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / brdeg spyad re re la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For each beating.

original: brdeg spyad re re la ltung byed re rer 'gyur te sor mo la sogs pa brdeg spyad ji snyed kyis dge slong la reg par 'gyur ba de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brdeg spyad re re la ltung byed re rer 'gyur te sor mo la sogs pa brdeg spyad ji snyed kyis dge slong la reg par 'gyur ba de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: For each of the means of striking, there is one offense of wrong conduct. There are as many offenses of wrong conduct as there are means of striking, such as fingers, etc., that come into contact with the monk.

original: ma phog na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma phog na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he does not strike, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sor mo la sogs pa brdeg spyad dag gis ma phog na brdeg spyad re re la nyes byas re re'o //🔽brdeg par bya ba gzhan yin la gzhan la brdeg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sor mo la sogs pa brdeg spyad dag gis ma phog na brdeg spyad re re la nyes byas re re'o // brdeg par bya ba gzhan yin la gzhan la brdeg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If he does not strike with the means of striking, such as fingers, etc., there is one offense of wrong conduct for each means of striking.🔽One should not strike one person for the sake of another.

original: brdeg par bya ba gzhan yin la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brdeg par bya ba gzhan yin la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not strike one person for the sake of another means

original: sems brdeg par bya ba yin pa la'o //
analyzed: sems brdeg par bya ba yin pa la'o //
translated: one should not strike the mind for the sake of the body.

original: gzhan la brdeg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan la brdeg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not strike another means

original: rang gi lus la rdeg par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi lus la rdeg par mi bya ba'o //
translated: one should not strike one’s own body.

original: tshig 'di ni sems rnyog pa can nyid kyis rang gi lus la rdeg pa dgag pa'i phyir byas so //
analyzed: tshig 'di ni sems rnyog pa can nyid kyis rang gi lus la rdeg pa dgag pa'i phyir byas so //
translated: This statement is made in order to prevent striking one’s own body out of a disturbed state of mind.

original: 'dir gzhung ni de lta bas na dge slong gis brdeg par bya ba gzhan yin la gzhan la brdeg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de lta bas na dge slong gis brdeg par bya ba gzhan yin la gzhan la brdeg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says, “Therefore, a monk should not strike another, nor should he strike anything else.”

original: ka ba la rdeg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ka ba la rdeg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “He should not strike a pillar”

original: rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid kyis ka ba la brdeg par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid kyis ka ba la brdeg par mi bya'o //
translated: means that he should not strike a pillar with a mind that is disturbed.

original: rtsig pa dang / sa dang / shing ljon pa dang / gzhan la yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtsig pa dang / sa dang / shing ljon pa dang / gzhan la yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Nor a wall, the ground, a tree, or anything else”

original: rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid kyis rtsig pa dang sa dang shing ljon pa dang sgo glegs la sogs pa gzhan la brdeg par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid kyis rtsig pa dang sa dang shing ljon pa dang sgo glegs la sogs pa gzhan la brdeg par mi bya'o //
translated: means that he should not strike a wall, the ground, a tree, a door, or anything else with a mind that is disturbed.

original: @344b shing tog brlag pa'i phyir brdeg pa gang yin pa de ni 'byung ba'i tshogs 'jig pa'i ltung byed kyi khongs su 'dus so //
analyzed: @344b shing tog brlag pa'i phyir brdeg pa gang yin pa de ni 'byung ba'i tshogs 'jig pa'i ltung byed kyi khongs su 'dus so //
translated: Striking a tree in order to destroy its fruit is included in the downfall of destroying a source of water.

original: 'di la bye brag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la bye brag ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference between the two is as follows.

original: dgos pa'i dbang gis shing gcog pa dang sa brdung ba la sogs pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dbang gis shing gcog pa dang sa brdung ba la sogs pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense for cutting down a tree or digging the ground if it is done for a specific purpose.

original: de ltar yang 'dir khungs ni sa ris dge 'dun gyis bsro gang gi shing gshegs pa dang zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir khungs ni sa ris dge 'dun gyis bsro gang gi shing gshegs pa dang zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the source here is the statement, “The firewood for the monk’s warming hut was cut.”

original: brdeg pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: brdeg pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The offense of striking was explained above.

original: // / ji zhig byas na gzas pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / ji zhig byas na gzas pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the offense of threatening?

original: de'i phyir / brdeg par gzas na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / brdeg par gzas na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If one threatens to strike.”

original: 'dir yang rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid kyis dge slong pha rol la lus sam des 'phangs pa'am de dang 'brel ba dag gang yang rung ba tha na rkang pa'i mthe bo'am yungs kar ram rtsva dag gzas na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bsten pa'i gzhung🔽thams cad ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid kyis dge slong pha rol la lus sam des 'phangs pa'am de dang 'brel ba dag gang yang rung ba tha na rkang pa'i mthe bo'am yungs kar ram rtsva dag gzas na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bsten pa'i gzhung thams cad ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: Here, too, the text should be applied as appropriate, just as it was explained above, with the phrase, “If one threatens to strike the body of another monk, or what is projected by him, or what is connected to him, even if it is just the toe, or a mustard seed, or a blade of grass.”

original: de ltar na 'dir tshigs gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir tshigs gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the verse here is as follows.

original: rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid kyis dge slong pha rol la lus la sogs pa dag gang yang rung ba tha na rkang pa'i mthe bo la sogs pa dag gis brdeg par gzas na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnyog pa can gyi sems nyid kyis dge slong pha rol la lus la sogs pa dag gang yang rung ba tha na rkang pa'i mthe bo la sogs pa dag gis brdeg par gzas na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mind is disturbed, then even if it is only the big toe of the monk who is struck, it is a downfall.

original: ji rdzas mang po nyid yin na yang kha na ma tho ba gcig tu 'gyur ram zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji rdzas mang po nyid yin na yang kha na ma tho ba gcig tu 'gyur ram zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If there are many objects, is there only one downfall?🔽For each object,

original: rdzas re re la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rdzas re re la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: there is one offense.

original: sor mo la sogs pa'i rdzas ji snyed gzas pa de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sor mo la sogs pa'i rdzas ji snyed gzas pa de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: There is one offense of wrongdoing for each object, such as a finger, that is struck.

original: sbyor ba la ni de snyed kyi nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba la ni de snyed kyi nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: There is one offense of wrong conduct for each object that is threatened.

original: gzas pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: gzas pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The offense of the threat has been explained.

original: // / ji zhig byas na gnas ngan len 'chab pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: // / ji zhig byas na gnas ngan len 'chab pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What is the offense of concealing a downfall?

original: pham par 'gyur ba dang dge 'dun lhag ma dag bcabs na'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba dang dge 'dun lhag ma dag bcabs na'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: If one conceals a root downfall or a serious violation.

original: dge slong gzhan gyi pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma'i gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa shes bzhin du 'chab na ltung byed do //
analyzed: dge slong gzhan gyi pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma'i gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa shes bzhin du 'chab na ltung byed do //
translated: If a monk knowingly conceals the downfall of another monk that is a basis of defeat or a downfall that is a serious violation, he commits an offense.

original: ci bcabs pa rnam pa thams cad la'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci bcabs pa rnam pa thams cad la'am zhe na /
translated: Is concealment an offense in all cases?

original: de'i phyir bde ba la mi reg pa dang dge slong gi tshul dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad dang dge 'dun 'khrug tu dogs pa'i dbang nyid ma gtogs par 'chab na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba la mi reg pa dang dge slong gi tshul dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad dang dge 'dun 'khrug tu dogs pa'i dbang nyid ma gtogs par 'chab na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the text says, “Except when there is a reason, such as not wanting to cause the other person to feel unhappy, or if it would create an obstacle to the monk’s way of life or pure conduct, or if it would cause a schism in the community.”

original: dbang nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni bde ba la mi reg pa la sogs pa thams cad spyar bar bya'o //🔽bar chad ces bya ba'i sgra ni dge sbyong gi tshul @345a * //
analyzed: dbang nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni bde ba la mi reg pa la sogs pa thams cad spyar bar bya'o // bar chad ces bya ba'i sgra ni dge sbyong gi tshul @345a * //
translated: The word “reason” should be applied to all the cases, such as not wanting to cause the other person to feel unhappy.

original: dang tshangs par spyod pa gnyis dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dang tshangs par spyod pa gnyis dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word “obstacle” should be applied to both the way of life of a spiritual practitioner and pure conduct.

original: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the text is as follows.

original: bde ba la mi reg pa'i dbang nyid dang / dge sbyong gi tshul gyis bar chad kyi dbang nyid dang / tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad kyi dbang nyid dang / dge 'dun 'khrug tu dogs pa'i dbang nyid ma gtogs par gzhan gyis pham par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: bde ba la mi reg pa'i dbang nyid dang / dge sbyong gi tshul gyis bar chad kyi dbang nyid dang / tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad kyi dbang nyid dang / dge 'dun 'khrug tu dogs pa'i dbang nyid ma gtogs par gzhan gyis pham par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: except for the power of not touching bliss, the power of obstacles through the way of training, the power of obstacles to pure conduct, and the power of fear of a schism in the Sangha.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma dag 'chab na ltung byed do //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma dag 'chab na ltung byed do //
translated: If he conceals a defeat or a serious violation by another, it is a downfall.

original: dge slong gi tshul zhes bya ba ni 'di 'phags pa'i lam yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi tshul zhes bya ba ni 'di 'phags pa'i lam yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The term “way of a monk” should be understood as the noble path.

original: bye brag gzhan yang bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang bcas pa dang mtshan mthun pa dang lta ba mthun pa dang mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa yin la nyin mtshan gyi mtha'i bar du 'chab na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba la sogs par bye brag tu byas te de
analyzed: bye brag gzhan yang bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang bcas pa dang mtshan mthun pa dang lta ba mthun pa dang mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa yin la nyin mtshan gyi mtha'i bar du 'chab na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba la sogs par bye brag tu byas te de
translated: There are other distinctions, such as that if he conceals a defeat or a serious violation for a day and night, it is a root downfall, and so forth.

original: ni gang zag gi gzhi kho na dang bcas pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ni gang zag gi gzhi kho na dang bcas pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: These distinctions should be understood from the text itself.

original: dus gang gi tshe bcabs na zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe bcabs na zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore it is said,

original: nyin mtshan gyi mthar ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nyin mtshan gyi mthar ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: at the end of the day and night.

original: skya rengs 'char ka tshun chad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skya rengs 'char ka tshun chad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means until the break of dawn.

original: snga rol du ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snga rol du ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Prior to that, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nyin mtshan gyi mtha'i snga rol du ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: nyin mtshan gyi mtha'i snga rol du ni nyes byas so //
translated: Prior to the end of the day and night, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ltung ba gzhan yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ltung ba gzhan yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is also another downfall.

original: pham par 'gyur ba dang dge 'dun lhag ma dag las gzhan pa'i ltung byed bcabs na ni nyin mtshan gyi mthar yang nyes byas la snga rol du yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba dang dge 'dun lhag ma dag las gzhan pa'i ltung byed bcabs na ni nyin mtshan gyi mthar yang nyes byas la snga rol du yang nyes byas so //
translated: If one conceals a downfall other than a defeating offense or a partially defeating offense, it is an offense of wrong conduct at the end of the day and night, and also prior to that.

original: gnas ngan len 'chab pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: gnas ngan len 'chab pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The downfall of concealing evil deeds has been explained.

original: // / ji zhig byas na zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: // / ji zhig byas na zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What is the downfall of making someone stop eating?🔽Therefore it is said,

original: nad kyi gnyen po'i don nyid ma gtogs par ched du bsams te /
analyzed: nad kyi gnyen po'i don nyid ma gtogs par ched du bsams te /
translated: with the exception of the case of a remedy for an illness, if one intentionally🔽makes someone stop eating,

original: sbyin pa po khyim pa'i zan gcod du bcug na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sbyin pa po khyim pa'i zan gcod du bcug na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “If you make a layperson stop giving food to a donor.”

original: zan gang gi sbyin pa po khyim pa yin na de ni sbyin pa po'i khyim pa'i zan te /🔽nad kyi gnyen po'i don nyid ma gtogs par dge slong gis ched du bsams te /
analyzed: zan gang gi sbyin pa po khyim pa yin na de ni sbyin pa po'i khyim pa'i zan te / nad kyi gnyen po'i don nyid ma gtogs par dge slong gis ched du bsams te /
translated: The food of a layperson who is a donor is the food of a donor layperson.

original: dge slong pha rol gyi sbyin pa po khyim pa'i zan gcod du bcug na ltung byed do //
analyzed: dge slong pha rol gyi sbyin pa po khyim pa'i zan gcod du bcug na ltung byed do //
translated: If a monk intentionally makes a layperson stop giving food to a donor monk,

original: de yang tshig gis bsgo ste zan gcod du bcug na ltung byed do //
analyzed: de yang tshig gis bsgo ste zan gcod du bcug na ltung byed do //
translated: except as a remedy for an illness, he commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If the monk makes the layperson stop giving food by speaking, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: spring yig dang lag yig dang lag rtsis dang mngags pa dang / brgyud pa dang zur gyis gcod du bcug na ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: spring yig dang lag yig dang lag rtsis dang mngags pa dang / brgyud pa dang zur gyis gcod du bcug na ni nyes byas so //
translated: If he makes the layperson stop giving by means of a written message, a sign, a drawing, or an intermediary, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽In this case, the text of some reciters reads:

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las mu stegs can gyi khyim dag tu gcod du bcug na nyes byas so zhes @345b gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las mu stegs can gyi khyim dag tu gcod du bcug na nyes byas so zhes @345b gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “If he makes a non-Buddhist stop giving, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: zan gcod du 'jug pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The second training rule is finished.

original: // / me la reg pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: // / me la reg pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: The offense of touching fire is stated.

original: 'dir de dang 'dra ba la reg pa yang dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir de dang 'dra ba la reg pa yang dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, touching something similar to that is also prohibited.

original: seng ge la reg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: seng ge la reg par mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: One should not touch a lion.

original: seng ge ni me dang 'dra bar bsnyen par dka' zhing bzod par dka' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: seng ge ni me dang 'dra bar bsnyen par dka' zhing bzod par dka' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a lion is difficult to approach and difficult to bear, like fire.

original: dus byin gyis brlab pa sngar byas te /
analyzed: dus byin gyis brlab pa sngar byas te /
translated: The time has been blessed.🔽One should touch fire.

original: me la reg par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de'i phyir dang por dus byin gyis brlab pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir ston pa dang chos dang dge 'dun dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba'i don nyid dang lhung bzed dang tshon
analyzed: me la reg par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de'i phyir dang por dus byin gyis brlab pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir ston pa dang chos dang dge 'dun dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba'i don nyid dang lhung bzed dang tshon
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate the form of blessing the time, it is said that the purpose of the Dharma activity of the Teacher, the Dharma, the Saṅgha, and fellow practitioners is the bowl and the colored powder.

original: gyi las la brtag pa ni dus byin gyis brlab pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gyi las la brtag pa ni dus byin gyis brlab pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The examination of the colored powder is the blessing of the time.

original: ston pa dang chos dang dge 'dun dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba mar me dang bdug spos gsol ba la sogs pa gang yin pa'i dgos pa de'i don yin te /
analyzed: ston pa dang chos dang dge 'dun dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi chos dang ldan pa'i bya ba mar me dang bdug spos gsol ba la sogs pa gang yin pa'i dgos pa de'i don yin te /
translated: The purpose is the purpose of the activity of the Teacher, the Dharma, the Saṅgha, and the spiritual companions, which is to offer lamps and incense and so on.
